name: Eric Lefkofsky
title: Founder and CEO at Tempus, Inc.
about:
Eric Lefkofsky is the founder and CEO at Tempus, a leader in artificial intelligence and precision medicine. He is the co-founder and General Partner of Lightbank, a private venture capital firm specializing in investments in technology companies. He is also the co-founder of Pathos AI, a clinical stage biotechnology company focused on re-engineering drug development; Groupon (NASDAQ: GRPN), a global e-commerce marketplace; Mediaocean, a leading provider of integrated media procurement technology; Echo Global Logistics (NASDAQ: ECHO), a technology-enabled transportation and logistics outsourcing firm; and InnerWorkings (NASDAQ: INWK), a global provider of managed print and promotional solutions.

He co-chairs the Lefkofsky Family Foundation with his wife Liz to advance high-impact initiatives that enhance lives in the communities served. Lefkofsky also serves on the board of directors of Northwestern Medicine. He holds a bachelor’s degree from the University of Michigan and a J.D. from the University of Michigan Law School.Specialties: Turning conventional businesses into e-enabled businesses with technology serving as a catalyst to revolutionize the conventional business process.
 
http://www.lefkofsky.com

name: Márcio Colunas
title: Founder and CSO at Sword Health
about:
Born in Chaves, Portugal, Márcio Colunas traces his passion for technology back to when he was just nine years old, as his elementary school got its first computer. During that time, he and his classmates explored all that early computing offered, including computer games and those iconic floppy disks of the '90s. This sparked his curiosity and led him to envision a career in programming—creating games that had to be as enjoyable to build as they were to play.

He pursued his studies in Computer and Telematics Engineering at the University of Aveiro, where his desire to improve lives through technology led him to co-found Sword Health, alongside Virgílio Bento. Together, they developed an AI-powered digital therapist to revolutionize musculoskeletal care, making world-class care accessible anytime, anywhere.

Initially focused on physical pain, Sword Health expanded into pelvic health and has since evolved into a comprehensive platform of solutions. With over 35 patents filed, more than $300 million raised from leading venture capital firms—including Khosla Ventures and General Catalyst— and a valuation of over $3 billion, Sword was recognized as one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S. by Inc. magazine in 2023 and awarded top spot on Fast Company’s 2024 World Changing Ideas list. 

Today, Márcio serves as the Chief Scientific Officer at Sword, leading the Research & Systems, Information Security, and Operations teams. Eager for knowledge, passionate about innovation, and a strong advocate for teamwork, he is known for his ability to simplify complex engineering challenges and think outside the box. As Márcio often says, "Without curiosity, there is no innovation."
education_1_degree: Master in Computers and Telematics Engineering, Computer Science
notable_achievements: Co-founded Sword Health, a company pioneering digital physical therapy using AI and wearable sensors; Developed Stroke Wearable Operative Rehabilitation Device (S.W.O.R.D) technology during university; Led technology development for Sword Health's digital therapy platform
reasoning: Márcio Colunas demonstrates clear achievements as a growth-stage entrepreneur who has successfully scaled Sword Health to significant valuations and funding levels. As co-founder and CSO, he has helped build a company valued at over $3B, raised substantial venture funding, and developed significant intellectual property. While he hasn't yet achieved a major exit or founded multiple successful companies (which would qualify for L6+), his track record at Sword Health shows proven ability to scale a technology company to unicorn status. The combination of technical innovation (35+ patents), substantial funding ($300M+), and current valuation ($3B+) firmly places him in the L5 category as a growth-stage entrepreneur positioned for potential major exit.

name: Virgílio Bento
title: Founder + CEO + Janitor at Sword // // Building Artificial Intelligence to Heal the world.
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Short version:

V is the founder and CEO of Sword Health, the leading company behind the world's first AI Healer that makes world-class care available anytime, anywhere, to anyone, while significantly reducing costs for healthcare organizations. Phoenix, Sword's AI Healer, has already treated more than 500,000 patients across three continents and delivered 6.5 million AI sessions across physical pain, women's health, and mental health, helping Sword's clients avoid nearly $1 billion in unnecessary healthcare costs.

Long version:

The vision behind Sword’s AI Healer started from an early age when V witnessed firsthand the vast gap between what society needs from our healthcare system and what our healthcare system is able to deliver based on traditional models. This observation sparked a determination to drive meaningful change in the field.

He understood that healthcare’s future depended on delivering a superior patient experience, value, and outcomes through thoughtfully designed technology. V identified AI’s transformative potential to fundamentally reshape care delivery, shifting from traditional human-centered models to AI-augmented systems.

During his PhD in Electrical Engineering, V established the theoretical groundwork for this vision—a future where AI Healers amplify human clinicians’ capabilities, making quality healthcare universally accessible.

After completing his doctorate, he founded Sword Health to realize his vision for a world where Sword's AI Healers are ever-present in our lives, ensuring we recover fully and quickly from conditions that affect our ability to live life to the fullest and making high-quality care as accessible as running water for everyone in the world.

Since 2020, Phoenix, Sword's AI Healer, has already treated more than 500,000 patients across three continents and delivered 6.5 million AI sessions across physical pain, women's health, and mental health, helping Sword's clients avoid nearly $1 billion in unnecessary healthcare costs.

This extraordinary impact is built upon a foundation of rigorous scientific research and innovation. V holds 40 patents and has authored over 40 peer-reviewed publications. His research spans sensor fusion algorithms, artificial intelligence, and neuroplasticity knowledge spaces, with work featured in leading scientific journals worldwide

Guided by bold vision and meticulous execution, V continues pursuing his mission to free the world from pain, with technology and human excellence as his primary allies.

notable_achievements: Led Sword Health to $3 billion valuation; Developed AI-driven digital physical therapy platform; Expanded Sword Health internationally with offices in US, Ireland, and Portugal

The combination of technical innovation, market impact, and scale achievements strongly supports this classification.

name: Chris Fernandez
title: Executive Chairman & Chief Research Officer at EnsoData
about:
My name is Chris Fernandez, and I'm Co-founder, Executive Chairman, & Chief Research Office at EnsoData. I work at the confluence of applied artificial intelligence and machine learning, distributed and parallelized cloud computing, and Terabyte to Petabyte scale data to design and clinically validate Waveform AI. 

The Waveform AI engine we've built contributes to increasing patient access, improving patient outcomes, enhancing the patient and provider care experience, addressing the affordability of healthcare, and advancing the state our of scientific knowledge and research methods for studying health and disease.

Our first product, EnsoSleep, aids clinicians in diagnosing sleep apnea by automating analysis of home and in-clinic sleep studies, providing a simplified, streamlined, interoperable diagnostic workflow in the cloud. EnsoSleep is an FDA 510(k) cleared, MDSAP Certified, ISO 13485 Certified, Health Canada approved, Colombia INVIMA approved, HIPAA compliant, HITRUST certified, and SOC2 audited AI platform. We’ve got several new apps in the works, and we’re expanding to improve access and affordability for patients globally.

Alumni of: Forbes 30 Under 30 in Healthcare (‘21), Inc. Best Places to Work (‘21, ‘22, & ‘23), InBusiness 40 Under 40 (‘21), Dreamit HealthTech (‘19), Healthbox Studio (‘17), Y Combinator Fellowship (‘15), Gener8tor gBETA (‘15), UWSMPH Honorary Associate (‘16), UW Iron Cross Society (‘16), WID AI and ML Optimization Lab (‘15), NIMH Conte Research Fellowship (‘14), UW MS BME (‘15), UW BS BME (‘14), 40+ peer-reviewed Sleep AI and Healthcare AI clinical and scientific research publications. More coming soon!
experience_2_company: Nowak Lab - Wisconsin Institue for Discovery AI & ML Optimization Lab
speaking_engagements: Guest on AI and the Future of Work podcast (2023); Featured on AI in Action podcast (2024)
notable_achievements: Co-founder and CEO of EnsoData, a startup applying AI to medical waveform data; Recipient of the 'In the Arena' Award for outstanding entrepreneurship from Hogan Entrepreneurial Program

name: Justin Mortara, Ph.D.
title: CEO | Physicist | Investor | Dreaming no small dreams!
about:
Dr. Justin Mortara is a physicist, proven executive leader and healthcare innovator.   For over 20 years he dedicated his career to Mortara Instrument, a leading provider of diagnostics for cardiovascular disease. During his tenure, Justin led the company to over 10x growth and market leadership, culminating in its acquisition in 2017 by Hillrom (Baxter).

Today he is President and CEO of EnsoData, the leading waveform AI company enabling diagnosis of sleep disorders and co-founder of Rose Biosciences, a tech-focused bio startup addressing the world’s biggest health problems.  

Justin also directs a portfolio of early stage investments through Mortara Group, advises and serves on various for profit and not for profit boards and never tires of learning new things.  He holds a Ph.D. in Physics from the University of California at Berkeley and a B.A. in Physics from the University of Chicago.

name: shuhao wen
title: Founder, XtalPI Inc
about:
XtalPi is a pharmaceutical technology company that is reinventing the industry’s approach to drug research and development with its Intelligent Digital Drug Discovery and Development (ID4) platform. With tightly interwoven quantum physics, artificial intelligence, and high-performance cloud computing algorithms, XtalPi’s ID4 platform provides accurate predictions on the physiochemical and pharmaceutical properties of small-molecule candidates for drug design, solid-form selection, and other critical aspects of drug development. XtalPi is dedicated to improving the efficiency, accuracy, and success rate of drug research and development, and contributing to a healthier society worldwide.
 

Founded in 2014 by a group of quantum physicists at MIT, XtalPi has since built an elite team with multi-disciplinary expertise in physics, chemistry, pharmaceutical R&D, and algorithm design. XtalPi’s cutting-edge technologies, innovative solutions, and diverse applications across the pharmaceutical value chain have helped it gain industry approval and establish strategic partnerships with top international pharmaceutical companies.
education_2_school: Dalian Institute of Chemical Physics, Chinese Academy of Sciences
education_2_degree: Doctor of Philosophy (PhD), Physical Chemistry (organic semiconductor and Hydrogen storage materials simulation)
speaking_engagements: Panelist at Fortune Innovation Forum on Unlocking Asia's AI Potential
notable_achievements: Named one of Fortune’s 40 Business Elites Under 40 in China (2020); Received Shenzhen Patent Award (2021); Top Ten Outstanding Young Entrepreneurs in Shenzhen (2023); Led XtalPi to be first company listed under HKEX Chapter 18C rules for specialized technology firms (2024)
reasoning: Shuhao Wen has demonstrated significant success as a founder of XtalPi, which has grown into a major AI/quantum computing pharmaceutical technology company. title: Co-founder & CEO at Lily AI | Bridging the gap between merchant-speak, consumer-speak and machine-speak | Ad Age Leading Women 2024
about:
As CEO and Co-founder of Lily AI, I’m proud to be part of the leading AI-powered Product Content Optimization platform that bridges the gap between consumers, merchants, marketers, and machines. At Lily AI, we are transforming advertising and eCommerce by converting nuanced consumer language into precise product understanding, helping consumers navigate millions of products to find the perfect item for their unique context. Leveraging a suite of AI, fueled by high-quality, human-verified proprietary data, we structure and optimize product content, enabling retailers and brands to understand complex search behaviors and improve product content, from consumer-facing content such as attributes, titles, copy and highlights to back-end data like metadata and schema markups. The result: improved paid ad performance, enhanced organic search visibility, greater operational efficiency, and increased sales.

At Lily AI, we’re passionate about making shopping more human and intuitive, empowering retailers and brands to deliver exceptional, customer-centric experiences across every digital touchpoint. I formed my love of retail when I began my career with Saatchi and Saatchi and was assigned to P&G where I witnessed the emotional strength of the connection people had to their preferred products. Inspired by consumer innovation, I joined Eko, a branchless banking and mobile payments platform serving the unbanked and funded by Gates Foundation. Prior to Lily, I was with UNICEF Ventures’ Innovation Fund, investing in life-saving apps and technologies. 

I am proud to be an immigrant founder who has been on 6 visas in the last 4 years to live my American dream. I am also a Tory Burch Fellow(2019) and hold an MBA from Indian School of Business and Bachelor’s in Economics from Shri Ram College of Commerce (India).

name: Eran Shir
title: Co Founder, CPO & Chairman at Nexar Inc.
about:
I am a serial entrepreneur and investor, currently trying to change the world for the better at Nexar.  Previously, I've been Entrepreneur In Residence at Aleph, a VC out of Tel Aviv where I've been focusing on fields like Internet of Things, big-data, crypto currencies, marketplaces and networks, and the way they disrupt important markets like healthcare, transportation, education, manufacturing, and finance. Before Aleph I ran the global Creative Innovation Center for Yahoo!, where I was responsible for Yahoo!'s ad creative technologies strategy and portfolio, as well as the development of its next generation ad creative personalization platform. I joined Yahoo! in Oct. 2010 when Yahoo! acquired Dapper, a dynamic ads and semantic web startup I co-founded in 2007.

In my past, I was a physicist, focusing primarily on complex systems and complex networks, and an Internet researcher, founder of the DIMES Internet research project, and Cogniview, a machine learning startup.

I am passionate about building great products, teams, and companies which aim to change people's life for the better.

Expertise and interests: Internet of Things, crypto-currencies, machine learning and big data, semantic web, complex networks, Web & mobile services, personalization and search engines, digital marketing.

name: Zach Greenberger
title: CEO @ Nexar | Formerly Lyft, Tesla & IBM | Driving cutting edge innovations in Vision AI for the physical world
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
As CEO of Nexar, I have a front-row seat to change. 

At Nexar, success isn’t defined by just being a leader in the AV category. We’re more than that. Our disruptive technology is changing how we see and experience the world, and bridging the gap between the digital and physical. 

We’re creating new ways of experiencing life by making useful AI for the physical world. 

Nexar is transforming mobility as we know it, from comprehensive datasets drawn from 200 million miles driven monthly, to HD maps of 98% of the main US highways, to creating adaptive prediction models and driving simulations so real you'll scan your blind spots. 

Before joining Nexar, I was fortunate to learn from industry leaders at Lyft and Tesla, where I focused on driving growth through strategic partnerships, and building new business segments. 

At those companies, I saw what AVs’ future could mean for the world. I've never been more certain that Nexar is going to be a huge part of it. 

Our platform and partnerships — including 1M+ dash cams with real-time data — transform data into actionable insights, improving AVs and making the roads safer for all.

All roads lead forward. And we’re driving the change, at Nexar.

For nine years, I have been on a specific mission to help people face and navigate fear, adversity, and uncertainty. As the founder of Brave Enterprises, I lead a team of experts who design and deliver evidence-based programs to help individuals and organizations build a brave mindset and practice facing their fears.

I am obsessed with helping people self-motivate, self-honest, and self-empowered.

My specialty skill is designing smart, transformational sessions that guide people to momentary and sustained transformation.

name: Arturo Loaiza-Bonilla
title: Co-Founder, Massive Bio | Chief of Hematology and Oncology, SLUHN | WebMD Medscape Columnist | AI in Oncology | 40 under 40 in Cancer | OpenAI Forum | HealthTech |
about:
Dr. Arturo Loaiza-Bonilla, MD, MSEd, is the Co-Founder and Chief Medical Officer at Massive Bio, a global industry leader in connecting patients to clinical trials using artificial intelligence. An internationally renowned medical oncologist and researcher, Dr. Bonilla has a distinguished academic and clinical career in AI applications in healthcare, precision medicine oncology, immunotherapy, clinical trial design, digital health, entrepreneurship, and patient advocacy.  Dr. Loaiza-Bonilla is board certified in both medical oncology and hematology and has extensive experience in the diagnosis and treatment of genomic biomarker-driven cancers and serves as the Systemwide Chief of Hematology and Oncology at St. Luke's University Health Network,  leading a dynamic oncology team spanning 15 hospitals across 11 counties in Pennsylvania and New Jersey, all part of a nationally recognized healthcare system.
 
Before joining St. Luke's, Dr. Loaiza-Bonilla was enterprise Chair of Research at Capital Health, and served as vice chairman of the Department of Medical Oncology at Cancer Treatment Centers of America in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, as well as enterprise director of research, where he provided leadership and expertise to their oncology trial portfolio across 5 cancer centers and over 70 NCTN and industry-sponsored clinical trials. His research has been extensively published in the most prominent journals and meetings in oncology, and he has been recipient of NIH funding to advance digital health and artificial intelligence tools for cancer research. He was also Faculty at the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine; Drexel University College of Medicine, and currently as Associate Professor at Lewis Katz School of Medicine at Temple University in Philadelphia.

Throughout his stellar career, Dr. Loaiza-Bonilla has held numerous leadership positions such as President of the Pennsylvania Society of Oncology and Hematology and President of Global Alliance for Patient Access, ASCO Committee member, CancerX - Moonshot founding member, and editorial board of several oncology journals. In 2018, he was recognized as Philadelphia Business Journal’s Forty Under 40, in 2019 he was bestowed the Influencers of Healthcare Award – Outstanding Healthcare Provider award by the Philadelphia Inquirer, and in 2021 he was chosen as recipient of '40 under 40 in Cancer' accolade. He has also been selected in Castle Connolly's and Philadelphia Magazine's Top Doctors listing since 2018, and writes a monthly globally syndicated column for WebMD/Medscape on 'Practical AI'.

name: Selin Kurnaz, PhD
title: Co-Founder and CEO at Massive Bio
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I am a 1X founder, hard-core engineer, non status quo business woman, deal-maker, immigrant and the child of the best parents in the universe who happen to be a journalist and an engineer.  

I founded Massive Bio after a family situation in cancer because I am obsessed with enabling access to clinical trials to cancer patients around the globe regardless of their location and/or financial stability. I am also obsessed with "making things work" regardless of how difficult it is or even if I am the only person in the universe that believes in it. Lastly, I am obsessed with delighting our pharmaceutical and CRO customers as I understand the value of gaining and retaining customers. 

Prior to Massive Bio, I was at the founding team of EY's Private Equity Value Creation where I helped private equity companies in investment decisions in healthcare and how to maximize their return from their portfolio companies in their investment life-cycle. I have been a part of hundreds of deals. I spent 10 years in management consulting firms. 

In my career, I have always combined strategy, operations and transactions but laser-focused on a specific industry. Revenue generation, profitability and capital efficiency are my objective functions in building businesses. I enable hyper growth but a smart one, not a dumb one where 95% of the digital health companies target.   

Though I am hugely in love to Massive Bio and be with it until I die, I don't see myself slowing down and I will continue to found new companies. I just don't want to build a company and I want to build an industry.  

Outside healthcare, I am interested in energy and transportation industries. I am deeply inquisitive about the intersection of mathematics and technology.  

Prior to business, I finished half a dozen engineering degrees (2 BS+2 MS+PhD), mostly from University of Michigan, and I have even done a quick stint at majoring Math. 

Nothing in life has presented to me and thus I always have to work very hard and show extreme perseverance to achieve my dreams. 

I am an amateur spinner and a dancer, I don't climb mountains, I don't surf and I don't even have a dog, not even one!

name: Isaac Castro

about:
Isaac Castro is Co-CEO and Co-Founder of Emerge, a consumer technology company building a multi-sensory communication platform to bridge distance and time—through touch, sight, sound, and brain activity, powered by emotion AI, to allow users to digitize and transmit their emotions. Emerge has been named as Technology Pioneer 2022 and included in the Top 10 Emerging Technologies of 2023 by the World Economic Forum.

Isaac was recognized as Innovator Under 35 by MIT Technology Review for the invention of a medical device for more effective cancer treatment. As a World Economic Forum's Global Shaper, Isaac actively worked on inspiring youth and fostering peace and reconciliation in Colombia, work for which he was invited to participate and speak at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting in Davos. 

Isaac is an advocate for human connection, mental health, and sustainable access to technology. Isaac’s work has been endorsed and featured by institutions such as the World Economic Forum, MIT, European Parliament, Institut Choiseul for International Politics and Geoeconomics, Fast Company, and in media and publications worldwide. Isaac holds a master's degree in telecommunications engineering, and he is a graduate of Google-sponsored Singularity University at NASA Research Park in Silicon Valley.

location: Marina del Rey, California, United States
about:
Mauricio is an Ecuadorian entrepreneur working at the intersection of hardware, AI, and spatial computing to transform the ways we connect, communicate, and interact with others from a distance. 

Co-founder of Emerge, a consumer technology company building a multi-sensory communication platform - through touch, sight, sound, and brain activity, powered by emotion AI. We hope to make communication across distance feel like we’re there, or they’re here.

With 20 years of company-building experience, his trajectory started with bottom-of-the-pyramid markets, helping open access to credit to the Ecuador’s poorest communities. He later shifted focus towards emerging technologies and startups- launching a medical device business, supporting the nation’s nascent startup ecosystem, and driving innovation initiatives with some of Ecuador’s largest companies. Winner of Ecuador’s Global Impact Competition in 2015, he joined a Google X and NASA sponsored program in Silicon Valley before moving to LA with his wife and kid.

Personal interests include adventure sports, a deep passion for music, and contributing to a future anchored in science, reason, and justice.

name: Sendur Sellakumar
title: Chief Executive Officer
about:
Sendur has been in the technology and investment banking industries for the last 25 years. Substantially all of Sendur's experience has been focused on enterprise software and cloud services.  Sendur started his career in technology as a software developer working in C/C++/Java environments across client-server and web service architectures.  He worked in large cap technology firms as well as startups. 

Sendur worked for Morgan Stanley as an investment banker covering the software sector. Sendur advised C-level executives and senior management on IPOs, capital structure, and mergers and acquisitions. He has led the execution of several technology IPOs, including Fortinet, Tesla, Avago, Responsys, InvenSense, AVG and Splunk. He has worked on several software and technology M&A transactions, representing over $15 billion in aggregate value.

Sendur spent nearly 9 years transforming Splunk from a licensed software business to a Cloud company. Over the initial four years, he built from the ground-up the Corporate Development, Pricing and Competitive Intelligence teams.  Over the subsequent 4 years, Sendur has been the tip of the spear on shifting Splunk to a cloud business. As CPO, Sendur was responsible for converting the Splunk portfolio to a set of cloud-native services.  Sendur was responsible for all product management and delivery of Splunk's products and services.  This included managing the gross margin from the business.  During his tenure, Splunk Cloud: (1) Grew from sub-$100M ARR to over a billion in ARR (2) Gross margin improved by >60% and (3) Customer NPS improved by 40 points.

Sendur is currently CEO at Dremio, an enterprise data analytics company.

Artemis's mission is to enable anyone to be a world-class investor.

name: Daniela Braga
title: Founder and CEO at Defined.ai | Generative AI | World Economic Forum
location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
about:
As the founder and CEO of Defined.ai, the largest marketplace for training data for AI, I have been leading one of the fastest-growing startups in the AI space for over seven years. 

With a hybrid background as a linguist and an engineer, and more than 20 years of experience in AI, I have a unique perspective and expertise in multiple fields, such as Generative AI, Responsible AI, Foundation Models, Speech Technologies, Natural Language Processing, Large Language Models, Automatic Speech Recognition, and Machine Learning.​

My mission is to build fair, accessible, inclusive, and ethical AI of the future, with the help of a community of AI professionals who share this vision. 

I am also passionate about technology that changes the world, and always seek the next challenge, stepping out of my comfort zone. As a world citizen, born and raised in Portugal, but lived in Spain, China, and the US, I have a global mindset and a curiosity for different cultures and perspectives. 

I am honored to be appointed to the National AI Research Resource Task Force, advising the US president on the AI strategy, and to be recognized by several awards and organizations, such as E&Y, Deloitte, Inc., Goldman Sachs, World Economic Forum, and YPO. 
 
For any media/event inquiries, please contact@defined.ai

name: Brian Falther
title: Mechanical Engineer | Systems Builder | 15+ Yrs Leading Product, Process & Facility Design
about:
I’m a mechanical engineer and entrepreneur with over a 15 years of experience in designing and launching physical systems, scaling operations, and leading cross-functional teams. From robotics and wellness spaces to large-scale construction and product ecosystems, I’ve built from idea to launch across multiple disciplines and projects.

I thrive at the intersection of systems thinking and hands-on execution. I’ve led design-build projects from idea to CAD to ribbon-cutting, managed multidisciplinary engineering teams, and launched customer-facing innovations under tight timelines and high operational complexity.

Most recently, I founded and launched BASK, a wellness brand and physical facility engineered from the ground up — from facility layout and product development to mechanical systems, staffing, software stack, and customer experience. Prior to that, I co-founded Bowery Farming, where I served as the systems engineering lead, developing the foundational technology and infrastructure of the company’s proprietary commercial farming system.

What drives me is solving hard, real-world problems — especially those involving robotics, automation, operational design, and the human experience.
speaking_engagements: Interview with Forward Fooding FoodTech 500; Discussion on indoor farming and agriculture challenges
notable_achievements: Pioneering work in vertical farming and urban agriculture

A recognized thought leader in the payments vertical of financial technology, Ernest has launched or incubated several financial technology businesses including prepaid, commercial payments, merchant services, P2P lending, and crowd funding. 

Ernest is CEO and founder of Finexio, the only AP “Payments as a Service” company. 

Prior, Ernest was Vice President, Corporate Alliances at Emdeon where he identified and developed unique partnership opportunities at a leading provider of revenue and payment cycle management and clinical information exchange solutions.  He spent most of his time focused on payments and big data analytics. 

Previously, Ernest was a member of the US Market Development Emerging Verticals team at MasterCard where was responsible for driving innovative products and solutions to meet the needs of the Healthcare ecosystem. He is recognized within the payments industry as an expert in prepaid and debit cards, commercial payments, and payment card issuers.

Prior to MasterCard, Ernest was a founding member of Ernst&Young's West Coast Working Capital Advisory Services practice where he partnered with leading Fortune 500 companies to identify areas of improvement in the cash conversion cycle, as well as developing and implementing programs to release cash, improve service, and reduce costs. 

Ernest graduated with a BA in History from New York University in Manhattan, NY. He also holds a MSc in International Public Policy with a specialization in International Political Economy from University College London in London, England. His graduate dissertation was on the economic development of Dubai.  Passionate about language and travel, Ernest studied in Italy twice during his undergraduate work, interned at the Italian Embassy to the US in Washington DC, and is conversational in Italian.

name: Iru Wang
title: Co-Founder @ MoBagel | Women in Tech Advocate
about:
Hey there! I’m really into technology, especially when it comes to supporting and encouraging women in the field. Growing up, I didn’t see a lot of women in tech, but that only made me more determined to dive in and help change that. I love being part of a community where we can lift each other up and make sure everyone feels included. It’s been amazing to see more women making a big impact in the tech world today.

When I’m not working on tech stuff, I like to keep it simple. You’ll probably find me reading, doing yoga, or going for long walks to clear my mind. I remember this one time I went on a nature walk with my two kids. The trail was a bit muddy, but we had so much fun. It's those little moments that always remind me to slow down and cherish the simple things.

Whether I’m solving a tech challenge or just relaxing with a good book, I’m always learning and looking for new ways to grow. Thanks for stopping by and getting to know a little about me.

Please don’t hesitate to reach out if there’s anything I can help with!

name: Rohan Malhotra
title: CEO at Roadzen (Nasdaq: RDZN) | Advancing AI at the intersection of insurance and mobility
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I am the CEO and co-founder of Roadzen, an insurtech company founded in 2015 to transform global insurance for mobility. I use my background in machine learning and product management to help simplify the auto insurance experience.

At Roadzen, we marry technologies such as telematics and computer vision to build products that give our partners dynamic underwriting (connected, usage-based, asset-based), embedded distribution capabilities and instant claims processing.  At the heart of our mission is to bring road safety, transparency and seamless experience to the millions of customers who use our products. Roadzen has partnered with some of the world's leading insurers, reinsurers, carmakers and fleets to bring our vision to life.

name: Helen Gu
title: Founder and CEO at InsightFinder (We are hiring!) && Professor at North Carolina State University
about:
Helen Gu is the founder and CEO of InsightFinder Inc. She is also a Professor at Department of Computer Science of North Carolina State University and leads a research group supported by over $4.2 million research grants from NSF, NSA, ARO, Google, IBM and Credit Suisse. She published more than 80 research papers and has filed 10 patents (All of them have been granted). Her research group website is http://dance.csc.ncsu.edu/

Helen was on sabbatical at Google as a visiting scientist in 2015 helping Google evaluate the patented unsupervised behavior learning (UBL) algorithm co-invented by her and her PhD student.  Google licensed the UBL technology based on the superior accuracy achieved by UBL on real system failure data. She also worked at IBM T. J. Watson research center as a Research Staff Member in 2004-2007 working on the IBM stream processing system called System S which later becomes IBM's InfoSphere Stream product. 

Helen Gu received her PhD in CS from UIUC in 2004 and BS in CS from Peking University in 1999. Her work has been widely reported by presses including NSF research highlights, Communications of ACM, and The Register, and won several best paper awards from prestigious International conferences.

name: Sylvia Kang
title: CEO & Co-Founder at Mira, Empowering Women Globally through Innovative FemTech Solutions
about:
As the Co-Founder of Mira, I am proud to have built a product that stands at the forefront as a catalyst for change in the realm of women's health monitoring platforms, driven by a deep-rooted passion to empower individuals and revolutionize the way we approach fertility health.

This mission is deeply personal, as I firmly believe that every person deserves the opportunity to take control of their reproductive well-being and pursue their dreams of starting or expanding a family.

We have developed the first FDA, CE, and CFDA compliant comprehensive women's health monitoring platform, utilizing innovative science and technology to support fertility health. Our platform has demonstrated an impressive 99% accuracy in clinical trials, making Mira a reliable and trusted solution.

I am wholeheartedly dedicated to advancing consumer health through the seamless integration of point-of-care technology.

I bring extensive experience in P&L general management, having held business and product director roles in a Fortune 500 life science company, where I successfully managed a $100M global business. My educational background includes an MBA from Cornell University and an MS in Biomedical Engineering from Columbia University. Combining my passion for healthcare innovation with my business acumen, I am dedicated to driving Mira's mission forward.

In addition to my professional achievements, I am also a Concert Pianist, having earned recognition through multiple international piano competitions in France, China, and Hong Kong. This background in music has instilled in me the values of discipline, perseverance, and creativity, which I apply to my work at Mira.

about:
- Uncovered $3.5 billion in revenue opportunities in cancer genomics, precision medicine, hemostasis, etc., through organic and inorganic (partnership) strategies.
- Commercialized six new product categories and platforms in diagnostic and medical technology markets - Product Launch lead (CEO of the product) - early inception to market growth - International revenue expansions into Europe, Latin America, and Asia.

As a senior product and marketing executive in the biotech and diagnostic industries, my market-winning work extends across end-to-end product management and product marketing for multinational top 50 S&P healthcare companies like Roche, Illumina, Natera, Abbott Laboratory, Allergan, Medtronic, and Baxter Bioscience (Takeda)—an irrefutable track record of recruiting, building, developing, and leading direct reports.

I have earned a reputation for driving customer-centric, multi-disciplinary projects from initiation to successful execution in the focus areas of product management, opportunity assessments, commercialization strategy, road map planning, go-to-market strategies, and global and regional campaign management. With a passion for helping patients live healthier lives and enabling clinicians, my early career includes experience as a bench scientist, giving me a solid foundation of quantitative and analytical skills and a unique, 360-degree view of the industry.

To round out my education, I completed a bachelor’s in cellular biology and an MBA in Finance from Pepperdine University. In addition to continuing education courses on leadership and management, I earned a certificate in Genomics from Stanford University.

name: Brandon Bornancin

about:
👋 Hi, I’m Brandon 👋 My life’s mission is to help you grow your business and make more money so you can help more people. 

I truly believe the more you give to others, the more you get back. What goes around….always comes back around.

Business is my sport. Business is my hobby. Changing people's lives is my passion. I do whatever it takes to help you grow yours.

Why follow me? I’ve crammed many learnings quickly from a ton of failures and a handful of successes building 3 companies since I was 18…. That’s what I like to write about.

I’m the CEO of Seamless.AI, the company we built from $0 to over $200,000,000 in just 5 years. We deliver the world's best sales leads using AI and help over 1 million people get emails and mobile phones for anyone. Join Seamless.AI for free at www.seamless.AI. 

We’re grateful to be named the #1 best places to work, #1 tech company of the year, #1 innovative company of the year, Forbes Top Company, Linkedin’s #7 Top Startup of 50, #1 remote company, and top purpose-driven companies.

I’m also the #1 best-selling author of 5 books: Whatever It Takes, The Power of Going All-In, Sales Secrets, Seven Figure Social Selling, and The Ultimate Guide To Breaking Into Tech Sales. I write to help you max out all areas of your life and want to give you everything I learn before I die.

I write about life advice and growth strategies that are data-driven, science-based, pragmatic, and non-bullshitty—a.k.a., advice that doesn’t suck. 

Some people say I’m an idiot. Other people say I saved their life. Read on and decide for yourself.

name: Simon (Seockhoon) Bae
title: Founder & CEO at CUPIX
about:
I am a serial entrepreneur and, on the side, a 3D geometry enthusiast. I like to indulge in problem-solving as a hobby, ranging from simple Sudoku puzzles to sophisticated industry disruption. My M.O. is to create a new solution by combining existing things when solving challenging problems. In the past, I helped manufacturers digitalize legacy parts by leveraging feature-based 3D modeling ideas. I applied the Github source code revisioning concept to automate engineering change order management. Today, I am the CEO of Cupix and focus on utilizing space mapping technologies developed for unmanned vehicles to devise a DIY 3D capture methodology and make building/maintaining facilities and infrastructures much more efficient and error-free.

* Founded Cupix in 2015. Currently working hard to provide an incredibly easy and fast way to capture sites in 3D only using a consumer-grade 360 camera as a building block of a brand-new 3D digital twin for general contractors, owners, and property managers.

* Lead the strategy development and its implementation for a 3D printing specialized cloud platform and client apps at 3D Systems.

* Founded VisPower in Sunnyvale, CA in 2010 and lead the company to develop and market TeamPlatform.com, a unique and pioneering SaaS app disrupting the product design collaboration market. VisPower was acquired by 3D Systems in 2013.

* Founded INUS Technology in Seoul, Korea in 1998 and served as CEO until 2010. Its flagship Rapidform software had been the world's best-selling 3D redesign and shape inspection software using 3D scan data. INUS was acquired by 3D Systems in 2012 and has operated since successfully as the Geomagic brand.

Specialties: 3D Scanning, Mechanical Computer Aided Design (CAD), 3D Printing, Virtual Reality, Cloud Platform, SaaS, Startup Strategy
speaking_engagements: Chairman at Korea Proptech Forum promoting real estate technology advancements
notable_achievements: Founded multiple technology companies acquired by 3D Systems; Pioneered 3D site capture technology with Cupix; Served as CTO of Cloud Strategy at 3D Systems
reasoning: Simon Bae demonstrates a clear pattern of successful serial entrepreneurship with multiple verified exits. He has founded three significant companies (INUS Technology, VisPower, and Cupix) with two confirmed acquisitions by 3D Systems. His track record shows consistent ability to build and exit technology companies in the 3D/spatial computing space. The acquisition of multiple companies by a major industry player (3D Systems) and the long-term success of these acquisitions (e.g., INUS Technology becoming the successful Geomagic brand) indicates substantial exit values and strategic importance. His PhD from Seoul National University and deep technical expertise in 3D technology further supports his classification as an elite serial entrepreneur.

name: Doug Brunton
title: VP Engineering @ Frameable. Frameable Core Enterprise Platform and services unlock revolutionary distributed/hybrid workplace collaboration from directly within Microsoft Teams.
about:
Doug Brunton is a seasoned technology executive with a history of success in product and services development and go-to-market.

Brunton found his path as an entrepreneurial executive when he founded Plus Three to bring the Democratic party's fundraising and outreach efforts online in 2000, promptly breaking the all-time single-day fundraising record for any political party in the US. Doug led product strategy and teams on both sides of Shutterstock's (SSTK) two sided marketplace during their IPO run-up. At Oblong Industries (OBLG) he built the product and strategy for Greenhouse, Oblong's public offering of their gestural operating system and entry point to the enterprise sales funnel. Doug is a Y Combinator founder (Pluot, DBA Daily.co - W16), and has been all-in with Frameable since its inception.

Doug takes a creative approach to solving difficult technical problems and building products that people want. He builds teams, putting the right people in the right seats at the right time. Doug Brunton is relentlessly ambitious, energetic and data-driven when finding product fit and market fit and is equally capable in every phase of that journey from building initial hard technical product proofs of concept to closing enterprise sales.

name: Kwindla Hultman Kramer
title: CEO @ Daily | Helping developers create awesome video experiences built on global WebRTC infrastructure | Y Combinator Top Company 2023
about:
CEO and co-founder of Daily — SDKs and infrastructure for the future of video.

If you are are creating a product or an app that has video or audio features, we can probably help. The Internet is increasingly a video-first medium, and we think of ourselves as building the infrastructure for the future of our collective digital experience.

I'm also always happy to talk about video, audio, WebRTC, distributed systems, and startups topics just in general, so feel free to DM me here.

I have been interested in large-scale networked systems and real-time video since I was a graduate student with Mitchel Resnick at the MIT Media Lab.

Before Daily, I helped to found Oblong Industries. We built an operating system for spatial, multi-user, multi-screen, multi-device computing. Our must successful product was a collaborative big-data environment.

Before Oblong I helped to build out the technology for AllAfrica. For six years, I worked mostly from the Washington DC office with a wonderful group of journalists and engineers. I also did a lot of traveling to advocate that everyone doing large-scale web development -- but particulary public- and civil-sector organizations -- use mainly Free and Open Source Software.

name: Bruno Basso
title: John A. Hannah Distinguished Professor and MSU Foundation Professor, Michigan State University;  Cofounder of CiBO Technologies
about:
As a MSU Foundation Professor and the John A. Hannah Distinguished Professor at Michigan State University, I have dedicated over 25 years of my career to advance agricultural sustainability and innovation. My core competencies include crop and soil sciences, regenerative agriculture, climate change research, Digital Twins, remote sensing, crop and biogeochemical systems modeling.

I have published more than 300 peer-reviewed articles, book chapters, and reports on these topics, and co-founded CiBO Technologies, a start-up that leverages AI and crop simulation to optimize crop production and environmental outcomes and an NGO called The Soil Inventory Project to connect people with soil carbon data and models. I have also received multiple international awards and recognitions for my teaching and research, such as Fellow of the American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS); Soil Science Society of America (SSSA); American Society of Agronomy (ASA); 2021 Morgan Stanley Sustainability Solution Prize Collaborative; 2019 Outstanding Faculty Award at Michigan State University; 2016 Recipient of the Innovation of the Year Award from Michigan State.   I serves as member of the Board of Agriculture and Natural Resources of the US National Academies of Sciences, Engineering and Medicine (NASEM) and the Biological and Environmental Research Advisory Council (BERAC).
speaking_engagements: Chair of planning committee for workshop 'Exploring a Dynamic Soil Information System'; Guest on MSU Research Foundation podcast discussing scaling scientific innovation and AI in agriculture
notable_achievements: University Foundation Professor at Michigan State University; Co-founder and Chief Scientist of CiBO Technologies; Published nearly 200 articles in peer-reviewed journals; Received numerous academic awards and fellowships; Led research on scalable climate solutions for agricultural carbon markets
reasoning: Bruno Basso qualifies as a Market Innovator and Thought Leader (L6) based on his exceptional academic credentials, industry recognition, and entrepreneurial achievements. He has demonstrated groundbreaking innovation in agricultural technology, founded a technology company (CIBO Technologies) that applies AI and advanced modeling to agriculture, and has received significant recognition as a thought leader in his field. His profile shows strong evidence of market innovation, particularly in the intersection of technology and agriculture, with substantial validation through awards, publications, and industry recognition.

name: Ofir Schlam
title: President & Co-Founder at Taranis
about:
Taranis CEO, Ofir Schlam is a fourth-generation farmer. Raised in Israel, he comes from a family of farmers who have grown cotton and wheat for the last 4 generations. His professional career started when he began his B.Sc. in Math & Computer Science at the age of 16 as part of a program for outstanding students at BIU and graduated Summa Cum Laude at the age of 19. For his military service, Ofir served in an elite technological unit of the Prime Minister's Office, where he was involved in developing and leading groundbreaking technology projects. During that time he also earned his M.Sc in cryptography at age of 22. Ofir moved up in the organization and in his last position before starting Taranis, he managed an R&D department of 15 software engineers. Ofir and his 3 co-founders started Taranis in 2015 with a mission to help farmers protect their crops more efficiently.

I am very interested in technology, business and generally curious to learn new fields.

Taranis, a precision agriculture intelligence platform, helps Ag supply chain companies, input manufacturers and operating farms increase their yields and cut costs by giving them a way to effectively monitor their fields, make informed decisions and then act on them. The system uses sophisticated computer vision, data science and deep learning algorithms to detect early symptoms of weeds, uneven emergence, nutrient deficiencies, disease/insect infestations, water damage, equipment problems and more so that farmers can address issues quickly and understand the impact on yield and cost of production.
Taranis is the most comprehensive imagery solution for Ag in the world that combines all satellite constellation sources with analysis beyond NDVI, along with the broadest network on manned aircraft taking multispectral field mosaic at 8cm per pixel and the unique sub-mm imagery analyzed by deep learning called AI2 – the first leaf level imagery.

about:
Currently I am working on shaping the future of video led commerce with in-video search, analytics and video experiences.  Proven and accomplished product management professional, entrepreneurial thinker, and innovator with 13+ years of experience with startups and world class brands in web/mobile product development including native IOS/Android apps, SAAS tools/technologies, digital commerce, payments and enterprise/consumer products. Built and led products teams, have strong cross-functional and international product development experience in Scandinavia, Europe, Asia and Latin America. Fluent in German, French, and Hindi. 

•	Co-founded, led and directed  “Modiv Media”, an award winning venture capital funded company providing  time-tested and customer-embraced mobile shopper marketing solutions integrating  personalized promotions, mobile self-scan, and instant checkout on shoppers smartphones. Modiv Media was acquired by Catalina Marketing, a global leader in in-store retail Point of Sale marketing solutions.  Issued Patent us 9,064,359 for queue management.
•	Pioneered adoption of mobile devices for personalized loyalty, Rewards, offers and payments management. Received a patent on how to use NFC tags in phones for shopping and other services. Issued US Patent 8,346,210 -	Method and apparatus for managing services using bearer tags.
•	Developed and launched a scalable global card and operator billing solution (124 operators in 43 countries) with localization for Nokia mobile app store increasing registered users to 70 million with 6 million downloads per day. 
•	Delivered $20 million of additional new ecosystem revenue and $2.5 million in new partner revenue worldwide for Nokia smart devices.

Specialties: Entrepreneurship, SAAS, Agile and Lean development, Mobile commerce, Payments, Billing, Strategic leadership, Board Advisor, Executive Management, Retail solutions, POS solutions, Web technologies, Go-To-market Strategy. I tweet at @ajbam .

name: Alex Fielding
title: CEO and Chairman at Privateer Space and Orbital Insight
about:
Alex Fielding is a leader and entrepreneur in the space and robotics industries, with over 25 years of experience in engineering, management, and innovation. He is the CEO and Chairman of Privateer Space and Orbital Insight; the leading privately traded geospatial intelligence platform company. He is also the Founder and Director of Ripcord, a company that uses vision guided industrial robots for digitization and cloud-based access.

Alex has a proven track record of creating and scaling successful companies, products, and technologies that have a positive impact on the world. He co-founded GPS company Wheels of Zeus with Apple’s co-founder Steve Wozniak, which was sold in 2006. He was CTO at Power Assure and VP at Vigilent before starting Ripcord while a contractor at NASA. He is an advisor to Astra. He holds multiple patents in the fields of vision guided robotics, machine learning, and cloud computing. He is a founding member of Singularity University and an active contributor to the IETF. He is passionate about advancing the frontiers of science, technology, and education for the benefit of humanity.
education_2_degree: Continuing ed. Sharpening the saw. M&A, Business Administration, Management and Operations
notable_achievements: Co-founded Wheels of Zeus with Steve Wozniak; Co-founded Ripcord, a robotics company focused on digitizing corporate paper records; Co-founded Privateer Space, a space startup with AI-powered space data platform; Led Ripcord to become a $250 million startup; Secured investments from prominent venture firms and Steve Wozniak
reasoning: Alex Fielding demonstrates a strong pattern of innovation, successful exits, and industry leadership that aligns with L6 'Market Innovators and Thought Leaders' classification. name: Dudley Lynch
title: Co-Owner and President, Brain Technologies Corporation
about:
For the past 30+ years, joining with my wife and business partner, Sherry Ann Lynch, I've served as the co-founder, president and chief creative and training person at Brain Technologies Corporation. It has always been the goal of our publishing, training, marketing and consulting company to operate at the forefront of the thinking skills “upgrade” revolution, using "thinkologist" approaches like these: 

• BrainMapping®, the tools and technology for helping people and their teams understand how they process information. This includes a premier instrumentality, The BrainMap®, and four other cutting-edge assessment tools.

• 59 Minute TeamBuilding™, a fast-moving, quick-results-producing "power hour (less a minute)" per week concept designed to take a group of like-minded colleagues and associates through 16 weeks of high-energy mutual exploration of a team's potential.

• Dolphin Strategy, the “do the next right, smart good thing” competency-, choice- and change-skills-building methods. This includes the unique DolphinThink® Workbook (co-created with Dr. Paul Kordis) for discovering the organizing principles and the natural advantages visible in the sum total of who you really are.

• Asset Report®: The Book of You, a fully customized and personalized 100-page-plus report on a user's thinking skills produced from the scores from a short but remarkably accurate (so we have often been told by clients) 1-page questionnaire.

• Several books on Dr. Graves' theory. This includes my latest feature-length work, LEAP! How to Think Like a Dolphin & Do the Next Right, Smart Thing Come Hell or High Water, available in both print and ebook editions from Brain Technologies and most major online book services.

Participants in Brain Technologies’ global network of consultants, are known as BTC Associates. Details are available at http://www.braintechnologies.com/team.htm. We welcome inquiries from interested thinking skills professionals worldwide.

about:
Picture this: It's 2021, and Lillian, fresh out of grad school, struts into a high-tech firm for her first big interview. She’s armed with a colorful CV and unparalleled enthusiasm. But by traditional metrics, she's... well, average. Yet, two years down the line, Lillian’s not just another face in the cubicle sea. She's the company's most invaluable asset, blowing all performance metrics out of the water. How did they spot her potential? Enter our Talent Intelligence Platform.

While most were playing catch-up with talent trends, we were in our lab, perfecting the world's most futuristic Talent Oracle. It's not just AI; it's like having Sherlock Holmes, Oprah, and Einstein combined, analyzing your talent pool. We address those head-scratchers:

"Which quirks make Jane in sales outsell the rest by 300%?"
"Are we missing the mark on what makes a stellar team member?"
"Can we predict if Raj will be a top performer or a coffee-break champion?"
"Is our ramp-up for rookies more of a crawl? How can we speed it up?"
"What if there's a retention landmine we're blindly stepping on?"
"Is Carlita in finance secretly the marketing maven we've been searching for?"
"What's the vibe check on our team's capability to shoot for the stars?"
"If our goal is to disrupt, are we even drafting the right dream team?"
"Could Jerome from logistics be the happiness czar our HR needs?"
"How can we gauge an employee’s sales mojo before they even make a call?"
"Who’s silently screaming 'enterprise role' while we pigeonhole them in commercials?"
"Is Alex right for upselling, or is he the renewal wizard we've been waiting for?"

By trusting our platform's magic:

We've sped up hiring from 0 to 60 in seconds flat.
Seen companies slash their "goodbye" rates from a cringe-worthy 44% to a mere 12%.
Rookie ramp-ups? Think of it as upgrading from a tricycle to a jet.
Cultured a workspace where gloom's out and 'heck yeah!' is in.
Watched as sales figures danced (and maybe moonwalked) to new heights.

And churn? Well, it's taken a backseat, while loyalty now rides shotgun.

In the grand theater of talent, don’t just trust the auditions. Let’s peek behind the curtain together.

name: Jon Pilon CPA
title: CFO | Outside Director
about:
Jon partners with the CEO and peers on strategy and operating excellence.  Jon has been a key leader at public and private turnaround, international and high-growth companies in the commercial and government contracting space.

STRATEGY | M&A | CAPITALIZATION

• Reevaluated strategic investments with CEO driving exit strategy and divestiture.
• M&A due diligence and an integration leader post close.
• Renegotiated debt financing amendment with more favorable terms while correcting covenant noncompliance. Supported debt and equity financings at multiple companies.
• Saved €2M to €3M per year in cash taxes through a cross-border debt forgiveness transaction.

A LEADER WITH VISION

Jon sets a vision, builds high performing teams and leads business improvement initiatives that help the front office / operations while ensuring back-office compliance is efficient and scalable. He uses his deep financial acumen to create business opportunities.
• Reduced dispute resolution cycle at Genesys from days to hours which reduced DSO by 23% and improved customer satisfaction.
• Reduced month-end close from 22 to 5 days while upgrading Genesys' 30-person finance team spread across three continents.
• Built a European shared services accounting function for PAREXEL while stationed in Berlin, Germany.
• Identified and deployed enabling technologies making the back office “easier to do business with” at TCS such as automated workflows and paperless expense reports.

name: Eilon Reshef
title: Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer at Gong
about:
I am a co-founder and Chief Product Officer at Gong, the leading revenue intelligence SaaS solution.

Gong helps revenue organizations drive productivity, predictability and growth through an AI-based platform used by all revenue team members. Gong captures all customer interactions - what customers say or write and through AI delivers guidance, automation and efficiencies.

Earlier, I was one of the founders of Webcollage, a venture-backed SaaS in the e-commerce infrastructure, which connected most the world's leading brands (P&G, Microsoft, L'Oreal and more ) with thousands of retailer websites (Amazon, Best Buy, Walmart and more). We sold Webcollage to Answers in May 2013.

I am a seasoned entrepreneur, an executive and (to a lesser degree) an investor in the internet and software spaces. Over the years, I’ve incepted, built and marketed software, carrying out diverse responsibilities (inception, technology, engineering, product management, product marketing, and general management) in both hands-on and management capacities.

name: Aaron Lee
title: Founder, CEO at Smith.ai
about:
Aaron is the CEO and co-founder of Smith.ai. He was the CTO of The Home Depot and co-founder of Redbeacon. 

Before that, Aaron was one of the founding engineers in Google Video. He later became the Tech Lead on YouTube monetization, building AdSense, AdWords, and YouTube products. He was also a Launch Engineer at Google, helped launch many other Google products, and mentored engineers. 

Aaron earned his M.A and B.A. from the University of Cambridge with first honors in Computer Science. He also received his Ph.D. in Computer Graphics from Princeton and has interned at Nvidia, Microsoft Research (where he was awarded the Microsoft Fellowship), NASA Ames Research Center, and Lucent Technologies. He has published papers in SIGGRAPH, IEEE, and holds eight patents.

name: Justin Maxwell
title: Co-Founder & ex-CPO @ Smith.ai | AI Product Leader
about:
I’m a product leader, designer, and 0–1 founder. I helped scale Smith.ai from 2 to 500+ people, building AI + human-powered systems that now handle millions of conversations a year. I led product, design (and helped build our operations and customer support), and integrated AI into the core of our platform long before it was cool.

Before Smith.ai, I did some solid stuff: Mint.com’s first UX hire, designer + PM for the legendary Mint for iPhone, led UX and mobile through its acquisition by Intuit, and designed for Apple’s Pro Apps and Apple.com teams. I was also at Google, where I worked on automotive UX, as well as payment systems.

As a product leader shaped by Apple, I see my role as assembling and organizing holistic talent greater than the individuals — myself included. I’ve mostly been a 0–1 generalist wearing Product & Design clothing: setting up systems, establishing rituals, mentoring teams, and keeping expectations high. People describe me as the glue. I’ve never been the smartest person in the room or the best designer — I just help them do their best work and set the goals we go after.

I also had the misfortune of being Theranos’ first Design Director. You can read my resignation letter in Bad Blood.

name: Eyal Feldman
title: CEO and Co-Founder at Stampli - Procure-To-Pay AI
about:
At Stampli, we're building the most efficient way for finance teams to control company spend from procurement to payment. By helping finance teams eliminate manual work with AI, they see a 25X boost in team efficiency, 98% faster invoice approval, and 75% shorter processing time. That's why over 1700 mid-market customers trust us to improve their most critical business workflows. 

I started Stampli with my brother Ofer after 13 years of building business solutions while I experienced the pains of inefficient payment processes first-hand. AP workflows were bogged down by back-and-forth email threads, fragmented systems, and a lack of visibility. Finance teams struggled to chase down invoice approvals. I knew there had to be a better way.

Now Stampli is the leading AI finance platform that connects every dot in the procure-to-pay process. We believe that effective financial workflows aren't just about enforcing policies. They’re about building systems that are intuitive, adaptable, and fully integrated with your company's financial ecosystem, where every step, conversation, and approval happens in one place.
 
I welcome connections with professionals who share an interest in AI, finance automation, and innovative business solutions. Let's explore how to drive financial efficiency together!

At Generative Labs, we enable companies to leverage their data through tailored AI solutions. Proven expertise from working with leaders like American Red Cross, Amgen, and Janssen.

I'm a strong advocate for rapid experimentation and iterative development. My success comes from quickly building working prototypes, gathering real-world data, and refining solutions based on concrete feedback rather than theoretical perfection.

I believe in leading through continuous learning, open collaboration, and data-driven decision making. My approach combines technical depth with user-centered design to create AI solutions that deliver measurable business value.

name: Shamail Siddiqi
title: Co-Founder & CEO at Masterminds Education | Shaping the Future of Learning
about:
As an Education Entrepreneur dedicated to Shaping the Future of Learning, I bring nearly two decades of rich experience spanning entrepreneurship, strategy consulting, operations, finance, and the consumer industry. My journey began in the world of Goldman Sachs and Booz & Company, where I honed my skills in driving strategic initiatives and delivering operational excellence across global markets.

The birth of my daughter marked a pivotal shift in my career trajectory, steering me towards the realm of education with a mission to redefine early childhood learning. Recognizing the limitations of traditional education systems to prepare children for a rapidly evolving world, I embarked on a global quest to uncover the most advanced methodologies in child development and neuroscience. This exploration led to the founding of Masterminds Education, an institution now at the forefront of educational innovation.

At Masterminds, we've developed proprietary programs that are a fusion of over 60 years of groundbreaking research in child development. These programs are not just about academic excellence; they're about nurturing well-rounded, confident, and happy children who are equipped to navigate the challenges of the 21st century. Our approach has garnered global recognition, earning us numerous accolades and setting new benchmarks in early and primary education.

The launch of our global micro-schools and our foray into online education in the US have expanded our reach, allowing us to impact even more lives. Our initiatives are supported by a cutting-edge AI platform, positioning us as pioneers in personalized education. I envision Masterminds becoming a global powerhouse in education, making personalized learning accessible to all.

name: Tania Siddiqi
title: Co-Founder & Director, Masterminds Education
about:
Tania Siddiqi is the Co-Founder and Director of Masterminds Education, a company dedicated to creating Intellectual, Physical and Social excellence in children age two to six years through its pioneering early years enrichment programs.

Tania has over 14 years of experience as a Trainer and Entrepreneur.  She has worked with some of the most influential blue chip companies like ANZ Grindlays, Shell and ABN AMRO. Her first entrepreneurial venture was a healthcare staffing company while living in New York City. 

Inspired by her experience as a business owner and a mother, Tania launched Athena’s Quilts in Dubai, a socially responsible business established to provide economic empowerment to women and education to children in developing countries. As an active member of UAE's theatre and film community, Tania has also written and directed many plays and films celebrating strong female role models. 

Her passion for education and empowerment led her to partner with a US based institute specializing in early childhood development. Tania has completed both basic and advanced courses in child development and has spent many months at the institute designing enrichment programs that enable all children achieve Intellectual, Physical and Social Excellence.
 
As Director of Masterminds Education, Tania is responsible for implementing Masterminds pioneering programs at their flagship Early Learning Centre starting September 2015.

name: Ben McKean
title: Founder and CEO at Hungryroot
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I started my first business when I was 18, and ever since I’ve been in love with building brand experiences and using technology to positively impact people’s lives. 

In 2009, I started my second company, Savored, which we sold to Groupon after becoming the nation’s largest provider of dynamic pricing solutions to the restaurant industry with over 2,000 restaurants and nearly a million diners seated on our platform. I then launched and led Groupon Reserve, Groupon’s premium business and latest iteration of the daily deal product, which was built on Savored’s technology. In 2015, I founded Hungryroot, which uses artificial intelligence to make healthy living easy, enjoyable and sustainable for millions of Americans across the country. In 2023, I started Every, a non-profit that uses AI to guide reflection, build understanding and uncover common ground. 

I believe in the power of technology, imagination and awareness to shape our lives, feel our best and positively impact the world. I’ve been fortunate to partner with and learn from incredible people, and I’m very grateful to be able to work on what I love.

name: Eli David
title: AI Researcher & Entrepreneur
about:
Dr. Eli David is a leading AI expert specializing in deep learning and evolutionary computation. He has authored over 100 AI patents and peer-reviewed papers in top artificial intelligence journals and conferences, with a primary focus on applying deep learning and genetic algorithms to real-world domains. For the past fifteen years, he has been teaching courses on deep learning and evolutionary computation, in addition to supervising the research of graduate students in these fields. He has also served in numerous capacities successfully designing, implementing, and leading deep learning-based projects in real-world environments.

Dr. David received the Best Paper Award in 2008 Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference, the Gold Award in the prestigious "Humies" Awards for Human-Competitive Results in 2014, and the Best Paper Award in 2016 International Conference on Artificial Neural Networks. He is the developer of Falcon, a Grandmaster-level chess playing program based on genetic algorithms and deep learning, which reached second place in the World Computer Chess Championship.

Dr. David has co-founded several successful deep learning-based companies, including Deep Instinct, recognized by Nvidia as the "Most Disruptive AI Startup" and today one of the prominent cybersecurity companies in Israel; and DeepCube, an AI accelerator which was acquired in 2021. He also serves as an AI consultant to several Fortune 500 companies, and major venture capital and private equity firms. He is a frequently invited speaker in prominent AI venues, a member of Forbes Technology Council, and a member of Bar-Ilan University's Board of Trustees.

In 2025, the State of Israel selected Dr. David as a national Torch Lighter at the 77th Independence Day ceremony—one of the country's highest civilian honors—in recognition of his pioneering contributions to AI.
awards_and_recognitions: Best Paper Award, Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference 2008; Gold Award, 'Humies' Awards for Human-Competitive Results 2014; Best Paper Award, International Conference on Artificial Neural Networks 2016; Nvidia's Most Disruptive AI Startup recognition for Deep Instinct; National Torch Lighter, State of Israel 2025
speaking_engagements: Frequent invited speaker at prominent AI venues; Member of Forbes Technology Council; Member of Bar-Ilan University's Board of Trustees

name: Lane Bess
title: CEO, Deep Instinct
about:
Lane Bess is CEO of Deep Instinct and Principal/ Founder of Bess Ventures and Advisory. Prior, he was the Chief Operating Officer of Zscaler Inc., an innovator and leader in Cloud based Internet security services. He has spent over 30 years as an operational executive and has successfully launched start-ups and grown medium sized businesses to large scale. Between 2008 and 2011, Lane was CEO of Palo Alto Networks where he led the late fundraising and scaled the company from its early go-to-market, to a revenue run rate exceeding $200 million on the path to its IPO. Prior to Palo Alto Networks, he served as the EVP of Worldwide Sales and General Manager of publicly traded Trend Micro Inc. (Nikkei) - growing worldwide revenues to over $1 billion annually. He has extensive experience in building technology businesses in the Europe, Asia Pacific and Japan as well as other International regions. His considerable work in the security technology sector has made him a trusted advisor for many Enterprise CIOs and CISOs.

With core strengths in Sales, Marketing and Product Management, Mr. Bess has deep expertise in driving high growth for network/cloud security, computing, and software companies. His business experience includes providing critical technology solutions to Fortune 2000 companies, large enterprises, mid-size businesses, as well as consumer markets. Through continuous leverage of distribution channels, Lane has been consistently recognized as a leading "channel friendly" executive. During Lane's career he has also held senior Sales and Marketing roles at NCR Corporation and AT&T. name: Pavel Bykov
title: CEO at IP Fabric, Inc.
about:
Pavel is a seasoned network infrastructure professional, investor and CEO. Pavel has over 15 years of experience building technical capabilities powering the digital transformation of global enterprises.

As CEO of IP Fabric, Pavel is on a mission to deliver Intent-Based Networking to Enterprises. IP Fabric is solving Network Assurance for large enterprises by creating a digital twin of the entire network infrastructure, containing information about every technology and protocol, and capable of simulating forwarding and security scenarios. IP Fabric's network model is also used as a Network Source of Truth for network automation initiatives, serving as an API for the entire network. IP Fabric was recognized by Gartner as Cool Vendor in Network Automation for 2022.

Prior to IP Fabric, Pavel had over a decade of experience in building and managing large-scale enterprise networks, designing and deploying business-critical services and capabilities, and leading global digital transformation projects. Pavel was also a CCSI and CCIE certified instructor, training both official and advanced custom courses created from scratch.

Pavel's hobbies include nuclear engineering, racquet sports, and traveling.

name: Jean Drouin
title: CEO, board member, founder and investor in healthcare technology, AI and biotech
about:
I am a senior executive, board chair/director and investor with a track record of scaling and transforming private and public healthcare services, technology, AI and biotechnology businesses.

As founder, CEO and Board Chair, I created and led Clarify Health, a technology and AI company delivering advanced business analytics and value-based payment solutions to health systems, insurers, and life sciences and biotechnology companies. Clarify has served more than 100 customers, who collectively impact 100 million patients and members. Clarify has aggregated one of the largest healthcare datasets and delivers sports-style moneyball insights to help its customers identify the best doctors and therapies, personalize care, grow more efficiently, and reduce costs. The company has raised over $350 million from investors including KKR, Insight Partners, Spark Capital, Softbank and BlackRock. 

Prior to Clarify, I was a Senior Partner at McKinsey, where I led the Healthcare Digital and IT practice. In this capacity, I was responsible for developing digital strategies and leading large scale transformations for health systems, insurers and life sciences companies. This involved identifying and deploying the digital and IT capabilities required to strengthen sales and marketing; automate operations; and improve quality and patient experience. I also founded McKinsey Advanced Healthcare Analytics (MAHA), which provided services and products on healthcare reform, consumer analytics, new payment and pricing models, and risk management. I worked extensively with private equity firms and investors on market assessments, due diligences, and go-to-market strategies.

Concurrently with McKinsey and Clarify, I spent almost a decade serving on the Board of Lester B. Pearson College of the Pacific, where I was ultimately Vice Chair. As Canada’s United World College, Pearson College has a vision to foster peace and international understanding through education, bringing together students from over 90 countries to study together. I currently serve on the Boards of Cambia Health Solutions, Clarify Health, and the Columbia School of Public Health.
