name: Todd Gottula
title: President of Clarify Health Solutions
about:
As Co-founder and President of Clarify Health, Todd combines his extensive experience in technology and innovation with a deep understanding of the healthcare sector to lead a company dedicated to transforming the industry. Clarify Health stands out as both a value-based care solution provider and the premier platform for high-fidelity healthcare insights and actionable recommendations.

Todd's visionary leadership and commitment to improving patient lives through technology and clinical expertise have positioned Clarify Health as a game-changer in the healthcare landscape. By leading a talented team focused on developing and implementing cutting-edge, scalable technology solutions, Todd has solidified Clarify Health's reputation for delivering exceptional value and transformative insights to healthcare organizations across the globe.

Under Todd's guidance, Clarify Health has made significant strides in value-based care through strategic acquisitions of Apervita's Value Optimization business and Embedded Healthcare. These milestones have not only fortified the company's position as a leading provider of value-based payment solutions but also cemented its status as a trusted source for accurate, data-driven insights and recommendations that empower healthcare providers to make informed decisions and deliver optimal patient care.

Before founding Clarify Health, Todd held the position of Executive Vice President and Chief Technology Officer at Advent Software, where he was instrumental in developing and commercializing innovative solutions for the global financial industry. His leadership at Advent contributed to the company's significant growth, servicing customers in over 60 countries and managing more than $18 trillion in assets before being acquired for $2.7B in 2015.

A proud alumnus of the California Institute of Technology, Todd holds a BS in Chemical Engineering, which serves as a testament to his strong technical expertise and problem-solving abilities.

name: Kuldeep Singh Rajput
title: Founder & CEO of OutcomesAI | Founder of Biofourmis | Forbes 30 Under 30 | Milken Institute Young Leaders Circle | Forbes Technology Council
about:
Kuldeep Singh Rajput is the CEO and Founder of OutcomesAI, a healthcare technology company focused on building trusted artificial medical intelligence to supercharge healthcare teams. Nursing shortage and clinical capacity are leading problems in healthcare, OutcomesAI is addressing this crisis by building a multi-modal AI optimized for healthcare applications – with an initial focus on assisting care teams with AI Companions.

Prior to OutcomesAI, Kuldeep was the Founder and CEO of Biofourmis, a global technology enabled care delivery company that brings the right care to any person anywhere! Biofourmis’ innovative solutions provide people everywhere with connected access to hospital-level services, virtual provider networks for remote care, in-home services, and life-changing clinical trials—all without leaving their homes. 

Recognized as the “Forbes 30 Under 30”, Kuldeep has demonstrated strong leadership experience with building teams, developing talents, and successfully growing, and managing strategic partnerships with global pharmaceutical manufacturers, health systems and Payers. He uses his background and experience in biomedical engineering and data from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) to unfold his vision of “Predicting and Preventing Serious Medical Events using AI”. During his Ph.D. studies at the National University of Singapore (NUS), he built bioelectronic implants, which aim to control biological processes and treat diseases by modulating electric impulses. 

He believes in giving back and is part of the Milken Institute Young Leaders Circle (YLC), supporting the mission of providing people access to education and healthcare for stable economic growth. Kuldeep has been featured in major publications and has been a keynote speaker at numerous prestigious conferences like TED. 

Specialties: Entrepreneur, Fund Raising, Building Companies, Generative AI, Digital Therapeutics, Licensing, and Deal Structure, Healthcare Strategy, Digital Healthcare, Wearable Biosensors, Pharmaceuticals

name: Maulik Majmudar
title: Chief Medical Officer and Co-Founder at Biofourmis
about:
Dr. Maulik Majmudar is a cardiologist and co-founder and Chief Medical Officer at Biofourmis. Prior to joining Biofourmis, Dr. Majmudar was the Medical Officer for Amazon Halo and led the development and launch of Amazon’s first health membership service. Prior to Amazon, he was Associate Director of the Healthcare Transformation Lab at Massachusetts General Hospital, and an Assistant Professor at Harvard Medical School, where he was responsible for the identification, validation, and implementation of digital health solutions to improve care delivery as well as the patient and provider experience. While at MGH, he was awarded an education grant from the Aetna Foundation to launch a new Fellowship in Healthcare Innovation, aimed at fostering the next generation of clinician innovators. 

Dr. Majmudar was also a founding member and chief clinical officer of Quanttus, Inc. a venture-backed medical wearables startup that was developing a novel wrist-based device for continuous cuffless blood pressure monitoring.

Dr. Majmudar attended Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine and then completed residency training in Internal Medicine at The Johns Hopkins Hospital, followed by a cardiovascular medicine fellowship at the Brigham and Women’s Hospital. He also holds two patents and has had several publications in high-impact journals, such as Nature, Circulation, JAMA, and Journal of Healthcare Delivery and Implementation Science.

name: Jason Mars
title: Professor at U. Mich, CEO of Jaseci Labs, Inventor/Founder
about:
https://www.jasonmars.org/
https://www.jaseci.org/

Jason Mars is a professor of computer science at University of Michigan, President of Jaseci Labs, and co-founder of Myca.ai. Jason Mars’ work is at the intersection of science, technology, and entrepreneurship with the mission to have meaningful impact in the world. This commitment is demonstrated by a long list of intellectual and technical contributions. As a professor of computer science at the University of Michigan, he directs Clarity Lab, one of the world’s most productive research labs in topics spanning artificial intelligence, large scale computing systems, and programming languages.

Among numerous contributions, Jason Mars has pioneered Jaseci, a cutting edge novel technology stack, and Jac, a programming language, that together raises the level of abstraction for the creation of sophisticated software powered by Generative AI. Within it’s first three years of development, it has already been adopted to power a half-dozen production platforms including Myca.ai, Tobu Life, and ZeroShotBot.

Jason Mars also founded a number of companies including most recently Jaseci Labs, a company dedicated to leveraging the open source innovations in Jaseci to help companies build world class AI technologies. His prior companies has had significant impacts bringing cutting edge AI solutions to over 20 million users in the Banking,  Healthcare, Automotive and Food Service industries. Mars track record includes raising over 62 million of venture capital dollars, and has grown business to $200m+ valuations. Mars was named Bank Innovations #2 Most Innovative CEO in Banking 2017, #4 in Top 11 Technologists in Voice AI 2019, Crain’s Detroit Business’ 2019 40 under 40 He has also been recognized with a CARAH Award in 2021 putting alongside Eric Holder, Andrew Young and Usain Bolt as prior winners.

Jason Mars is also the bestselling author of “Breaking Bots: Inventing A New Voice In The AI Revolution” where he expresses controversial insights on the surprising progress in AI and what the future holds while deconstructing the DNA that underlies true AI innovation and disruption. The book also serves to inspire aspiring leaders to build something that can change the world and tells Jason’s personal story of comeuppance.

Prior to University of Michigan, Jason was a professor at UCSD where he made a number of key contributions in Cloud Computing. He also worked at Google and Intel. Jason holds a PhD in Computer Science from UVA.

about:
I am a computer science professor and an entrepreneur who is passionate about innovation and transforming the world through technology. 

My research focuses on designing systems (architecture, compiler, runtime systems, distributed systems) for AI applications and Conversational AI systems. I have published more than 40 research papers at top venues for computer architecture, systems and AI such as ISCA, ASPLOS, MICRO and ACL. I have received awards including the Google research award, Facebook research award, JPMC faculty research award, ISCA/MICRO/ASPLOS Hall of Fame, and NSF Career award. I have graduated 10 Ph.D. students and mentored 6 post-doc fellows.

As an entrepreneur, I am currently a co-founder of myca.ai, a company that uses cutting-edge AI to supercharge personal productivity and growth. Before that, I co-founded Clinc, a conversational AI company that raised $70 million in VC funds and received several industry awards including Frost and Sullivan’s Technology Leadership Award in 2019, Gartner Cool Vendor in 2021, and Crain’s 40 under 40. I have led teams to design and deploy multiple large-scale AI solutions including USBank’s mobile virtual assistant for 6 million users.

name: Angela Hood
title: AI for B2B expert/ Forbes 50/50 List / INC Magazine Founder / Google Accelerated / IBM Think Keynote / Outstanding Alum@TAMU & Founder/Alum Uni of Cambridge: ideaSpace Founder/Alumni
about:
Hi everyone,

If you would like to connect with me and we don't know each other PLEASE reach out to contact@thiswayglobal.com and share what you would like to talk about so you can be connected to the right person on my team. You will have far greater success than reaching out to me here in LinkedIn.

My team will accept public speaking requests, customer invites and investor communications here.

Otherwise, feel free to "follow" me 

Hope you have a great day!
Angela

I am the Founder/CEO of ThisWay Global, an international, VC-backed HR tech company that was incubated at ideaSpace – University of Cambridge, UK, with new offices now in the US. ThisWay's team is comprised of experienced entrepreneurs, global PhD’s in the areas of machine learning and AI, as well as talent from across the globe. 

Over the last twenty years, I have founded and built three companies, in sectors that range from architecture to the licensing industry. The common core in each has been my ability to build consensus amongst stakeholders, whether they be individuals, businesses or international governments.

I am a recognized thought leader on the topics of "Diversity and ROI" and "AI in the new world of work."

Without knowing my history, it would seem that the leap from land development to tech development is a big one. However, ThisWay is the manifestation of my drive to solve big problems. As early as 1992, when I founded the Texas A&M College of Architecture Career Fair, through my award-winning land development plan in the early 2000s, I have always sought to find meaningful solutions to big challenges.

IBM Silver Business Partner

ideaSpace-University of Cambridge: Alumni Founder

name: Joel Wiegert
title: CEO at Artera Services
about:
Joel Wiegert is the CEO of Artera Services.  He is also a member of Artera’s Board of Directors.

Artera is a leading provider of essential infrastructure services.  With iron-clad operational excellence and governance practices, Artera is forging best-in class safety ratings.  Together, Artera builds the energy foundation that keeps America strong.

Through our operating companies, we build and modernize infrastructure, not only ensuring reliability today but facilitating sustainability for tomorrow.  Our core focus is serving the natural gas industry, while offering specialty services that support the the advancement of water, wastewater and other critical industries across a combined service territory of 41 states.  Founded in 2020, Artera provides scale and support to an integrated portfolio of legacy businesses that have been providing critical infrastructure solutions since 1953.  

We accomplish this with a dedicated team of 10,000 strong that deliver clean, energy efficient solutions to the customers and communities we serve to make peoples lives better.

Before becoming Artera CEO, Joel Wiegert was the CEO of Dayco where he successfully drove growth and profitability that resulted in a successful sale of the company.  Prior to this he was President at BorgWarner.

Joel Wiegert holds a BS in Mechanical Engineering from Illinois Institute of Technology, BA in Liberal Arts from Wheaton College and an MBA from Bowling Green State University, through an executive MBA Program sponsored by Dana Corporation.

name: Andre Esteva, PhD
title: Co-Founder & CEO, ArteraAI | TIME100 Health
about:
Andre Esteva, PhD, is an American entrepreneur and AI scientist. He is CEO and Co-Founder of ArteraAI, a medical AI company that personalizes cancer therapy, is standard of care (NCCN Guidelines), reimbursed by Medicare, and deployed internationally. ArteraAI was named a TIME 2024 Best Invention and selected for the World Economic Forum's Global Innovators as one of the world's top growth-stage companies.

He was named to the 2025 TIME100 Health list—TIME Magazine's recognition of the most influential people in health—and to Modern Healthcare's 40 Under 40 for 2025. He has co-founded four companies with a combined market cap of $2.2B. Previously, he was Head of Medical AI at Salesforce Research, and held engineering roles at Google Research, Sandia National Labs, and GE Healthcare.

His research has been cited over 25,000 times. His publications have appeared on the covers of Nature and Nature Medicine—the first to show AI matching doctors at diagnosis. His work is featured in Cell, The Lancet, NeurIPS, TIME, and widely covered by the WSJ, Fortune, BBC, The Economist, and hundreds of outlets.

He earned his PhD in Computer Vision at Stanford, and graduated with highest honors in Electrical Engineering and Pure Math from UT-Austin, where he was Engineering Valedictorian.

Harvard Business School professor Jeff Bussgang described me as "The 10x Founder" in The Experimentation Machine, his best-selling 2025 book.

Before becoming an entrepreneur, I paid my way through Columbia University as a 911 paramedic in the South Bronx, wildland fire fighter in Montana and a multimedia journalist for the New York Times.

I publish Accelerate or Die, a popular email newsletter about AI and the future of humanity.

🚍Since 2015 my life has been devoted to disrupting the mode of transportation that moves more people than any other: buses. I started with the private side, where I found a robust industry of small charter bus  companies, run by families, and that spoke to my upbringing. 

📱I wrote the first apps to allow riders to crowdsource routes and crowdfund bus trips. Then I architected a platform that networks together the fleets of bus companies. I have since built a team to develop the first managed marketplace to automate the business of buses. And it's all proven with millions of customers. Here's some of the accomplishments that I'm most proud of:

📈Led the company from complete shutdown during the pandemic shutdowns, now on track to nine figures in annual revenue

🚌Created the leading assetless bus service in the United States with millions of customers

🏈Partnered with the NFL to promote bus ride share to Super Bowl 57 without a sponsorship

💱Approved by SEC to go public by merging with a SPAC, but chose not to due to market conditions

💸Raised tens of millions of dollars in financing while maintaining an exceptional capital efficiency ratio 

⚽Launched a pilot expansion into Germany by partnering with Daimler, Elemental, and FC Bayern Basketball

🌍Internationalized our entire platform and partnered with one of the largest bus operators  to launch the bus ride share in Brazil

🔗Merged the leading US mass mobility companies into a single platform

👭Executed the largest mass mobilization in a generation with the Women's March on Washington, moving 50,000 people in a single day to gatherings around the country

💰Raised capital from the largest commercial vehicle manufacturer in the world 

🏆Accelerated the company in Detroit with Techstars

🎓Incubated the company at Yale University who became our first investor

name: Nosa Omoigui
title: CEO and Founder at Weave.AI
about:
Before joining Weave.AI, Nosa led large machine learning and personalization teams at Amazon and held senior roles at Microsoft Research (MSR), where he managed next-generation research and technology transfer initiatives for 200+ researchers globally. In his role at MSR, he also served as the primary liaison to senior Microsoft executives, including the CEO, bridging cutting-edge research with strategic business priorities. 

Now at Weave.AI, Nosa drives innovation in Agentic GenAI-Powered Decision Management, leveraging advanced generative AI agents to solve complex enterprise challenges. These AI agents provide real-time, 360-degree insights, risk identification, and actionable guidance, enabling organizations to make proactive, data-driven decisions in dynamic and high-stakes contexts. Weave.AI specializes in tackling intricate decision workflows that involve vast datasets, critical proprietary inputs, and evolving regulatory and competitive landscapes. The platform is purpose-built to ensure verifiable accuracy, deep domain knowledge, and explainable outputs—addressing the limitations of traditional AI solutions, such as hallucinations and lack of context.

Nosa holds 26 granted patents and over 50 pending patents in AI and related technologies. He earned graduate degrees in engineering from Carnegie Mellon University (CMU), where he was a General Instruments Fellow and winner of the Herbert L. Toor Best Thesis Award.

name: David Ferrucci
title: Chief AI Officer
about:
Dr. Dave Ferrucci is an award-winning Artificial Intelligence researcher and entrepreneur with a distinguished career spanning over 25 years. He is widely recognized as the inventor of IBM's Watson, having initiated and led the team that achieved its landmark Jeopardy! win in 2011. His enduring passion for advancing computers' abilities to fluently reason, learn, and communicate inspired him to establish Elemental Cognition (EC) in 2015. At EC, Dr. Ferrucci spearheaded the groundbreaking combination of large language models (LLMs) with the precision of formal reasoning agents. This innovative approach enables the use of ordinary language to reliably solve complex reasoning and optimization challenges, particularly for high-stakes operational problems that demand both linguistic fluency and rigorous mathematical exactitude for transparent, precise, and efficient solutions.

Presently, Dr. Ferrucci holds the position of Chief AI Officer at Unqork, where he is responsible for the strategic application and integration of reliable AI throughout the Unqork platform. He also maintains an active partnership with the Center for Global Enterprise, contributing to the AI research agenda for its Institute for Advanced Enterprise AI.

Prior to founding EC, Dr. Ferrucci spent over two decades at IBM Research, culminating in his recognition as an IBM Fellow and VP. Following his tenure at IBM through 2012, he directed the early AI strategy at Bridgewater Associates. Dr. Ferrucci earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science, specializing in AI, from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. He holds an impressive portfolio of over 100 patents and publications and has delivered keynote addresses at highly distinguished venues worldwide. His leadership extends to various esteemed roles, including a member of the Connecticut Academy of Science and Engineering and Managing Director of the Institute for Advanced Enterprise AI. Additionally, Dr. Ferrucci serves as an Adjunct Professor of Management and Organizations at the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. In recognition of his significant contributions to the field, Dr. Ferrucci was named to Insider's "The AI 100 2023: The top people in artificial intelligence."

name: Matthew Rooda
title: Founder/CEO of SwineTech; Host of the Popular Pig Podcast; Johns Hopkins MBA; Forbes 30U30
about:
I am Matthew Rooda, the Founder and CEO of SwineTech, Inc., where I lead a team dedicated to revolutionizing animal agriculture through workforce management and human-centered automation on a global scale. Our flagship product, PigFlow®, is at the forefront of this transformation, streamlining and automating routine and emergency care, communication, daily workflows, administrative tasks, and herd diagnostics. With PigFlow®, we empower pork producers to maximize their resources, enhance operational efficiencies, boost employee engagement, and significantly improve pig care.

My journey through genetics, pre-medicine, and animal agriculture has ignited a deep-seated passion for integrating technology into livestock care. Since laying the groundwork for SwineTech in 2015, I have helped navigate SwineTech through pivotal milestones, including our participation in the Pearse Lyons Accelerator in Ireland, raising over $12 million in venture capital, and expanding our presence across multiple continents. My commitment to innovation and progress in animal agriculture has also earned me a place on the Forbes 30 under 30 list and recognition as a speaker and thought leader at numerous industry events.

In addition to my role at SwineTech, I host the Popular Pig Podcast, a platform where I connect with a vibrant community of experts, enthusiasts, and professionals. Together, we delve into the intricacies of swine production and entrepreneurship, sharing insights and best practices. My genuine enthusiasm for the subject and my ability to engage with my audience have established me as a trusted and respected figure in the agricultural community, further affirming my position as a forward-thinking leader and advocate for innovation in animal agriculture.

name: Alon N. Cohen
title: Serial Entrepreneur | Founder & Executive Chairman at nsKnox and Intezer | Founder, Former Chairman & CEO at CyberArk
about:
I am an Israeli serial high-tech Entrepreneur, Novelist and Inventor. 

Together with my partner and high-school friend Udi Mokady, I founded CyberArk Software Ltd (Nasdaq:CYBR) in my basement in Modi’in, Israel and spent 15 years with the company as its Chairman and first CEO, turning an idea into a leading global cyber security company.

Currently, I’m the Founder, Chairman and CEO of nsKnox Technologies, Ltd, a Fintech-Security Company, focusing on helping banks and corporations to prevent corporate payments fraud. 

I am also the Founder and Executive Chairman of Intezer Labs, a cyber security company, protecting enterprises and their cloud infrastructure from advanced cyber attacks.

Prior to that, I led the turn-around of FilesX, a storage company, and the formation of a new product category of continuous remote office protection (CDP for remote offices), leading to its acquisition by IBM.

name: Jordan Noone
title: Executive Chairman at Zoo // General Partner at Embedded Ventures
about:
Co-Founder, General Partner of Embedded Ventures
Co-Founder, Executive Chairman at Zoo
President's Leadership Council, University of Southern California
Founder / Former CTO, Relativity Space

Contact:
Email • jordan@embedded.ventures
Website • https://www.jdnoone.com/

Jordan Noone is an entrepreneur and investor. He co-founded Embedded Ventures, Zoo, and Relativity Space.

He invests as a General Partner at Embedded Ventures, an early stage venture capital firm investing in deep tech. He leads portfolio company Zoo as Executive Chairman, the world's only company that develops full stack generative AI hardware design tools.

He founded Relativity Space in 2015, he led it as Chief Technology Officer for five years, pioneering the development of 3D-printed rockets and launch vehicles. Relativity Space was part of Y Combinator's Winter 2016 batch and is now led by former Google CEO Eric Schmidt.

He has had a lifelong interest in aerospace and began designing and building spaceflight hardware at the University of Southern California. Jordan led USC's Rocket Propulsion Lab and became the first student and youngest individual in the world to receive Federal Aviation Administration clearance to fly a rocket into space.

Jordan is still involved with USC's Rocket Propulsion Lab advising student members, is a member of the USC President's Leadership Council, and sponsors the USC K-12 STEM Center's Project Payload.

He received a BS in Aerospace Engineering from the University of Southern California, and lives in the greater Los Angeles area.

name: Tim Ellis
title: Cofounder, Board Member, & fmr CEO at Relativity Space
about:
Relativity Space is building humanity’s multiplanetary future. We invented a new approach to design, build, and fly our own rockets, starting with Terran 1 – the world’s first entirely 3D printed rocket, and Terran R - a 20,000 kg payload fully reusable rocket built on the same 3D printing factory platform as Terran 1. As a vertically integrated technology platform, Relativity is at the forefront of an inevitable shift toward software-defined manufacturing. By fusing 3D printing, artificial intelligence, and autonomous robotics, we are pioneering the factory of the future. Disrupting 60 years of aerospace, Relativity offers a radically simplified supply chain, building a rocket with 100x fewer parts in less than 60 days. We believe in a future where interplanetary life fundamentally expands the possibilities for human experience. Our long-term vision is to upgrade humanity’s industrial base on Earth and on Mars.

Previously responsible for bringing metal 3D printing into Jeff Bezos’ Blue Origin, and a propulsion development engineer on Crew Capsule RCS thrusters, BE-4, and New Glenn. Alumni of USC and played a leadership role in launching the first student designed and built rocket into near space. Testified to the US Senate on commercial space policy and is the youngest member on the National Space Council User’s Advisory Group by nearly 2 decades, and directly advises the United States White House on all space policy. Is recognized as part of the TIME 100 Next most influential people in the world, 3x 30 Under 30 from Forbes, Business Insider, and Inc Magazine, and is an MIT 35 Tech Innovators Under 35 recipient. Relativity is backed by Tiger Global, Fidelity, Baillie Gifford, Bond, Tribe Capital, Playground Global, General Catalyst, XN, 3L, Social Capital, Y Combinator, Mark Cuban, USC, and Stanford.

name: Mike Myer
title: CEO & Founder at Quiq
about:
I like to build things – code, software products, teams and companies.  There’s no greater satisfaction than getting stuff done!

I’m a software engineer by training and have worked in Bell Labs Research early in my career.  I’ve spent a much of my career building RightNow (the first SaaS enterprise customer service platform), where I led Engineering from the beginning, through our IPO in 2004 and eventual acquisition in 2012 by Oracle for nearly $2B.  Subsequently, I ran Product and Engineering at Dataminr a NYC-based event discovery and data science startup.  I was a Director at Cradlepoint, the leader in 5G broadband networking, until Ericsson acquired the company in Nov 2020 for $1.1B.

My company, Quiq, is designing the platform for the next generation of communication between people and brands. People text all the time, but communicating with companies requires stepping back to the ways of the past - phone and email.  Quiq's Conversational Platform modernizes customer communications with Conversational AI and an asynchronous contact center built for Enterprise scale.

Quiq is headquartered in Bozeman, Montana, the “Last Best Place”.  I split my time between Bozeman and New York City, which couldn’t be more different, but also another "Best Place".
speaking_engagements: Speaker at All Access: AI + Data in CX conference; Guest on Tech Talks podcast discussing customer service and AI
notable_achievements: Seven MTV Movie & TV Awards; Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Writing for a Variety Series; Screen Actors Guild Award; Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame (2002); Officer of the Order of Canada (2017); MTV Generation Award (2007); Created and starred in the Wayne's World, Austin Powers, and Shrek franchises
reasoning: Mike Myer demonstrates a clear pattern of building and scaling multiple billion-dollar companies. He was a key executive (Engineering leader) at RightNow from founding through IPO and $2B acquisition by Oracle. He then held senior roles at Dataminr and was a Director at Cradlepoint which had a $1.1B exit to Ericsson. He's now founding CEO of Quiq, showing a consistent pattern of involvement in successful enterprise software companies. His track record spans multiple decades with proven ability to scale technical organizations and achieve major exits.

name: William O'Neill
title: Executive Leader: Enterprise SaaS, AI & Cloud Innovation | Building High-Performing Global Teams & Delivering Resilient, Scalable Technology Solutions | Co-founder & Strategic Growth Driver
location: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
about:
As a seasoned Technology Executive and Co-founder, I've dedicated over two decades to architecting and scaling transformative Enterprise SaaS and AI solutions. My journey includes co-founding Quiq and spearheading its evolution from a visionary concept to a category-leading enterprise AI platform, achieving significant revenue milestones and securing substantial venture funding, all while pioneering market-leading LLM-powered agentic AI experiences.

My Core Focus: Driving Innovation & Impact at Scale
I thrive on building and leading world-class, global technology organizations that deliver highly resilient, secure (consistent 99.998% uptime, zero incidents over a decade), and scalable systems. My expertise lies in:

* Enterprise AI Transformation: Pioneering the development and deployment of dozens of advanced agentic AI solutions, fundamentally changing how enterprises engage with customers and driving considerable new revenue streams (representing a major portion of recent ARR growth).

* SaaS Platform Excellence: Architecting and scaling cloud-native microservices platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) from the ground up, achieving exceptional customer retention (e.g., 106% NRR) and operational stability.

* Empowering Leadership & Culture: Cultivating high-trust, high-accountability environments where exceptional talent is empowered to deliver their best. This philosophy has directly resulted in industry-leading team stability (e.g., <1% annual voluntary attrition) and the rapid delivery of market-differentiating products. My approach was pivotal in Quiq's strategic shift to an agentic AI leader, fostering deep collaboration and a fail-forward, growth mindset.

Strategic & Forward-Looking Approach
I excel at the intersection of technology execution, AI product strategy, and market leadership. Whether it's leading M&A technical integrations that significantly boost revenue, serving as a trusted technical advisor to boards and investors, or evangelizing technology to secure major enterprise deals, my focus is on translating complex technical capabilities into tangible business value and strategic advantage. I am passionate about solving complex, meaningful challenges with software and am driven to shape the future of AI in the enterprise.

I am always open to connecting with fellow leaders and innovators to discuss how technology, particularly AI, can drive the next wave of business transformation.

name: Martin Zych
title: Financial modeling & data analytics expert for high growth companies. Follow me for posts about FP&A, Finance & Accounting Humor and tech.
about:
Before becoming the CEO at Jirav, I spent 10 years working in finance, accounting, and tech.

I’ve worked as a Controller, Finance Director, and CFO. I helped multiple businesses grow from early startups to established corporations. Both in-house and with outsourced teams. And helped raise over $250 million in funding for clients across the globe.

During my time working in diverse environments, I came to realize that financial planning and analysis were outdated and cluttered, causing finance teams to lose a good night’s sleep.

There was a clear lack of efficient solutions to simplify important processes like planning, budgeting, forecasting, and reporting. Existing tools were too expensive and complicated, mostly designed for big enterprises. It was clear to me that smaller and mid-sized businesses needed an easy, intuitive, and data-driven platform for financial planning and analysis (FP&A).

Recognizing this gap, I took on the challenge and created Jirav.

Jirav is designed to help the very people who run small and mid-sized businesses, including founders, owners, accounting firms, and part-time CFO teams.

I'm proud to say that Jirav has already helped thousands of businesses better understand their financial situation, allowing them to make informed decisions. Jirav helps businesses see their financial and operational data clearly. It uses technology to simplify budgeting and forecasting and offers insights they can act on faster.

name: Sarah M Worthy

about:
On LinkedIn, I share a mix of content focused on leadership, healthcare management, knowledge work and then a smattering of random but really interesting and smart stories I enjoy reading. I also often promote the amazing work we're doing at DoorSpace®.

I'm the CEO and Founder of DoorSpace® - a SaaS company that is transforming the way healthcare organizations retain and develop clinical talent. I've spent the majority of my career working inside early-growth stage B2B tech startups and I love helping businesses solve their biggest data problems!

Which is why I developed DoorSpace® to enable healthcare organizations to solve their clinical turnover problem. Our innovative technology “flips the script” on the question of “what makes people leave?”, and instead asks “what makes people stay?”. 

We’ve built a platform specifically designed to make it easier for organizations to create a workplace where people want to stay. 

With our solution, healthcare organizations are better able to: 
* Know your people, and build strong relationships with them 
* Reduce friction/frustration in clinician’s workflow by eliminating wasteful administrative tasks
* Support your people more effectively in their career development

*** All while dramatically reducing the amount of time your clinicians and your administrative team is spending on manual data entry and paper pushing.*** 

Our free mobile app (built specifically for clinicians to help them stay on top of their careers) is available here: 
iPhone/Apple Store: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/doorspace-app/id1598482275
Android/Google Play: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.doorspace.application

title: AI Innovator & Executive | Ex-Microsoft | CEO/CTO & GTM Leader - $100M+ performance agreements | Scaled Enterprise SaaS Deployments to Millions  | YC Founder, AI Advisor, Board Member
about:
I'm an AI technology and business executive with 20+ years of experience building and scaling global platforms — from Microsoft to venture-backed startups. I've held leadership roles in both engineering and GTM teams focused on AI and LLM based SaaS platforms across enterprise software, dev tools, and AI infrastructure. Also served as CEO, CTO, and board member, leading cross-functional teams through product development, GTM, and growth.

At Microsoft, I led key initiatives in SharePoint Cloud, Visual Studio Dev, and Windows App Store strategy, products that reached over 190M million people. Later, as co-founder and CEO of a healthcare AI startup, I raised from top VCs (YC, Draper and others), secured performance based contracts worth $100M+ in enterprise deals, and drove to 8 figure revenues (with profitability) through large-scale Nationwide deployments with clients such as Anthem, Optum, Kaiser Permanente, UCSF, Dignity Health, Sharecare, and others. 

I serve on the Boards of Federation AI and advise Fortune 500 C Suite and high growth companies. Most recently, I’ve focused on building ground up AI platforms and infusing them with enterprise software to bridge product, GTM, and verticals —helping enterprises unlock new growth opportunities with AI. 

Along the way, I've written and co-authored various papers on AI/LLMs, distributed systems, and HPC and have received various AI awards. I've shared my experience through op-eds and thought leadership articles on AI's impact with Kathy Ireland (Bloomberg International), Forbes, Fortune, Nasdaq, World Economic Forum, Newsweek, and CNBC. 

I'm still hands on technology and love doing AI hobby projects - currently building a text to code enterprise platform, a humanoid robot at home, 3d printing. Beyond my professional pursuits, I find fulfillment in exploring the world (over 30 countries and counting), scuba diving, hiking, literature, and cherishing moments with my family.

I thrive at the intersection of innovation and execution, and I’m currently helping executives and enterprises explore AI transformations, GTM, and growth. I’m always open to exchanging ideas with fellow executives, product leaders, and investors working on transformational tech. Feel free to connect or reach out directly.

name: Alexander Harmsen

about:
Alexander Harmsen is an experienced tech entrepreneur, CEO, board member, and advisor, having founded multiple successful companies and organizations. His work has seen him produce multiple AI-driven products, scale sales globally, hire world-class executives, manage hundreds of employees, raise over $30M in venture capital, and successfully navigate an M&A process. He is focused on hard problems that have a meaningful impact on the world, knowing that very few others are in a unique position to take on such challenges.‍

He is currently CEO & Founder at Global Predictions, a company bringing hedge fund inspired AI-based socio-economic models to mainstream investors through its flagship AI Financial Advisor product portfoliopilot.com. He formerly founded, built, and sold Iris Automation, an AI modeling software company focused on perception and navigation software. As an advisor, he helps companies like computational biopharma company VeriSIM Life, whose AI-based technology models the entire human body and is used by pharma giants to accelerate the drug development cycle.‍

Alexander is recognized on both Inc' and Forbes' 30 Under 30 lists. He holds a degree in Engineering Physics and Economics from Canada’s top institute, the University of British Columbia, and has a number of patents and published papers to his name. He is also a Loran scholar and graduate of Y-Combinator. He has earned a pilot license and in previous work has built AI perception systems for NASA’s Mars Helicopter, a drone to accompany the rover to explore Mars’ surface autonomously.

As a founder, technical manager and engineer with two decades of experience, I've helped raise over $100M in funding; authored 26 issued patents; built and managed teams of over 50 people in different disciplines; and engineered products that have shipped in the millions.

As a founder and CTO of Accel Robotics, I've raised funds; developed a technical path (invented where required); hired an amazing, multi-disciplinary team; and delivered a solution with class leading performance, at the lowest operating and hardware cost.

I hold a PhD in Bioengineering from the University of California San Diego, where I developed techniques to better understand how biological networks are connected and communicate.  Before that, I developed special micro-fluidic printing systems at Hewlett Packard, and worked as a software QA engineer for Biosym/Molecular Simulations (Dassault).

name: Alli Webb
title: Founder and Co-CEO of Messy. Co-Founder of Drybar, Squeeze and Becket + Quill. N.Y. Times + USA TODAY Bestselling Author.
about:
Alli Webb is an N.Y. Times and USA Today Bestselling Author, Co-Founder of Drybar, Squeeze and Becket + Quill. After spending 15 years as a professional hair stylist, Webb left the hair industry in 2005 to start a family, but after being a stay-at-home mom for 5 years, Webb decided to find a way to continue pursuing the creative side of hairstyling at a new-mom pace. She began offering affordable in-home blowout services to her mommy friends, which quickly expanded into a mobile operation by 2009. In 2010, Webb opened the first Drybar in Brentwood, CA. 10 years later and over 150+ locations across the U.S., Webb’s Drybar has exploded into a nationally recognized and highly sought-after brand. 

Webb diversified the Drybar brand, creating a line of products and tools sold at popular retailers such as Nordstrom, Sephora, and Ulta, recently selling this product division to Helen of Troy for $255 million. Webb has been on the cover of Inc Magazine’s “How I Did This” issue, named the “100 Most Creative People in Business” by Fast Company, featured on Fortune magazine’s “40 Under 40” list, Marie Claire’s “Most Fascinating Women” and recently Inc. magazine recognized her as one of “The 100 Women Building America’s Most Innovative and Ambitious Businesses.” Webb appeared on season 10 of ABC’s Emmy nominated hit show “Shark Tank” as a guest shark in 2019. 

Staying true to her signature approach to beauty and self-care, Squeeze, follows suit in the affordable luxury space as innovative massage concept that lets you book and pay online - the latest extension of her expanding empire where she operates as an active angel investor, advisor and co-founder. Squeeze’s first location is in the Los Angeles neighborhood of Studio City with several other locations across the country set to open in the next year. 

Webb also joined forces with LA based jewelry designer Meredith Quill to build yet another new brand, now known as Becket + Quill. 

Webb is resides in Los Angeles, CA.

name: Andrew Sellers
title: Enterprise Technology Executive | Cybersecurity, Distributed Systems & Artificial Intelligence
about:
As an architect of enterprise SaaS platforms and products, I’ve spent my career at the confluence of theory and practice of data and AI-enabled applications—applying large-scale data engineering, infrastructure development, and cybersecurity controls to the development and delivery of secure and reliable information services.

During my career, I’ve worked shoulder-to-shoulder with highly accomplished business architects and technology innovators to tame data complexity and help decision-makers identify growth insights and manage risk.

Collectively, I’ve been privileged to lead teams of up to 200 people in building and delivering cloud and physical enterprise technologies and data-intensive services to millions of users worldwide—drawing on deep technical expertise and business experience to empower resilient organizations and discover untapped value.

My work today draws on computer science education and management experience with the U.S. Air Force, where I served as a senior cyberspace operations officer—applying strategic and technical leadership to reinforce the organization’s international network infrastructure and data services capabilities. 

I’ve also published more than one-hundred patents and publications, with notable peer-reviewed articles on automated data extraction and cybersecurity as well as patents on applying artificial intelligence and data engineering to risk management solutions.

My work and leadership wouldn’t have been possible without the camaraderie of incredible colleagues, talented team members, and engaged customers—fueling my belief in creating cultures of ownership, intellectual curiosity, and inclusion.

name: Jason Crabtree
title: CEO at QOMPLX, Inc.
about:
Jason Crabtree is the CEO of QOMPLX, where he leads an effort focused on unified Identity Threat Detection and Response, Attack Surface Monitoring and broader open XDR capabilities that include real-time streaming analytics. He has an extensive background in developing next-generation operational risk management and situational awareness tools and information sharing in multi-spatial, multi-temporal distributed systems across a variety of civilian, defense and intelligence applications.  

QOMPLX harnesses data to provide unified visibility into cyber risks and ensure trust in identity. QOMPLX solutions reduce cyber risk and attack surfaces by both mapping exposures and performing real-time detection of attacks. This increases network observability by closing the largest remaining gaps in cybersecurity: identity verification, attack surface management, cross-tool data fusion, and data interoperability. QOMPLX defends some of the world's most renowned brands by re-establishing trust for client organisations, assuring authentication, and enabling confident security decisions. 

Jason previously served as a Special Advisor to senior leaders in the defense cyber community, with responsibilities ranging from policy advice and operational support, to research direction and technology transition with partners across the Intelligence and Defense enterprise.  

He is a licensed professional engineer and complex adaptive systems aficionado with a strong background in modeling, simulation, and data analysis who is currently focused at the nexus of cyber security, critical infrastructure, and operational risk management. He also serves as a contributor and consultant for global strategic analysis and geopolitical risk management firms including Oxford Analytica.  

He has been an invited participant, panelist and speaker on energy, risk management, finance, and security for organizations including the Casualty Actuarial Society, FS-ISAC, Financial Services Roundtable, the Center for New American Security, the Markle Foundation, the Ditchley Foundation, the Gridwise Architecture Council, and RAND in both the United States and United Kingdom.  Jason has also worked extensively on large-scale cyberspace modeling, analysis, and risk management technology research, to include supporting work within the Defense Advance Research Agency's cyberspace portfolio. Jason was also a 2014 Cyber Policy Fellow with the Madison Policy Forum in New York City and a former Cyber Fellow for New America.

He is also an inventor on ~90 US Patents (issued/allowed) with dozens more pending.

name: Jarrod Yuster
title: CEO & Founder at Pico
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Jarrod S. Yuster is the founder and Chief Executive Officer of Pico, a leading infrastructure services provider, focused on today’s global capital markets community. Pico’s mission is to empower the electronic trading community to access the global capital markets through flexible, scalable, ultra-low latency technology solutions. Pico’s client base encompasses a full spectrum of market participants - banks, broker dealers, technology vendors, asset managers, trading firms, family offices, hedge funds and liquidity venues. Pico was founded in 2009 and has grown to over 130 employees in three offices in New York, Chicago and London. 

Mr. Yuster has over 20 years of experience in institutional trading. Previously, Mr. Yuster was Global Head of Merrill Lynch's Electronic Trading, where he oversaw the business from inception in 2002 through February, 2009. He was responsible for sales, trading, risk, execution service, product development and quantitative analytics for these products worldwide. His trading products reached over 85 global equity markets. His team built electronic and quantitative trading strategies and provided consulting to clients on execution, transaction cost analysis, trading technology, commission/exchange fee management, and market structure. Mr. Yuster has extensive experience starting trading businesses and building trading technology products. Prior to working on Wall Street, Mr. Yuster worked as a product engineer, performing semiconductor research at Intel Corporation. 

At present, Mr. Yuster is a member of the Yale School of Engineering Leadership Council and also serves on the Operating Board for the Yale Entrepreneurial Institute (YEI), providing mentorship to Yale student entrepreneurs. Mr. Yuster is an active early stage investor in and advisor for numerous technology and services companies. Mr. Yuster received his M.S. in electrical engineering from Columbia University and a B.S. in electrical engineering from Yale University.

name: David Stiff
title: Entertainment + Tech Leader | CEO at Vault AI
about:
David Stiff is an international media and technology executive and entrepreneur with experience spanning North America, the Middle East, and Europe. He is the co-founder and CEO of Vault, where he has spent a decade pioneering the use of artificial intelligence in the entertainment sector, delivering insights to Fortune 500 companies.

David has worked as an executive producer, writer and development executive across film and TV. In 2015, his time in Israel's high-tech sector inspired the idea to blend AI with creative storytelling, leading to Vault's founding with some of Israel’s top AI engineers. 

With no funding or customer base, David journeyed to Los Angeles to bring Vault to market. His vision for using AI as a decision making companion quickly won the trust of top studios and network executives, who became Vault’s first clients.

Today, Vault is a leader in predictive analytics for entertainment, working across thousands of films and series. The company’s groundbreaking technology has revolutionized production, greenlighting, and marketing processes.

Under David’s leadership, Vault has achieved significant milestones:

- Raised over $10M in venture funding from corporate VCs in media and traditional venture capital firms
- Grew revenue from zero to millions annually
- Onboarded premier clients from top studios, networks, and streaming services
- Oversaw a tech stack that housed over 300+ AI models, working closely with clients to translate them into AI products used on 1000+ film and television titles 
- Recruited a top-tier C-level team and advisory board featuring industry veterans with C suite experience  at studios and major production companies
reasoning: David Stiff demonstrates characteristics of a proven operator with significant executive experience and demonstrated ability to scale a venture-backed company. While he hasn't had a major exit yet, he has successfully built Vault AI from zero to a multi-million dollar revenue business with significant venture funding and enterprise clients. His experience spans both creative (entertainment industry) and technical (AI) domains, with proven ability to recruit top talent and secure major enterprise customers. The $10M+ in funding and growth to millions in revenue places him solidly at L4, but not yet at L5 which would require >$50M in funding or clear path to major exit.

name: John Jansen
title: Senior Staff Engineer at Primer.ai
about:
I’m a Senior Staff Engineer at Primer Technologies, where I design and scale systems that turn raw data into actionable insight—fast. My background spans decades of building software and internet infrastructure, with a focus on backend architecture, data pipelines, and applied machine learning.

I’ve led investigations into online misinformation, including early work during the 2016 U.S. election that was featured by NPR, The Dr. Oz Show, and others. That work also led to collaborations with TED Fellows, helping them map the global TED network.

Before Primer, I was a Senior Software Engineer at Quid, where I helped shape the core of their big data analytics platform. Prior to that, I architected digital platforms for 30+ radio stations at MediaWorks NZ, building systems that powered some of New Zealand’s largest media brands.

Originally trained in graphic arts, I cut my teeth building early content management systems and quickly moved into large-scale systems work. Since then, I’ve worked across industries and continents, always staying close to the intersection of people, data, and code.

My work has been featured on NPR, Full Frontal with Samantha Bee, Radio NZ, and The New Zealand Herald. Outside of work, you’ll usually find me outside with my family—or tinkering on a side project that’s a little ahead of its time.

name: Dan Mallin
title: Certified EOS Implementer® | Facilitator | Teacher | Coach - Helping people get what they want from their business | AI Expert | Business Consultant and CEO-Founder of Capacity's Answer Engine®(Lucy.ai) & MNCup.org
about:
As a serial entrepreneur, Board Member, Founder & CEO of Lucy, Founder of the Minnesota Cup, and Certified EOS Implementor, Dan specializes in driving business growth through AI innovation and strategic leadership. I have successfully founded and exited five technology companies, earning six U.S. patents in AI along the way. My passion lies in empowering fellow entrepreneurs to achieve their vision using the Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS), a framework that has helped me and my clients transform their businesses. Dan is passionate about helping entrepreneurs and small business owners increase and maximize their growth while spending less time drowning in the day to day operations. Are you an entrepreneur who is interested in doing more of what you love, being fairly compensated while having the time for other passions? You can gain control and live your ideal life and Dan will help you get there! Let's connect if you're looking to maximize your company's value or need a speaker who can inspire and guide your leadership team.

Dan created Lucy, an AI-powered enterprise knowledge management SaaS software platform that transforms how the Fortune 1000 leverages their unstructured data.

Formerly the CEO & Founder of Magnet 360, Dan helped companies leverage marketing and technology to provide competitive differentiation and engagement for outcomes. Decades of experience amplify Dan’s character as a results-focused business leader, where outcomes matter more than the process or toolset. “Our clients expect results; we deliver.”

Founder of MNCup.org, the largest statewide business competition.
Board of Homes Center for Entrepreneurship, Carlson School of Management, University of Minnesota

Dan sits on multiple private company boards, bringing a differentiating viewpoint, helping evaluate opportunities, & facilitating governance as an agent of change. He has been recognized as the 2020 AACSB Influential Leader, Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year, Business Journal’s 40 under 40, Twin Cities Business 200 People to Know, & the Minnesota Business’ Real Power 50. Dan has also served as a chief officer at multiple companies recognized as ‘best places to work’ in multiple markets nationally. The aggregate speaks to Dan as a practitioner, a visionary leader, an intuitive business person, and a mentor to many, a role in which he takes great pride.

name: Raj Chowdhury
title: Blockchain Pioneer | Speaker | Investor | Author | CEO HashCash & PayBito
about:
Raj Chowdhury is the CEO of HashCash Consultants and a Blockchain pioneer.
Chowdhury pioneered the first interbank Trade Finance and Remittance implementations of Blockchain between two of the largest global banks. He is an eminent voice on Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies globally and actively engages with policymakers in this area. He is a contributor to Economic Times, Business World, Business Standard, CNNMoney and advises industry leaders in adoption of Blockchain.

He is the author of the books ‘The Dark Secret of the Silicon Valley’ and ‘Special Housing Unit’.

His portfolio of startups are creating Blockchain solutions for financial, supply chain companies, payment processors and cryptocurrency exchanges.

Raj co-founded Power Enhancing Devices, which designed Piezoelectric NEMS applications to harness environmental energy for portable devices.

He co-founded Locus International to generate mapping data for GPS navigation.

Raj had been a research associate at MIT’s Microsystems Technology Lab. He went to Tufts University, Santa Clara University and the Fletcher School of International Law and Diplomacy for MS, MBA and other certifications.

He is a member of Asha Silicon Valley, a nonprofit committed to education for children in emerging countries.

name: Hao Li
title: CEO & Co-Founder of Pinscreen | Professor at MBZUAI | AI VFX Supervisor | MIT 35 Under 35 | DARPA ISAT | Deepfaker
about: Hao Li is the CEO and Co-Founder of Pinscreen, a Los Angeles-based startup renowned for its pioneering generative AI technologies in visual effects, dubbing, and digital humans. He is also Professor at the Mohamed bin Zayed University of Artificial Intelligence and the Director of the MBZUAI Metaverse Center. Previously, Hao was a Distinguished Fellow with the Computer Vision Group at UC Berkeley and an Associate Professor of Computer Science at the University of Southern California, where he directed the USC Institute for Creative Technologies. He has also been a visiting professor at Weta Digital, a research lead at Industrial Light & Magic / Lucasfilm, and a postdoctoral fellow at Columbia and Princeton Universities. Hao’s research lies at the intersection of computer vision, computer graphics, and machine learning with a focus on photorealistic human digitization, real-time performance capture, immersive telepresence, and generative video synthesis and manipulation. He is widely recognized for his groundbreaking work in real-time 3D facial tracking, which has led to the technology behind Apple's Animoji, the digital recreation of Paul Walker in the movie Furious 7, and the first real-time deepfake face-swapping technology based. His research on facial reenactment has been widely adopted in Hollywood, driving advancements in photorealistic digital doubles and de-aging effects. Additionally, he is known for pioneering production-grade visual dubbing solutions, which have made possible the first fully AI-lip-synced foreign language films and TV shows. His algorithms on deformable shape registration have not only advanced the field of data-driven facial animation and human body modeling, but also improved the radiation treatment for cancer patients all over the world. Hao has received numerous accolades, including being named a Top 35 Innovator Under 35 by MIT Technology Review in 2013. He has been awarded the Google Faculty Award, the Okawa Foundation Research Grant, and the Andrew and Erna Viterbi Early Career Chair. In 2018, he won the Office of Naval Research (ONR) Young Investigator Award, and in 2019, he was named to the DARPA ISAT Study Group. He won the ACM SIGGRAPH Real-Time Live! “Best in Show” Award in 2020, and an Epic Megagrant in 2021. Hao has been a speaker at the World Economic Forum in Davos (2020) and was featured in the inaugural season of Amazon’s documentary series re:MARS Luminaries in 2022. Hao earned his PhD from ETH Zurich and his MSc from the University of Karlsruhe (TH).

name: Alex Capecelatro
title: CEO at Josh.ai
about:
Experienced leader in AI

*NOTE* – I get a lot of messages here on LinkedIn, most of which is spam, and therefore won't likely see or respond here. Please email me if you'd like to chat. Thanks! – *NOTE*

Alex is deeply passionate about the intersection of design and technology. His interests span IoT, UX design, machine learning, AI, smart home, and pushing the boundary on what's possible. 

Alex had his first success in middle school when he and his brother launched a consumer BMX website that quickly grew in popularity. His interests evolved towards physics, science, and engineering, and with a focus on impact he left high school early to work as a research scientist for the government. 

After working on nanotechnology and bioengineering projects for the Naval Research Lab, Harvard, Sandia National Lab, NASA, and UCLA, Alex consulted for the X Prize Foundation and Aerogel Technologies. With a desire to bridge his engineering interests and consumer products, Alex joined Fisker Automotive full time. It was at Fisker that Alex saw firsthand the power of combining brilliant engineering and elegant design to inspire consumers.

In 2011 Alex founded Hyphos Inc, a software company based in LA. With a passion to take what he learned in consumer product design and technology, Alex built a team aimed at bridging the online-offline gap in order to connect people in a more meaningful way. His first product, At The Pool, was featured in the likes of Forbes, LA Times, and Fast Company, and boasted members in more than 120 countries across 3,500 cities. Yeti, a local recommendation product that emerged from At The Pool passed 3,000,000 swipes in just the first few months.

In 2015, Alex launched Josh.ai with co-founder Tim Gill, aiming to revolutionize society's interaction with our environments. Initially focused on luxury smart homes, Josh.ai boasts the industry-leading natural language processing engine and home control platform, alongside its award-winning hardware.

Alex sits on the UCLA Engineering Alumni board, the CEDIA board, the StartOut board, and has been a fellow with the LA Coalition for Jobs and the Economy. In his spare time Alex is an avid hiker, cyclist, skydiver, and skier.

notable_achievements: Raised over a billion dollars for Fisker Automotive; Developed innovative smart home automation with Josh.ai
reasoning: Alex Capecelatro demonstrates a strong track record as a proven operator with multiple ventures and significant technical experience. name: Dean Stephens
title: Senior Advisor
about:
I am a successful serial entrepreneur who now advises executives and organizations on how to grow to a successful exit and become the market leader in a competitive industry segment.  I have over 30 years of experience in the healthcare industry, first as a management consultant with Deloitte and then as a founding CEO of successful start-up ventures.  My passion lies in strategic market analysis, building quality products and capabilities, and honing business and financial models that drive toward great outcomes.  I enjoy working with highly motivated, ethical people who want to win.

My startup ventures covered many dimensions: Enterprise SaaS, SEO-leading consumer media, AI components NLP and ML, scalable work flow solutions, and efficient company operations.  My strengths include board management, creating effective advisory boards and teams, establishing novel performance reward systems, designing effective customer contracts, developing investor networks, and raising capital.  I believe in tracking to profitability and strong margins through multi-year contracts and high customer retention.  

Company Overviews: 
Healthline Networks (2005-2015), as a rich content media company, targeted online health information seekers with empathetic quality content and unique-to-market online applications (drug search, symptom search, etc.)  Our revenue per pageview led the entire online market through our life science industry partners.  Using advanced NLP technology, we also designed and delivered search-based applications to leading health plans and providers.  Healthline became a profitable, high growth company that we sold to a top tier private equity firm, Summit Partners. 

Talix (2016-2021) delivered SaaS solutions to the fast-growing value based care market.  We targeted both health plans and provider groups and systems using innovative AI-supported workflow applications.  Competing with large incumbent players as well as start-ups, we focused on building a best in class business solution that encompassed advanced technologies, customer success, partnerships and innovative pricing to win.  In 2021, TA Associates and Francisco Partners acquired Talix and merged it into Edifecs, a portfolio company.

Prior to becoming an entrepreneur, I spent over a dozen years in Deloitte’s management consulting practice, with half that time as a principal.  My consulting focused on building new organizations and sub-divisions for leading healthcare companies facing managed care competition.
speaking_engagements: Board member at Caregiver Action Network; Board member at Trualta
notable_achievements: Founded one of the largest private oil producers in the U.S.; Built company with drilling rights on over 500,000 acres mainly in Texas
reasoning: Dean Stephens demonstrates a strong track record as a serial entrepreneur with multiple successful exits in the healthcare technology space. He has founded and led two significant companies (Healthline Networks and Talix) to successful exits with major private equity firms. His companies showed clear market innovation, particularly Healthline Networks' leading position in health information and Talix's AI-supported workflow solutions. The exits to Summit Partners and TA Associates/Francisco Partners indicate substantial company valuations. His 12+ years as a Deloitte principal adds credibility to his operational expertise. While he could potentially qualify for L7, the exact exit values aren't specified, so a conservative L6 classification is warranted.

name: Sarah T. Khan
title: Operations & Growth Healthtech Leader | Clinical Transformation, Customer Strategy, Enterprise Scaling B2B/2C | DaVita, Optum, SaaS and AI Startups, UCLA | Advisor, Speaker, Women's Health Founder
about:
Sarah is a leader with a unique blend of expertise in operational scaling, clinical transformation, and commercialization. Her 15+ years career spans enterprise providers & payers, health systems, Fortune 500s like DaVita and Optum, and SaaS and AI/ML/LLM health tech startups. She’s an advisor to early stage companies and femtech founder. 

With a Master’s in Public Health (MPH), she brings an essential population health perspective, grounded in a deep understanding of barriers to equitable care and access for underserved groups like women in midlife. 

Previously, Sarah served as Chief Clinical Transformation & Client Success Officer at a SaaS, B2B/B2B2C care management and patient engagement startup, leading post-sales functions and the VBC product line. 

Prior to that, she held senior leadership roles over strategic portfolios at DaVita, Kaiser Permanente, Sutter Health, and John Muir Health. 

Sarah’s roots in performance transformation trace back to DaVita, where within a year she elevated quality to Global Top 7 rank from bottom one-third, and achieved unprecedented YOY growth, among other accomplishments. She also led the GTM for DaVita’s consumer engagement platform, tripling market penetration across Northwest U.S. states in the first year. 

Sarah has held lynchpin roles bridging Pharma/Device companies (Novartis, Medtronic), Physician Investigators, the FDA, and IRBs in developing, reviewing and managing hundreds of adult and pediatric clinical trials (Boston Children's, Brigham & Women's, Dana Farber & Cedars-Sinai).

name: Jonathan Stambolis
title: Co-Founder & CEO at Zenysis Technologies
about:
Jonathan Stambolis is the Co-Founder and CEO of Zenysis Technologies, a company on a mission to unleash the power of data through an interoperability platform built to accelerate global development goals and improve lives everywhere. 

He has 20 years of experience in capital fundraising, global health, international diplomacy, and technology. Previously, Jonathan represented Australia at the United Nations in New York with responsibility for global health, humanitarian, and development affairs. During this time, he negotiated the groundbreaking 2011 United Nations Political Declaration for HIV/AIDS, the international political framework for the global AIDS response. He also served as an Adviser on Global Health to the Secretary-General of the United Nations, Ban Ki-moon.

Before his work with the United Nations, Stambolis served as a corporate and commercial legal adviser to financial institutions in connection with more than US$300 billion in M&A, capital markets, and investment fund transactions. Clients included J. P. Morgan, KKR, UBS Warburg, HSBC Bank, ABN Amro, Macquarie Bank, Westpac Bank, and Commonwealth Bank. He also co-founded PodProperty, a company that addresses Australia's housing affordability crisis.

He completed a Masters of International Relations and International Law at Australia’s top-rated university, graduating in 1st place. Upon graduation, he was appointed as an Adviser to Australia’s Ambassador to the United Nations in New York and played a key role in securing Australia's election to the United Nations Security Council.

name: Suze Dowling
title: Co-Founder, Chief Business Officer @ Pattern | Startup Consultant, Advisor & DTC Expert | Available for 1:1 Founder Coaching
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Suze Dowling, known to many as a startup whisperer, is a founder, brand-builder, investor, and—most importantly—a DTC operator. Equal parts brand-builder and operator, she has over a decade of experience creating, growing, investing in, and acquiring brands.

In her time working on businesses, from ideation to multi-million dollar exits, she has crafted the ultimate DTC guides that she wishes existed when she started – she jokes, “This is the stuff they don’t tell you in business school. It’s for founders who need solutions – not an MBA”. Navigating the intersection of innovation and practicality, her playbook ‘The DTC Operator’ is a ‘how-to’ for turning entrepreneurial vision into reality. 

Suze is the co-founder and Chief Business Officer at Pattern Brands, a family of 7 purposeful brands that help people transform daily tasks into opportunities for enjoyment. In this role, she focuses on acquiring, integrating, and scaling sustainable, DTC-first businesses. Since inception, Pattern has raised over $50M, launched multiple marquee products to critical acclaim—including Wirecutter’s #1 towel and #1 spatula, and taken home Apartment Therapy’s 2023 Organization Award—and scaled in national retailers.

Before co-founding Pattern Brands, Suze led operations as General Manager & Partner at Gin Lane, the globally recognized independent agency that launched over 50 digitally native brands, including household names like Harry’s, Hims, and Sweetgreen. In this role, she balanced growth, profitability, and quality while overseeing P&L, helping the agency contribute to a staggering $15 billion in startup value.

Suze is also a respected thought leader in the DTC space, with features in The New York Times’ Wirecutter, DigiDay, and Modern Retail; speaking engagements at Harvard Business School, ShopTalk, Brand Innovators, and Foundermade; and multiple podcast appearances.

Reach out to Suze for consulting, advising and mentorship: paperbell.me/suze-dowling
speaking_engagements: Guest on Starting Small podcast discussing brand building and Pattern Brands; Featured on Finien podcast about D2C challenger brands and Pattern's portfolio; Guest on WIN/WIN: Women in Innovation podcast; Speaker on Modern Retail Podcast about roll-up brand strategy
notable_achievements: Helped launch over 50 D2C challenger brands; Built over $15B in market share for brands through Gin Lane; Raised $99M for Pattern Brands and acquired 7 home brands

name: Ty Smith
title: Retired Navy SEAL and Chief Executive Officer at CommSafe AI and Hiro Consulting
about: Ty Smith is a native of the great state of Illinois.  He enlisted in the United States Navy September 30th, 1996.  His first duty assignment was as a military police officer in Sardinia, Italy; for nearly five years, he submersed himself in Sardinian culture, and the Italian language.  Ty was accepted to Basic Underwater Demolition School (BUD/s) in October of 2001, just one month following the September 11th terror attack.  Ty graduated from BUD/s training in the Spring of 2003, and was then assigned to SEAL Team 8 in Little Creek, VA.  After a successful tour of duty on the East Coast, Ty transferred to the West Coast and served as a Naval Special Warfare training instructor for three years prior to being assigned to SEAL Team One in Coronado, CA.  After the successful completion of six deployments to the Middle East as a SEAL operator, Ty completed a Bachelors Degree in Organizational Management from Ashford University, and an MBA from the University of Southern California, Marshall School of Business.  Ty retired from naval service May 20th, 2016, after 20-years of faithful and honorable service to God and this great nation.

name: Steven Hong, PhD
title: VP/GM @Ambarella | CEO @Oculii | Investor/Board Member
about:
Steven is currently VP/GM at Ambarella (NASDAQ: AMBA), one of the market leaders in Multi Modal AI Inference SoCs. Steven joined Ambarella through its $400M all cash acquisition of Oculii, where he was the CEO/Co-Founder, growing the company to become the leading provider of AI Software for Radar Perception and Sensor Fusion. Prior to the acquisition, Oculii had raised more than $80 million from top-tier VC investors and secured commercial partnerships with leading Tier-1, OEM, and AV companies globally. 

Prior to founding Oculii, Steven was a partner at Kleiner Perkins where he invested in early stage (Seed/Series A) HardTech companies pioneering Autonomous Systems, AI + Machine Learning, Space, IoT, 3D Printing, Robotics, and Cloud Infrastructure. Before KP, Steven co-founded Kumu Networks (Self Interference Cancellation for Full Duplex Wireless - $65M from NEA, Khosla Ventures, Third Point, Cisco, Verizon) where he was responsible for product management, fundraising, IP strategy, business development, and marketing. Steven started his career as a management/strategy consultant at McKinsey and Uber, where he specialized in M&A diligence and expansion strategy.

about:
As a proven executive leader with over a decade of experience scaling SaaS businesses, I specialize in corporate development, strategy, and strategic partnerships that fuel transformative growth and create lasting enterprise value. In my current role as Chief Strategy Officer at LivePerson, I lead strategic alignment, corporate partnerships, and inorganic growth initiatives, driving the company’s evolution into an agentic AI orchestration platform. I’ve cultivated high-impact partnerships with some of the world’s largest technology platforms (i.e. Google, Meta, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Salesforce, NICE, Avaya, ServiceNow) and have negotiated and structured deals that materially accelerate growth and profitability.

I played a hands-on role in corporate development and M&A, from sourcing strategic interest to negotiating a successful 18x revenue multiple exit to LivePerson.

I bring a track record of:

- Driving double-digit YoY growth through platform, OEM, and channel partnerships
- Leading M&A and strategic investment initiatives, from deal sourcing to integration
- Creating monetization strategies around emerging technologies (AI, CX, messaging ecosystems)
- Positioning companies for high-value exits and rapid scaling in dynamic markets

I thrive at the intersection of technology, partnerships, and growth strategy, with a particular focus on SaaS and AI businesses at inflection points, whether public or venture/private equity-backed. My passion lies in shaping ecosystems and forging alliances that unlock growth opportunities, accelerate innovation, and deliver measurable outcomes for customers, partners, and investors.

name: Alexandre Wayenberg
title: CEO @ Shape
about:
Alexandre Wayenberg is the CEO of Shape, a startup developing the ShapeScale, a scale that scans your body in 3D and allow users to visualize how their body shape change. Shape has been funded and been part of the Summer 2015 batch of Y Combinator.

During his studies he co-founded a spin-off of the EPFL – Agorabee where he developed his first connected devices and honed his entrepreneurship skills. Agorabee went on to win the 2009 IMD Startup competition and Alexandre was awarded the Venture Leaders prize in 2009.

He is the former founder of Capsule, a one stop design and engineering consultancy that helped Startup and SMEs to transform their ideas into products. He has been involved in the design and development more than 15 connected products and has lived 5 years in South China where he acquired hands-on manufacturing and industrialization experience.

He has experience with Design, Hardware and Software Engineering, Manufacturing and Entrepreneurship. He is passionate about bringing game changing innovation to the world and inspiring and helping others to do so. He has been animating workshops and been a mentor for the last 2 years at the Startup Weekend Hong Kong, RISE Startup program, the Founder Institute Hong Kong Chapter and at Paperclip Hong Kong.

Alexandre is a graduate from the EPFL in Micro Engineering with a Master in Micro and Nano Systems and a Minor in Biomedical Engineering. During his time at EPFL, he has been the assistant of Prof. Renaud (BioMEMS) and Schmid (Introduction to Microcontrollers). He has more than a decade of experience designing PCBs and is a certified PCB designer from the IPC, the Association Connecting Electronics Industries.

name: Jennifer Harris
title: Co-Founder at MOTIVO - Independence by design
about:
Jennifer Harris is an innovative product designer with a unique ability to identify consumer needs and translate them into viable business opportunities.  She is experienced at bringing successful products to market for both start-ups and fortune 500 level companies beginning with up front incubation through to marketing and sales.

After seeing firsthand the unmet needs of her mother and grandparents who had to use mobility aids Jennifer co-founded Motivo Inc. Through this entrepreneurial venture, she is focused on redefining the mobility aid category creating independence enabling products designed for people, not patients. 

Harris is also an accomplished artist and craftsperson whose work reflects an interest in design, functional object making, and the social and cultural significance of objects of use.  Her work is part of the permanent collection at the Samuel Dorsky Museum of Art in New York and has been exhibited nationally at galleries and museums including the Cleveland Institute of Art in Ohio; the Contemporary Crafts Gallery in Portland, Oregon; and the John Michael Kohler Arts Center in Sheboygan, Wisconsin.
