As the Co-Founder and CTO of Ablacon (now Cortex EP), I lead an interdisciplinary team that uses AI to develop software for treating Atrial Fibrillation, the most common heart arrhythmia. With over 10 years of experience in computer science, physics, and machine learning, I have created novel methods to analyze and leverage large amounts of real patient data to make individual treatment more effective. My goal is to make AI more useful and understandable for everyone, especially for the health sector.

I am also passionate about science communication and education. I hosted the popular science program "Terra X Lesch & Co" with ZDF, where I explain complex scientific topics in an engaging and accessible way. I also produce TV content for various programs that aim to get people excited about science through videos, tutorials, and magazines. I have a PhD in Computer Science from Technische Universität München, scholarships from the Fulbright Program and the German National Academic Foundation, and I am a passionate private pilot. I speak German and English fluently and am trying to brush up my French and Italian.

name: Vinay Chandra
title: CEO at High Peak Software
about:
I am a mountaineer at heart. The tougher the climb, the more determined I am. In my experience, mountaineering is not all that different from founding and growing a successful startup. 

There is a certain level of persistence and single-minded focus that comes with mountaineering. These are the very qualities that make for a steady foundation for startups. That is where High Peak Software, my current company, derives its name from.

I am a serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience, having successfully founded seven businesses in India, Germany, and the US. 

At High Peak Software, AI experts and engineers solve difficult, real-life problems using challenging technologies to build world-class products for small, medium and enterprise businesses. We provide intelligent, automated solutions for manufacturing, legal, healthcare, media & advertising, HR, education and other sectors. 

I am also passionate about bringing useful AI products to market that make users’ lives easier. 

One of our flagship products, Scarlet, is an automated document processing system powered by intelligent machine-learning algorithms. It is a highly configurable solution capable of processing any kind of document, including non-searchable image files. 

Our other flagship product is an AI-based automated defect detection system. The AI models used in this system are trained using high quality, error-free surface images of the product and execute anomaly detection in real-time. 

If you are looking to leverage AI technologies and to automate your business, let’s connect via InMail or marketing@highpeaksw.com.

notable_achievements: Founded and led multiple businesses on three continents over 25 years; Developed AI products like Scarlet for automated document processing and AI-based defect detection systems; Led Core Technology Operations offering at Deloitte focusing on business transformation and operational optimization

name: Ken Sills

about:
Ken Sills leads product development for Preteckt, a division of Diesel Laptops that uses machine learning to predict maintenance issues in vehicles weeks before they cause downtime. Since developing the initial prototype of this hardware/software solution in 2015, Ken has been focused on building Preteckt's team of engineers, scientists, business developers, and sales professionals so that the transportation industry can benefit from Vehicle Prognostics as a Service.

Ken has over two decades of R&D experience creating solutions that couple hardware, software, and data science. His diverse background often provides an outsider's perspective on problems, allowing him to craft solutions that apply tool sets from many seemingly independent fields of research. Skills honed in Computational Astrophysics that provide a unique advantage in Machine Vision. Skills honed in Continuous Emission Tomography that allow for improved Data Visualization in the trucking industry. Teaching skills developed as a Professor of Physics that map directly onto the role of chief product evangelist.

Ken's work has been published in books and in peer-reviewed journals, and hardware and software that he has developed is deployed around the world.

As CEO of IntelliBoard, Becky leads a mission-driven organization focused on delivering actionable insights through learning analytics to improve student success globally. With a background as an educator, Chief Product Officer, and executive in the EdTech sector, she brings a unique blend of strategic vision, operational expertise, and product-driven leadership.

She has built and nurtured a high-performing, cross-functional team, fostering a culture rooted in open communication, clear expectations, and empowerment. Her leadership has shaped a more focused and resilient organization, streamlining operations to create a leaner team poised for scalable growth.

She led the development of a new go-to-market strategy, improved platform adoption, and strengthened client health, ensuring every institution served by IntelliBoard sees measurable value. Her work has bridged cross-organizational collaboration, driven product innovation, and improved client outcomes.

Deeply committed to data governance and adoption at scale, Becky believes in the power of data to transform everyday decisions that drive learner success. She is proud to work alongside the passionate professionals at IntelliBoard to reshape how education is delivered, measured, and improved worldwide.

name: Omri Timianker
title: Global Entrepreneur & Systems Architect | AI Innovation, Strategic Execution, and Building Resilient Futures
about:
The future isn’t something I chase — it’s something I work to understand and build with others.

With over two decades as an entrepreneur, builder, and strategist, I have helped shape ventures, ecosystems, and alliances that have moved hundreds of millions of dollars across industries, continents, and fields of human creativity.

From AI-driven intelligence platforms to cultural and culinary ventures, my work is fueled by a deep respect for tradition — and a relentless belief in the power of bold ideas, executed with precision, to create enduring futures.

I combine technological expertise, human insight, and operational scale — building frameworks that survive storms, adapt to disruption, and allow leadership to thrive beyond the noise.

I move across industries, across cultures, across languages — always seeking the points of connection where human resilience and technological evolution meet.

I am a dreamer who builds, a strategist who moves, and a realist who knows that the future will not wait for permission.

I collaborate closely with executives, innovators, and future-builders around the world — not to optimize for today, but to design ecosystems that endure tomorrow.

Across every venture, every market, every border I’ve crossed, one truth remains:
The future belongs to those with the courage to create it — not just survive it.

I don’t move with the tide.
I build the next shores.

Dream it. Design it. Deliver it.

name: Paul Denslow
title: AI & NGS Powered Microbiome Discovery & Testing - Advancing Health and Longevity
about:
Paul Denslow is the CEO and Co-Founder of Intus Bio, the company at the forefront of microbiome innovation, and the developer of GutID.

Through Paul's leadership, Intus Bio is opening up a whole new health sector by making the fundamental role the microbiome plays across an array of health outcomes, part of healthcare.  The company's patented and proprietary Titan-1 platform. combines NGS and AI powered analysis to produce unprecedented high-resolution data, and incredible and actionable health insights.

The GutID microbiome test is available today at GutID.com.  Intus Bio through collaborations with major institutions, is developing transformative disease specific tools for the diagnosis, early detection and prevention of cancer and other chronic diseases.

name: Hisashi Ito
title: Knowhere - CEO, founder
about:
I am the founder and CEO of Knowhere Inc., where we are developing SmartScout—an AI-powered baseball performance platform that enables players, coaches, and scouts to measure pitching and hitting metrics using only a smartphone.
SmartScout is currently being used by multiple MLB and NPB clubs, and is expanding into the amateur and youth baseball markets globally.

I began my career at DeNA in 2011, working in the platform division as part of the consulting group for Mobage third-party services.

In 2012, I joined COSMONAUTS Inc. as a founding member and game planner. I later took on the lead planner role for Sōken no Cross Edge, a co-developed title with DeNA, achieving over 50 million yen in monthly sales at launch. I also coordinated with DeNA's overseas publishing division and handled live operations.

In 2013, I joined HEROZ Inc. as the game producer, collaborating with KADOKAWA and managing development and progress. 
I then participated in the launch of Pokémon Co-Master, a title co-developed with The Pokémon Company, overseeing the project as a Project Manager from initial contract through global launch. The app achieved over 40 million downloads worldwide. I managed both development and live operations until 2020.

name: Hugo Garcia-Cotte
title: Chief Executive Officer | Cypheme | Leading the Charge Against Counterfeits and Safeguarding Brands
about:
As the CEO of Cypheme, a French deep-tech startup specializing in anti-counterfeiting technology, I am excited to contribute to our cutting-edge solution for product authentication and supply chain management. Our technology leverages the power of artificial intelligence and computer vision to detect and prevent counterfeit products from entering the supply chain. Here are some key aspects of our solution:

Our technology has the potential to significantly reduce the incidence of counterfeit products: a pervasive issue in many industries.
By using AI and computer vision, we can detect even the most sophisticated counterfeit products with a high degree of accuracy, surpassing traditional authentication methods.
We use specially designed stickers with a chemically unique signature, making them impossible to counterfeit or copy.
Our mobile app, available on WeChat, empowers consumers to easily verify the authenticity of products, access product information and characteristics, and receive personalized marketing content.

Our highly customizable sticker enables us to offer a range of services, including dosage help and personalized marketing content.
As a member of a company that is addressing the critical issue of counterfeit products using advanced technology, I am proud to be part of a team that is making a difference.


BOOK YOUR DEMO TODAY: 
EMAIL: hugo@cypheme.com
WEBSITE: https://www.cypheme.com/

name: Brigham Tomco
title: Entrepreneur and Investor
about:
Brigham Tomco is a serial entrepreneur with a focus on solving complex problems for businesses.  He is the CEO/Founder of Emmersion, a SaaS language education technology company that delivers AI-driven adaptive language assessments.  Emmersion has over 700 customers including many Fortune 500 companies and top universities.  

Brigham is also the Chairman and Founder of Zylun Global, an investment holding company, and is the founder of its operating entities CoDev, Clear Insights Group, and ZG Properties.  Zylun Global’s companies employ over 800 people worldwide.  CoDev is an offshore technical outsourcing firm with offices in Utah and the Philippines.  Clear Insights Group is a market and opinion research firm with offices in Utah and Idaho.  

Additionally, Brigham has a passion for Education, Mentorship, and Economic Development and sits on multiple boards including Utah Land Trusts Protection and Advocacy Committee, Presidents Advancement Council at BYU-Idaho, the Wolverine Fund at Utah Valley University and Utah SITLA and SITFO Nominating Committees.  He was an Adjunct Professor at Brigham Young University-Marriott School teaching Financing New Ventures. Prior to Zylun, Brigham worked in NYC at Ocean Road Advisors and Meyer Ventures an $800+ million portfolio investing in public and private equities, hedge funds, real estate, venture capital, high-yield debt, and fixed income.

name: Alex Moukas
title: Serial Entrepreneur | Advancing Innovation in Artificial Intelligence and Multi-Agent Systems | Combining Research, Education, and Technology to Conserve the Ocean
about:
Alex Moukas is a serial entrepreneur with $1B+ exits with background in AI and Multi-Agent Systems.

He sold one of his companies at 27, took another company public in London at 33, and completed Velti's NASDAQ IPO at 39. His 2013 restructuring transaction with Blackstone, to take Velti private was recognized by M&A Advisor at their 13th Annual Awards as the “Cross-Border Deal of the Year”. 

Alex is the founder of OCEEF, the Ocean Conservation, Exploration and Education Foundation, a 501(c)3 non-profit.  He was the CEO of Velti, a global mobile marketing software provider with presence in 25 countries. He co-founded the company in 2000, grew it to 1,250 employees, and he is still non-exec chairman. He previously co-founded FCI, a privately-held, strategic sourcing software provider in Cambridge, MA, which was later acquired by SAP AG.

He has authored a book on Artificial Intelligence published by Springer and has more than 50 publications in scientific journals and conferences. He holds 12 US and international patents, in the fields of Mobile Technology and Artificial Intelligence. 

Alex is an industry speaker to the likes of Bloomberg, CNBC, MWC, Mobile Marketer and sat on the Global Board of the Mobile Marketing Association. He has been voted as one of the 10 most important people in Mobile Technology globally by Business Insider, a Top Global leader under 40 by Global Telecoms Business Magazine and was a Finalist for the E&Y Entrepreneur of the Year Award in Northern California.

Alex holds a BS in CS from the American College, an MS in Artificial Intelligence from the University of Edinburgh, and an MS from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (jointly supervised by MIT Media Lab and Sloan School of Management).

name: Justin Oberman
title: President, CEO & Co-Founder, Airspace Data
about:
Justin P. Oberman is a recognized expert and industry leader in aviation/aerospace, homeland security, and identity management. His 27-year career includes service in government, as a tech-company founder, and as an advisor to investors and management teams. 

Justin is CEO of Airspace Data, which is building and deploying a software capability so that the military, FAA, and the airlines can share restricted airspace at scale to signiﬁcantly reduce CO2 emissions, operating costs, and ﬂight times.  The company was formed in 2021 and started supporting civilian flight plans through military airspace in summer 2023.  Partnering with two major U.S. carriers, the live-flight test including 4700 completed flights and more than 100,000 gallons of fuel saved.

Justin has served numerous major government contractors and institutional investors as an advisor, helping support efforts to secure more than $3 billion in contract wins, $5 billion in strategic acquisitions, and numerous strategic marketing efforts.

Justin helped set up TSA after 9/11, later serving as an Assistant Administrator and Senior Executive at DHS. He was responsible for creating and running major identity management programs including TWIC, Hazprint, PreCheck, Alien Flight Student vetting, and all other aviation-industry background check programs. He also helped write HSPD-12 and co-chaired a Secretarial task force on DHS identity-program reorganization.
awards_and_recognitions: Truman National Security Project Fellow
speaking_engagements: Contributor at Airspace World blog; Speaker at industry and policy events related to aviation, aerospace, and homeland security
notable_achievements: Co-founded and serves as CEO of Airspace Data, automating airspace sharing to increase efficiency and reduce emissions; Played a pivotal role in helping set up TSA after 9/11; Produced several films including Hotel Tehran and Prisoner's Daughter
reasoning: Justin Oberman demonstrates strong operational and executive experience, particularly in the aviation/aerospace and homeland security sectors. Over the last 15+ years, I’ve led and built across industries—from AI and EdTech to animal welfare and game design. Whether it’s synthesizing complex knowledge into clear insight (as I’m currently doing with Incited), or building companies and systems from the ground up (like Grok, Petter, Green Ice Games, or PFA Pune), I’ve consistently turned chaos into coherent, strategic action.

I’m the person founders call when they need clarity—of thought, story, or execution. I’ve helped startups across stages secure funding, restructured teams and operations for educational institutions, developed community strategies for animal rescue centers, and designed business models resilient to financial crises.

I don’t fit into a linear career path—because I don’t believe in one-size-fits-all growth. I’m curious to the core—driven by an innate need to know, not just to learn.

Whether it's designing games that teach kids financial decision-making, rescuing strays, or building pitch decks for VCs—I show up with heart, hustle, and high standards.

If you’re a fellow nerd, misfit, or visionary looking to build something meaningful—let’s talk.

I have a unique job and an even stranger hobby.

name: Henrik Werdelin
title: Enjoy turning nothing into something with good people. Co. founder of BARK (BarkBox/BARK Air), Audos & founding partner of Prehype. Author: The Acorn Method and upcoming book Me, My Customer and AI.
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Henrik Werdelin is an accomplished founder, investor, and author with over 15 years at the forefront of entrepreneurship. Best known as the co-founder of Bark (BarkBox), the NYSE-listed company bringing joy to dogs and their people, Werdelin also co-founded Prehype, the esteemed startup studio behind ventures like AndCo, Ro, and ManagedByQ, and Audos, an AI platform helping aspiring entrepreneurs create startups smarter and faster. Active in applied AI since 2019, he co-hosts the podcast “Beyond the Prompt” with Stanford’s Jeremy Utley and is the co-author of the forthcoming “Me, My Customer and AI,” exploring how AI reshapes the entrepreneurial landscape. Formerly an Entrepreneur in Residence at Index Ventures and head of product development at MTV International, he has been involved in multiple successful startups and incubations—including HotPotato, AndCo, ReadMill, and Sunrise—to acquisitions by the likes of Facebook, Fiverr, Dropbox, and Microsoft. A native of Denmark with stints in Paris, London, and New York, Werdelin frequently speaks on entrepreneurship and AI and has been recognized by Fast Company as one of the “Top 100 Most Creative People in Business” and by Business Insider’s Silicon Alley 100.

Henrik graduated from Aalborg University (Denmark) with a BA in Social and Politics Science and received a Masters with distinction in Journalism from the University of Westminster (London, UK).

about:
I am passionate about the intersection of technology and business. I find great satisfaction in (i) harnessing advanced technologies to enable people to solve complex, real-world problems; and (ii) enabling teams of competent, high-performance people to solve challenging and impactful problems in a rewarding work environment.


Some career highlights:

• Co-founded Enview, an AI/ML platform company, and served as CEO, raising several rounds of venture capital from top US/European firms before successfully being acquired by Matterport (Nasdaq: MTTR) in 2022. Along the way, landed clients including Google, PG&E, SoCal Edison, National Grid, San Diego G&E, ExxonMobil, TransMountain, Enbridge, TransCanada, US Army, US Air Force, US Dept. of Energy, etc. 

• Consistent track record of successfully negotiating and closing and delivering complex 6/7/8-figure deals across multiple roles and industries.

• Solved urgent operational problems while embedded with the US Army in Afghanistan via prototyping, remote sensing, data analytics, and in-situ fabrication. 

• Flew experimental aircraft with NASA and private industry. Put multiple pieces of hardware (satellites and propulsion units) into Earth orbit with the USAF Research Lab

• Completed a PhD at Stanford in aerospace engineering, focused on AI/ML.

about:
I have been working on small drone technologies for over thirteen years, addressing markets in agriculture, infrastructure, military and beyond. I am the CEO and founder of GreenSight. GreenSight has built a data intelligence platform that uses automated drones to gather daily imagery and deliver actionable information to customers. Over the last few years we have conducted over 8000 flights with the system, making us one of the highest volume drone services providers in the world. GreenSight is also developing autonomous aircraft for a variety of agricultural, commercial and military applications, and conducts product-centriic R&D for the US Department of Defense and dozens of innovative enterprise and commercial customers.

GreenSight is currently hiring across multiple technical positions to support our growth in autonomy, robotics, and unmanned aerial vehicles.

I receive dozens of LinkedIn connection requests per week. Please include a message in your request if you would like to connect. Thank you!

name: Joel Pedlikin
title: Chief Operating Officer at GreenSight
about:
I am the co-founder and Chief Operating Officer of GreenSight, a 55 person robotics startup. GreenSight's goal is to develop autonomous robotic platforms, and we do an unusual breadth of interesting cutting-edge work aimed at that goal.  We're probably best known for our Turf management/monitoring system ("Turfcloud") which was built around a custom drone that we deploy to commercial turf users (golf course, stadiums, etc.) to fly over and image their grass every day.  
 We run sophisticated cloud software on that imagery to give the turf grass managers actionable information on a daily basis.  That system now includes a comprehensive software dashboard, robotic mowers, soil moisture sensors, and a number of other cutting age capabilities.  We also do a lot of paid R&D work for both government customers (NASA, DoD, NSF) and commerical agricultural companies.   I run the company day-to-day, and report to my business partner and the genius behind GreenSight, James Peverill CEO.  

I also founded, and still actively participate in, the Jumpstart Fellowship Program with MassRobotics. (https://www.massrobotics.org/stem/jumpstart-fellowship/). This program provides training and summer internships (at tech companies) to high school women of color from Boston and Lowell area schools.  I am always looking for both young women to participate in the project, and robotics companies to offer the internships.

GreenSight is always hiring (I lead recruitment), and always looking for new customers, potential partners, and the right potential investors.

My academic background in “General” Engineering gives me foundational knowledge in all aspects of engineering, but also allowed me the flexibility to dive head first into entrepreneurship. Throughout college, I managed SEO, inventory management, marketing, and supplier & manufacturer relations at The Longboard Store, an ecommerce business where we sold thousands of high-quality skateboards.

When I’m not working, you’ll find me enjoying the outdoors, skiing, golfing, and playing guitar. These experiences fuel my creativity and reinforce my belief in the importance of balance, teamwork, and staying grounded in nature.

I’m always eager to connect with like-minded professionals, whether to discuss startups, technology, or the next adventure. Feel free to reach out if you’d like to chat or collaborate.

Hi there - I’m Andrew Gauthier.

I began my career as an Accountant, completed my obligatory big 4 experience, and dove into entrepreneurship.

name: Angelina DeLago
title: Founder & CEO, Botkeeper - Automated Bookkeeping Platform for Accountants
about:
Botkeeper is an automated accounting platform that uses human-assisted machine learning and AI to deliver the fastest, most accurate, and lowest cost bookkeeping available to accounting firms.  Botkeeper allows accounting firms to scale their CAS practice, benefiting from software-like margins, while simultaneous improving the experience, reliability, and bookkeeping results for their small business clients. 

Recognized as an industry leader by Gartner, AccountingToday, CEO World, Patch, Red Herring, Bostinno, and Stevie Awards, Botkeeper has tallied 110M in funding from marque investors including Tom Golisano, Founder/CEO of Paychex, Point72, Greycroft, Google's Gradient Ventures, Ignition Partners, Sorenson Capital, High Alpha, The Bonadio Group, as well as several other VCs, entrepreneurs, accounting partners, and professional athletes.  Roughly 300 accounting firms and 8000 small businesses depend on Botkeeper for bookkeeping. Botkeeper Inc. is a US company with subsidieries in the Philippines and Colombia and a proud employer of a world class and diverse team across many states and several other countries.  I have personally been ranked among the top 30 Most Inspiring Business Leaders, CPA Practice Advisor's 20 Under 40 Influencers, and top 100 Most Influential People in Accounting.

Visit www.botkeeper.com today to see what the Future of Bookkeeping looks like.

Prior to Botkeeper my background has been in automation, decision trees, and accounting with a triple major from Babson College in Quantitative Methods, Entrepreneurship, and Strategic Management.  While in college I co-founded ThinkLite which automated lighting analysis, design, and manufacturing.  ThinkLite grew from dorm room to 46 on Inc's 500 List and resulted in my being ranked 2nd among America's Top 25 Entrepreneurs Under 25 by Bloomberg Businessweek.  After successfully exiting ThinkLite, I invested in and helped grow a cloud accounting firm from 7 to 40 people in the 3 short years.

Outside of Botkeeper I am an investor and advisor several businesses venture funds.  I also sit on the Technology Advisory Committee & Board of Corporators at Fidelity Bank. In my personal life, I enjoy spending time with my wife, two daughters, and dog as well as binge-watching movies and TV, skiing with friends, brainstorming with other entrepreneurs, and island hopping off the coast of Saint Petersburg FL.

name: Alvaro Bravo
title: President & Co-Founder at Aki Technologies
about:
Alvaro is currently the President & Co-Founder of Aki Technologies, a mobile advertising technology that deciphers mobile mindset to ensure more appropriate and effective delivery of advertising on mobile devices

Alvaro began his career as a management consultant with Monitor Group working with the largest media and telecom companies around the world for almost 10 years. This experience was the foundation of his interest in mobile advertising. 

He is one of the pioneers in mobile advertising in the United States. After joining Greystripe in September 2006, he built a diverse and successful career in the industry since its inception. He has held different roles and been a critical contributor to the growth of two successful start-ups. He formerly served as COO of the largest independent advertising platform, Opera Mediaworks. He had a broad range of responsibilities and was ultimately responsible for the P&L of a rapidly growing company with offices in more than ten countries, over 350 employees, and 500 million mobile users.

Alvaro was the first non-founding member of Greystripe’s executive team where he built the largest ad-supported distribution network for games and applications before the App Store. When Greystripe shifted its business model, abandoning the feature phone market, he created the first mobile indirect sales strategy which ultimately led to the acquisition of Greystripe by Valueclick.

After the sale of Greystripe, Alvaro joined Mobile Theory when there were only six employees.  His contribution was pivotal in the sale of the company to Opera Software.  Under his operational and strategic leadership, Mobile Theory grew to 70 employees, its revenue multiplied by tenfold, and the company became one of the most profitable mobile ad networks.

name: Scott Swanson
title: Founder @ bonder | Worlds 1st SuperPlatform | Retail Reimagined. Social Reinvented. Communities Reconnected.
about:
For over two decades, I worked behind the curtain, consulting the world’s largest tech companies on global infrastructure. 

I’ve seen the finest hardware, the most advanced software, and the relentless evolution of technology. Yet, something was missing through it all: a commitment to building technology that serves people rather than exploits them.

My search for something deeper led me to years of study under Kobun Chino Otogawa Roshi, the same Buddhist teacher who mentored Steve Jobs. Jobs gave the world the most iconic hardware ever created. But the software that followed? It still fails to deliver on its highest purpose. Phones have connected us, but they have not brought us closer together.

That’s why I/WE built Bonder. Not as another social platform. Not as a data-harvesting machine. Not as a tool to keep people endlessly scrolling.

But as something entirely new, a human-first platform designed to elevate how we connect, communicate, and engage with the world around us.

Bonder isn’t here to extract value from users. It’s here to give it back.
speaking_engagements: Frequent speaker at industry events; Regular contributor to trade publications like Adweek, AdAge, Digiday, and MediaPost
notable_achievements: Over 30 years of experience in financial services; Reduced client division operational budgets by 30-40% through business model design

The Buddhist training and tech consulting background suggest maturity and industry knowledge, but don't qualify for higher classification without evidence of successful entrepreneurial outcomes.

name: Michael Avon
title: Managing Partner at ABS Capital Partners
about:
I am a growth equity investor, operator and entrepreneur focused on data analytics & intelligence, cybersecurity,  compliance & software and technology enabled services businesses. I am the Managing Partner at ABS Capital Partners, a leading growth equity fund based in Washington DC and Baltimore MD. 

Previously, I was the  Founding CEO and then Executive Chairman of ICX Media, a digital video marketing data and intelligence company. ICX Media sold to leading marketing services company Salient Global. Prior to ICX,  I was the CFO & EVP of Millennial Media, where I led global finance, strategy, business development, corp dev, HR, legal and international operations. I helped found and launch Millennial Media as a venture capitalist in 2006 before joining the company full time in 2009. I led Millennial's IPO in 2012, and the company ultimately sold to Verizon (it is now the core data and marketing technology platform inside of Yahoo). 

Prior to Millennial and ICX, I was a venture capitalist and growth investor with Columbia Capital, where I led data, software, digital media, cybersecurity and mobile investments for a multi-billion-dollar venture capital and growth equity firm.  I helped launch two companies out of Columbia Capital (Millennial Media and Vubiquity) and invested in various growth businesses. I have 25+ years of experience in technology start-ups and growth companies as an entrepreneur, executive, attorney and venture capitalist/private equity investor. 

I am currently on the Boards of GuidePoint Security, Deepwatch, ExecOnline, Apptopia, Squadlocker and Validifi (observer). I'm deeply involved in the #DCTech community and am on various Boards of the University of Virginia College of Arts and Sciences Foundation. 

Specialties: Specialize in data/analytics, cybersecurity and FinTech.  Background includes extensive experience in business development, corporate development/M&A, operations, finance and strategy.

name: Lauren McCann
title:
Co-Founder & CEO of Procure Impact |
Purchase with intention, unlock human potential.
about:
Lauren McCann is Co-Founder & CEO of Procure Impact, a B2B marketplace that serves as a catalyst for social change, connecting businesses with a vetted portfolio of hand-crafted and high-quality wholesale, bulk, retail, and corporate gifting products manufactured exclusively by vendors that employ underestimated populations in the USA.   Procure Impact was named to Fast Company's 2025 Most Innovative Companies List. 

Each supplier on their platform employs individuals with barriers to work in the USA – individuals with disabilities, refugees, veterans, and individuals who have experienced poverty, mental health challenges, homelessness, trauma, incarceration, and addiction.

Lauren is also the Founder of CALLIOPE, a mission-driven impact studio and consulting firm that builds, grows, scales, and invests in models that maximize human dignity, transformation, and social impact. 

Lauren previously served as Executive Vice President of the Stand Together Foundation, where she co-developed the vision, model, and approach to the foundation's venture philanthropy that helps grow and scale innovative models that help break the cycle of poverty. 

Prior to joining Stand Together, Lauren served as vice president of strategic development for the National Association of Manufacturers. Lauren held additional roles in external relations at the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) and the Mercatus Center at George Mason University. 

Lauren has received several recognitions and awards including the 2025 Arne Sorenson Social Impact Award and being named on Inc's 2025 Female Founders 500 List.  She is a Tory Burch Fellow and a Business Fellow for Praxis, a venture-building community advancing redemptive entrepreneurship. She is also a Fellow of the inaugural class of the Civil Society Fellowship and a member of the Aspen Global Leadership Network.

name: David Stillman
title: Multi time CEO/Founder, Investor, Advisor w/ several exits.
about:
I am 3x CEO and Founder with 3 successful exits. My first companies, Vorsight, and Funnel Clarity were pioneers in the outsourced demand generation and sales training/consulting space. We recruited, hired, and trained over 500 recent college grads and trained 100s of companies and 1000s of sales reps over 15 years. We won numerous awards including several Inc 500 and Stevie’s. 

I built ExecVision to address the problems we experienced at Vorsight and Funnel Clarity, no accountability, and no reinforcement post sales training which leads to reps not getting better. I created the SaaS category, Conversation Intelligence which has companies valued over $10b. We grew the company to $10m ARR with 60+ employees, then drove the business to cash flow break even during the Pandemic and a successful exit to Mediafly.

As a tenured CEO of over 10 years in the software industry leading successful Series A SaaS companies, I have a proven track record of developing and executing strategies for growth, driving revenue and customer acquisition, and building high performance teams. I am skilled in crafting a compelling vision, leading organizations through change, and managing the full P&L. I have deep experience with cross functional strategy across Finance, Sales, Marketing, Customer Experience, and Product which drives success from closed deals to implementation, expansion, and renewals. 

As a seasoned startup SaaS advisor, I bring extensive experience and a track record of success in helping early-stage SaaS companies navigate the challenges of launching, scaling, and growing their businesses. With a deep understanding of the SaaS business model and the unique challenges facing startups in this space, I have helped numerous companies develop and execute successful go-to-market strategies, raise capital, identify product market fit, and help them understand how to build winning teams. 

When I am not at work, you can find me spending time with my wife and twins. We love playing/teaching/watching golf, tennis, skiing, swimming, basketball or football, cooking or traveling all over the world.

name: Steve Richard

about:
I am a sales trainer and coach with over 18 years of experience in B2B sales and marketing. I help sales professionals become wildly successful by improving the quality of their sales conversations. I believe that conversation intelligence is the key to unlocking sales performance and customer satisfaction.

As the SVP of Revenue Enablement at Mediafly, I lead a team of experts who provide integrated solutions for sales planning, coaching, forecasting, and engagement. We empower sellers to lead with value, managers to coach at scale, and buyers to interact through personalized content experiences. We work with top revenue teams around the world, such as PepsiCo, Nestle, Databricks, and Honeywell, to accelerate pipeline growth and close more deals faster.

I co-founded ExecVision, a conversation intelligence platform, that was acquired by Mediafly in 2022. ExecVision helps sales teams translate insights from customer interactions into performance improvements. I am passionate about using technology to help more sales professionals worldwide achieve their goals and grow their careers.

Outside of work, I volunteer for Columbia Lighthouse for the Blind and enjoy scuba diving, skiing, running, and watching football. I am a proud dad of four kids and a husband to the best wife in the world. I love to learn new things and share my knowledge and experience with others. You can reach me at srichard@mediafly.com or grab a time with me here: https://go.oncehub.com/SteveRichard.

name: Farhad Farahbakhshian

about:
Product manager | founder | engineer. I am deeply passionate about shaping the future of how people connect with one another and AI. I have spent the past 10 years building 0-1 products at the intersection of human understanding and technology. 

Currently, I lead the Codec Avatars, as well as Embodied AI teams at Meta, where we develop products such as photorealistic avatars that facilitate communication across AR, VR and mobile devices, AI agents that bring embodiment to multimodal LLMs, and human-centric AI tools such as dubbing that enhance visual translation for creators.

Prior to Meta, I co-founded Naked Labs, a startup backed by Founders Fund and NEA. With over $20 million in funding, we launched the world’s first consumer 3D body scanner and scaled the team from 0 to 50.

My career began at Maxim, where I progressed from electrical engineer to director of product management, overseeing the company’s automotive wireless product line. This journey equipped me with a comprehensive understanding of deep-tech product development.

name: Eduardo A. Laveglia
title: Founder & CEO @ Proaxion | Consultor, profesor e investigador especializado en CX / UX Research & Service Design.
about:
Lidero un equipo que ayuda a organizaciones de Latam a obtener mejores resultados de negocio, conociendo más a fondo a las personas (usuarios, clientes, pacientes, estudiantes y ciudadanos), para crear experiencias que les agreguen valor y luego generen su lealtad y recomendación. 

En Proaxion nos ocupamos de la travesía end-to-end a través de un espacio híbrido donde lo digital y lo físico se integran en una Phygital Experience (PXP).

Porque toda experiencia es en esencia una vivencia humana. Aunque intervenga la tecnología, del otro lado de la pantalla hay una persona rodeada por un entorno físico que no es neutral. Trabajo con mi equipo para que esa visión integral no se omita.

Desde hace más de 20 años me dedico con pasión a este propósito, complementando mi tarea de consultor con una larga trayectoria en el ámbito académico. Dirijo programas universitarios en CX y UX, además de ser profesor de posgrado en Service Design y Research para el diseño de experiencias. 

En 2013 publiqué el primer libro en español sobre un caso exitoso de CX, donde explico cómo, usando el modelo de las 3T, Café Martínez construyó su marca poniendo el foco exclusivamente en la experiencia del cliente. También soy autor de artículos e investigaciones publicadas en journals académicos y speaker en congresos y eventos de la especialidad en América latina.

name: Eric Murray
title: Business Leader & Innovator with a Passion for Delivering Value through Technology
about:
WHO I AM: I am the “innovator,” the “strategist,” and the “entrepreneur” who builds a team around envisioning and then capitalizing on opportunities. I see the potential in new technologies and business models, transform the opportunity into a simple value proposition, build multitalented teams to execute the business model, and connect customers with the new solution. I lead from the front as the activator that ensures Everybody—the business, customers, and market—benefits from the initiative.

WHAT I DO: I have heard, “Execution is where good ideas go to die.” In my experience, a well-crafted strategy, appropriate resources, and tenacious execution are all required for superior results. I bring the vision of a strategist, the pragmatism of a businessperson, and the detail-focused view of an engineer to each opportunity. By optimizing the whole process, we deliver profitable results together.

WHO I WORK WITH: I forge lasting connections with business stakeholders, customers, and partners—recognizing that one person can play all three roles—based on mutual goals and the right amount of camaraderie. I have a record of building partnerships that leverage shared resources, existing expertise, and collaboration to deliver a complete solution to market faster. For example, I drove both the Tantalus/Itron and ABB/Accenture alliances to mutual success.

WHERE I EXCEL: By incorporating strategies from R&D, sales, marketing, finance, and operations, I deliver growth for companies of diverse sizes and industries, including Fortune 100 enterprises. I’ve enjoyed multiple opportunities to start and grow multimillion-dollar revenue, as well as deliver large project revenue in new models.

WHAT I DO BEST: Envisioning | Strategic & Tactical Execution | Global Growth | Operational Planning | Strategic Partnerships | Market-driven Sales Strategies | Commercialization | Marketing | Team Building & Development | Customer Engagement | Channel Management | GE Best Practices & Six Sigma

name: Erik Logan
title: Operations, Engineering, and Product Executive
about:
Building technology companies and products has been my passion for over 25 years. My focus is on creating long term business value by planning and implementing the right products, processes, and solutions that match the needs of a specific business environment. I love diving into customer problems and solving them using creative solutions while building the right teams and infrastructure to get the job done.

Throughout my career there have been a few quotes that have stuck out with respect to my own working experiences. While most are obvious, it is the implementation of them that can be challenging. I continue to use these and others as guiding principles to push for success and to learn from failure. 

“The essence of strategy is choosing what not to do” - Michael Porter

In any business, there are finite resources. Getting all product or operational ideas out on the table and intentionally choosing what NOT to do is more important than choosing what to do. In my experiences in greenfield environments this can be easier, however over time momentum and inertia can cause priority inversion. To keep the business aligned with strategy, we had to be very intentional about how to treat new versus current ideas and continuously iterate on the question of what provides the most value. 

“There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.” - Alan Perlis

No program, process, or product will be 100% error-free. There is always a trade off of time versus perfection, technical debt versus time to market. The push and pull in every environment is different, however some details are above others with respect to your customers or internal stakeholders experience. In my career, when we ‘sweat’ those details, we were successful, even if the other areas were not 100%. 

 “Sometimes you have to take a break from being the kind of boss always trying to teach people things. Sometimes you just have to be the boss of dancing.” - Michael Scott

People need an environment where they can be successful. When a team isn’t working, it is usually a process problem or a management problem. My teams have been most successful when I have met people where they are, been human, and figured out how to help them be successful. That said, sometimes you have to leave people behind. 

“Sometimes you are the piranha, and sometimes you are the meat” - Lance Young

In life and business, there are good days and bad days. Celebrate the wins, dust yourself off from the losses and more than anything, just keep moving forward.

name: Mark Nassi
title: Chief Financial Officer at NCS Analytics
about:
Professionally: Colorado CPA with a Masters Degree in Accounting and a Bachelors Degree in Mathematics. My career started as a successful computer programmer, but after getting married and buying a house, I decided to take the H&R Block Tax course. It changed the direction of my career.

I love numbers and logic. Enjoyment is derived when taking complex data and distilling it into understandable pieces that can be used to make decisions. It’s fun showing people that although common financial statements are useful, they are universally NOT the only metrics that determine the health of a business. I’m passionate about teaching people and making a case for why other KPI’s need watching. Building processes, charts, and MD&A enriched financials is fun. I nerd-out building SQL queries to extract data and then serve as the Excel guru who can manipulate these extractions. Peace, for me, is found in organizing, improving accuracy, and building efficiencies. Not much brings more joy to me than collaboration and intelligent discourse. Creativity and entrepreneurism have played a big role in my life.

Personally: I’m a family man, married for over 20 years with two teenage daughters, a goldfish, a dog, and two cats. I enjoy lots of hobbies including art, music, photography, fly fishing, snowboarding, cross country skiing, snowshoeing, hiking, running, playing basketball, playing softball, playing board games, reading books, writing, and watching cinema. In my down time, you can try to find me in the Colorado Rocky Mountains, at or near our little cabin in the woods affectionately known as “Mark’s Happy Place."

mark@nassi.org
303-248-6285

name: Snehal Shinde
title: Pioneering AI Agents in Fintech | CPO @ Zeni | Investor @ TwinVC | 3x Entrepreneur, 2x Exits
about:
🚀 Entrepreneur | AI & Fintech Innovator | Product Leader

I thrive at the intersection of AI, fintech, and automation, building products that redefine industries and create lasting impact. With over 15 years of experience, I’ve led game-changing products, shaping the experiences of tens of millions of users globally.

Building the Future of AI-Driven Finance

As Co-founder & Chief Product Officer at Zeni, I’m pioneering the development of intelligent, human-like financial agents that seamlessly automate bookkeeping, accounting, and CFO functions. Zeni has raised $47.5M to date, and we are fundamentally transforming how businesses manage their finances—cutting costs, streamlining operations, and elevating financial decision-making with AI.

Proven Track Record: AI, Exits, & Scaling Startups

✅ Mezi – Co-founder, CPO & CTO | Built an AI-driven Travel-As-A-Service platform from the ground up. Raised $11.5M, acquired by American Express for $125M. Scaled Mezi within Amex to 100M+ users across Travel & Servicing verticals.

✅ Dhingana – Co-founder, CEO & CTO | Built India’s largest music streaming service with 10M+ monthly active users. Acquired by Rdio in 2014, where I led strategy and product expansion in emerging markets as VP of Emerging Markets.

✅ Yahoo! | Symantec | ADP – Held senior leadership roles driving product innovation in media, mobile, and security. At Yahoo!, I spearheaded efforts to make Yahoo! News, Finance, Sports & Movies more social and mobile-first, driving engagement at scale.

Expertise & Passion

🔹 AI & Automation | Fintech | SaaS | Enterprise Software
🔹 Product Strategy & Innovation | Scaling Startups | Business Growth
🔹 UX/Design Thinking | Organizational Leadership | Consumer Internet

I’m passionate about building AI-first, category-defining products that automate complex workflows, drive efficiency, and enhance user experience. If you’re working on something exciting at the intersection of AI, automation, and fintech, let’s connect!

name: Swapnil S.
title: CEO at Zeni - AI-powered Bookkeeping for startups | CEO Coach | 3x Entrepreneur with 2x exits | Advisor | Investor in 40+ startups
about:
I’m the CEO & Co-founder of Zeni.ai - Bookkeeping, Tax, and CFO Services Platform designed for Startup Founders. Zeni is my 3rd startup. I have built and sold two startups before. My first startup was Dhingana and my second startup was Mezi. 

👉 Follow me on LinkedIn if you would like to learn from my entrepreneurial journey as I routinely share key insights which can be very helpful for startup founders and executives. 

🕊 Zeni

• Zeni is the first AI-powered Finance Operations As A Service platform built for startup founders. 
• With a unique blend of AI, machine learning, and finance experts, Zeni runs all finance operations for startup founders including bookkeeping, tax services, CFO services, R&D Tax Credits, and more…
• We have raised a total of $48 million in VC funding (Series A and B)
• 200+ startup founders use Zeni to manage all their finance operations
• Zeni startup customers range from pre-revenue to $100 million-plus in revenues. Zeni scales as your startup scales. 
• Think of Zeni as your internal finance team

✈️ Mezi

• Mezi was the first AI-powered Travel As A Service platform built for business travelers
• We raised a Seed Round in 2015 and our Series A in 2016. 
• In less than 2.5 years, Mezi was acquired by American Express for a rumored $150M in cash
• Mezi now powers travel concierge and servicing for all American Express card members worldwide. 
• Mezi is one of the first human-assisted AI-powered platforms that is serving 10s of millions of customers every single month

🎶 Dhingana

• Dhingana was the biggest Indian music streaming service
• We bootstrapped it to 1 million unique monthly listeners and then raised our Series A round
• In the next 12 months we grew it to 3.5 million unique monthly listeners and raised our Series B round
• In the next 12 months we grew it to 10 million unique monthly listeners and were acquired by Rdio (started by Skype founders)

💰 I also advise and invest in early-stage startups via my fund Twin Ventures (https://twin.VC).

• Investing in AI startups is our niche 
• We only invest in deep-tech AI platforms
• We have co-invested with several VCs like A12Z, Craft Ventures, Nexus Ventures, Sierra Ventures, K9 Ventures, Saama Capital to name a few.

name: Adva Punin
title: Co-Founder/Director at MEZI
about:
Adva initially started her career as a graphic designer and then later decided to delve into jewellery design as part of her family's heritage and passion for the industry. In 2005 Adva and her sister Tal started the fashion label MEZI which has now become a recognised accessory brand specialising in fashion jewellery,  leather goods and designing for others. The company is located in Sydney with representation in Australia's leading boutiques, department stores and also international stores.

As part of their craft and design both sisters are meticulous on the overall finish and quality of every piece of jewellery and leather good that is made. They are involved in every facet of the process with the strictest approach on quality, since its an area they personally won't compromise on when delivering to their customers. 

Over the years they have seen their fashion jewellery designs on the catwalk, leading fashion publications, fashion bloggers, newspapers, popular  TV programs, celebrities and a number of other outlets.  

About MEZI
Since inception in 2005, placing great emphasis on wearable, statement pieces has become a signature of a Mezi design. The inspired creation of Australian jewellery designers Adva Punin and Tal Manning, Mezi is now recognised for its modern approach on classic features, making for standout and truly trans- seasonal collections.

Please visit the website or LinkedIn company profile for more information http://www.mezi.com.au
speaking_engagements: Interview on Breakfast With Audrey about Mezi brand and career path

name: Eugene Volkov
title: at CredoRax
about:
I bring over twenty years of technical and business experience to Micorde. A graduate from Kazan Technology University in 1988 as an "IT Digital Systems Architect" I began my career working at a leading Scientific IT technology institute dealing with different types of embedded and special purpose equipment and specifically developing real time Operating System core modules and applications. A large part of my work was dedicated to different combined software/hardware modules for the specific purpose of high performance holographic storage systems.

 Later, I started my work in the IT department of the President’s Council of the Republic of Tatarstan. The first database network that united all major government bodies of the Republic of Tatarstan was developed and implemented according to my architectural solution, under my supervision and deep involvement. 
 I became a team leader of the first electronic voting system for Parliament of the Republic of Tatarstan. It was successfully developed and installed under my direct control and management and being an extremely robust and proficient solution - has already seen three major releases. 

 In the last eleven years I had been dedicated to different technical and management tasks. From 1999 I began working in Canada as a team leader, systems architect and a chief IT developer for an e-commerce payment service provider. 

 My major areas of responsibilities were dealing with a variety of pure technical and IT security issues. I worked on several privacy related projects and encryption software modules as well as hardware tokens. The results were presented to the market in 2002 and found customers in the B2B market.

 I became a cofounder and CEO of BizChord Consulting Corporation, a multi-currency online payment and security solution provider. The company was sold to IncrediMail (NASDAQ: MAIL) in 2006.
I am married with two children and live in Toronto, Canada.
reasoning: Eugene Volkov demonstrates a strong technical background combined with proven entrepreneurial success, including a verified exit. His profile shows progression from technical roles to founding and exiting a company (BizChord Consulting Corporation) that was acquired by a public company (IncrediMail/NASDAQ: MAIL) in 2006. name: Kayla Matheus
title: Human-Robot Interaction at Amazon Lab126, Yale
about:
The short version: I’m a product leader and strategist with a background in social robotics and IOT, behavioral design, and startups. After a decade in industry, I am currently pursuing my PhD in human-robot interaction at Yale University in order to dive deeper into the user experiences and technologies of the future. 

I believe that smartphone screens are the UI of the past, and that the key to the future lies in more immersive, tangible, and human technologies. I’ve spent the latest phase of my career building these types of experiences, whether a social robot for health habits, a conversational AI for sleep, or an electric vehicle charger that comes to life. I seek to build a future where our devices help us become who we want to be, rather than sucking our energy and attention away from what it means to be human.

Prior to pursuing my PhD, I was the VP of Product at Volta Charging, responsible for millions in revenue from EV charging and media products based in connected hardware and machine learning. I was also the founder and CEO of MOTI, a minimal social robot to help user build daily health habits. A few highlights from these roles and others include:

• Led the end-to-end development of two new electric vehicle charging stations with internationally award-winning industrial design and smart sensors.
• Grew the product department at Volta by 5x in one year, including establishing the hardware, QA, and product management teams.
• Invented, designed, and founded the social robotics and behavior change startup, MOTI. Featured in Fast Company, TechCrunch, Engadget, and more.
• Selected as one of 16 designers from around the world by the Google Creative Lab for their inaugural design founders program, 30 Weeks.
• Taught design thinking at Northwestern and human-centered design with Design for America.
• Graduated with a dual degree in Mechanical Engineering and Art from Yale University and helped form the Yale Center for Engineering, Innovation, and Design.

*Speaking engagements*
I very much enjoy speaking on the topics of foundership, human-centered design, social robotics, and habit formation. In the past, I have been a guest lecturer at the Hult Business School, California College of Arts, and Stanford d.School. I have also spoken at various conferences and meetups, including: Action Design, Health 2.0, Consciousness Hacking, AI Expo North America, and the Silicon Valley Product Management Association. Please feel free to message me about speaking opportunities.
education_1_degree: MS (en route), Computer Science (focus: HRI, ML/AI)
awards_and_recognitions: Winner of the WBA Accelerator Program at the Wi-Fi Global Congress in San Jose
speaking_engagements: Interview at Wi-Fi Global Congress; Featured in WBA TV interview

name: Pulin Thakkar
title: CEO @ Polymail | Power email for operators who live in the inbox | 2x Founder (Vonly, Marketly) | 1x Exit | ex-Microsoft
about:
As CEO of Polymail, I’m building on a powerful foundation to deliver the #1 email inbox for founders, operators, and entrepreneurs. Polymail serves thousands of startups and individuals, helping them close more deals, respond faster, and stay on top of every critical thread—without the plugin chaos or missed follow-ups.

📌  Start your 7-day trial: https://polymail.io/
--------------------------
📌  See pricing: https://polymail.io/pricing
--------------------------

Previously, I pioneered innovative anti-piracy solutions that helped the world’s top media companies—like Disney, Warner Bros., and Netflix—maximize revenues for their premium digital content. Following my tenure at Microsoft—where I am a named inventor on 12+ patents—I developed a solution that delivered actionable insights for Cisco, Microsoft, and Disney to combat multibillion-dollar losses from illegal distribution. I then led Marketly to scale the industry’s best-in-class search enforcement platform, earning trust with 100+ global rights holders. To accelerate impact, I guided Marketly’s acquisition by Corsearch, expanding its reach as a leader in online brand protection.

BUILDING STRONG, SCALABLE FOUNDATIONS

I've driven growth that benefits companies, teams, and customers alike—whether within a global enterprise or a lean startup. At Marketly, I fostered a results-driven culture with nearly 100% customer and employee retention while scaling operations across Silicon Valley, Seattle, and India. At Microsoft, I contributed to internal startup teams, co-creating Microsoft’s online ad-delivery infrastructure, architecting LiveMeeting’s audio/video conferencing solution, and leading a cross-functional initiative to launch the Windows Phone app store.

A LIFELONG LEARNER & BUILDER

Inspired by my 7th-grade programming teacher, I’ve long been passionate about using technology to solve real-world problems. I pursued a computer science degree at USC to fuel my entrepreneurial ambitions, later earning my MBA from the University of Washington while working at Microsoft. Alongside leading teams and building companies, I continue to explore innovation lab projects and regularly take advanced courses at Stanford to sharpen my skills.

I’m also an active limited partner at a venture capital firm and angel investor in early-stage startups, supporting innovative founders across SaaS, AI, and tech-enabled sectors.

Props Athletics was born out of the desire to empower people to be active – to sweat! When Lauren Siegal, the founder of Props Athletics, couldn’t find a product in the marketplace that suited her needs, she took her love of design and her passion for fitness to the drawing board and created the ultimate workout glove, lauded by top fitness professionals and celebrity trainers as absolute game changers.

Props Athletics is focused on creating unique lines of fitness accessories that are all about FITNESS, FASHION & FUNCTION. PROPS gloves, our signature product, double as a sweatband, allowing you to wipe and wick away sweat while remaining completely odor free. The superior silicone grip prevents sliding on any surface, helps prevent calluses and minimizes germ transfer without any added bulk. 

PROPS help you go harder in any workout, without compromising style.  They can be used to enhance any activity, including:

name: Jud Bowman
title: Founder & CEO at Sift Media
about:
Tech entrepreneur that has been lucky enough to start 3 companies so far: Motricity, Appia, and Sift Media. 

Co-founded my first company as a high school senior at the North Carolina School of Science & Mathematics, took an indefinite leave of absence from Stanford, and helped grow Motricity to more than $100 million in annual revenue and 500 employees. Motricity's platform delivered more than $3 billion of ringtones and games to mobile phones. Investors included NEA, TCV, Carl Icahn, Noro-Moseley Partners, and Wakefield Group. Motricity successfully completed a $50 million IPO co-led by Goldman Sachs and JP Morgan and achieved a market capitalization as high as $1.25 billion. 

Founded my second start-up, Appia, in 2008 and raised $30 million in venture capital from investors including Venrock, Trident Capital, Eric Schmidt’s TomorrowVentures, Relay Ventures, Noro-Moseley Partners, and Wakefield Group. Appia's mobile user acquisition network for Android & iOS delivered more than 100 million app installs for hundreds of advertisers, including 60 of the top 100 grossing apps on the App Store and Google Play. Appia reached #467 on the Inc. 5000 and was acquired by Digital Turbine (Nasdaq: APPS) in March 2015 for approximately $100 million.

Founded my third start-up, Sift Media, in 2015 around the idea that the set of apps each of us has installed on our smartphones is like a digital fingerprint of who we are and our interests. We sift through 50 billion mobile ad requests daily, leveraging advanced AI & machine learning algorithms to hypertarget app install ads for our clients. To date, Sift Media has served 250 billion mobile ads and delivered 100 million app installs for thousands of advertisers. Sift Media’s DemandScale platform was named to the AppsFlyer Performance Index 14. Backed by $5 million in venture capital from investors including Alerion Ventures, Cofounders Capital, IDEA Fund Partners, Piedmont Capital, Tweener Fund, and Wakefield Group, Sift Media ranked #414 on Deloitte's 2021 Technology Fast 500 and #1655 on the 2021 Inc. 5000.

Currently serve on the Board of Directors of the Research Triangle Foundation and as a Trustee of the North Carolina Symphony.
education_2_school: North Carolina School of Science and Mathematics
speaking_engagements: Featured guest on First in Future podcast discussing entrepreneurship and mobile technology
notable_achievements: Co-founded Motricity with a $50 million IPO; Founded Sift Media; Sold Appia, Inc.
reasoning: Jud Bowman demonstrates an exceptional track record as an elite serial entrepreneur with multiple successful companies and exits. He has founded three significant companies, with two notable exits including an IPO and a $100M acquisition. His achievements started remarkably early (in high school) and show consistent success in scaling companies to significant revenue and valuations. The combination of a successful IPO (Motricity reaching $1.25B market cap), a $100M exit (Appia), and a current growing company (Sift Media) places him firmly in the L7 category as an Elite Serial Entrepreneur.

name: Carol Reiley
title: AI Robotics Entrepreneur|Board Member|Investor|SF Symphony Collaborative Partner|World Economics Forum YGL|Forbes Top 50 Women in Tech|Builds things that don't exist and makes humans superhumans
about:
Please reach out and email: creiley@gmail.com

A serial entrepreneur, scientist, and engineer with over 20 years of academic/industry experience in artificial intelligence and robotics (nickname: Mother of Robots). Strong leader and innovator who focuses on building teams, building trust, and building products. Strives for efficiency, high impact, and getting things done. 

Previously co-founded, was President, and board member of drive.ai, a self-driving car startup with the Stanford AI lab that was acquired by Apple. Built a 8 person company to 200+ employees over 4 years raising over $77M funding. Cofounded multiple startups and launched several robotics products in highly regulated industries. 

Creative collaborator of the SF Symphony, Board/Advisor of several AI companies.  Also active in diversity outreach events that advocate for understanding bias in AI. Work profiled in NYTimes, Harper's Bazaar, Wired, The Atlantic, etc. In 2018 was on the Top Women Founders in Tech and AI lists from Forbes, Inc, Quartz.

Research interests are on the development of intelligent robotic systems that can aid humans in performing skillful tasks more effectively. Application areas include surgery, industrial robotics, remote exploration, creative expression, and education.

Specialties:  AI, Robotics, computer vision, product strategy, fundraising, design-based research, human machine interaction, human factors, circuitry, machining, medical device design, electromechanical components,  IP development and review, FDA regulatory submissions (510(k) and IDE), surgeon training, Operating Room and surgical experience, scientific/technical presentations both academic and professional

name: Mark W. Westlake
title: CEO & Founder. GearBrain
about:
Mark W. Westlake is a veteran digital executive with a proven ability to lead and build successful digital businesses.  Over the past 27 years, he has erected a successful track record in the online world.  For the past few years, he has built a new innovative data and technology company to help simplify the Internet of Things (IoT) for consumers.  Besides a content site, GearBrain has built a patented IoT compatibility find engine called The GearBrain.  This platform is the nucleus of the GearBrain Marketplace, an open platform that helps consumers find, buy, and connect any smart device.   t also brings together manufacturers, retailers, installers/integrators to help simplify the purchasing, integration, and management of all these new smart solutions for the home, office, car, and Metaverse.  With AI's help, it's the perfect mouse trap to help us and our partners learn what devices customers have in their homes so we can upsell them additional products and services.

From his days at The Sporting News working with a team to determine how to make money in the digital world to today, Westlake has always been at the forefront of the digital world.   He has a keen eye on the market and its direction and knows how to help his businesses succeed.  Some businesses, such as AutoTrader, About.com, and Purch (formerly TechMediaNetwork), still thrive today. 

Being part of the C-suite, Westlake has played a key role in acquiring companies, raising funds, leading teams, driving strategy, and hitting revenue goals on both a domestic and international level.   e has also been part of two successful exits (About.com and HowStuffWorks) totaling over $660 million in value.

He has also been active within the industry as well as outside.   I sat on the Advisory Board for Upstream Seller Forum and was a founding member of 212 (an NYC interactive ad association).   Westlake has also served on the Advisory Board for the USA Triathlon Association and has been President of his local Little League Baseball chapter.   Lastly, Westlake also plays in a band, The Modulators, once the hottest in NYC in the 1980s.   Today, they play for fun!  His other hobbies include golf and tennis.

name: Tyler Cummings
title: Full-Stack Engineer
about:
Foremost, I have a passion for coding. Growing up, I always wondered what made games, apps, and computers tick. Some of my fondest memories are taking apart computers and putting them back together in my grandparent's basement. However, it wasn't until I installed Game Maker Studio that I realized that I loved to code and create projects using code. All throughout high school, I spent my free time learning how to code and make video games. My senior year, I took an AP Computer Science (Java) class. One of the highlights of the course was that we were tasked to come up with an Android app that would solve a problem in the community. I came up with an app that would help connect food pantries with grocery stores and other businesses. This was where I discovered SQL, XML and concepts like user authentication.

Currently, I am a junior at Illinois State University, majoring in Computer Science. I am also a Lab Assistant for Illinois State University's IT 168 class. I enjoy helping others learn code and sharing a passion with other intuitive people. My most recent personal project has been the development of a website that helps connects local businesses with local charities and food banks. Because of the pandemic, I've been inspired to take action and use my skills to help out my community. One of my biggest motives was the knowledge that more families were going to go hungry due to unemployment and the fact that schools were not meeting up in person. When I was in school I saw first hand the importance of school and the resources that it provided to needy kids. I was so lucky to find a group of friends who were just as passionate and willing to work with me on this project. For the development, we have been mainly been using GitHub, HTML5, CSS, Node.js, SQL, and JavaScript. 

My specialties include learning new skills quickly, Java, SQL, C, XML, Git, and JavaScript. I have started to learn HTML, Node.js, and CSS. I have also started studying and creating neural networks and perceptrons. I am constantly trying to learn new concepts and languages, so I can apply them to future projects.

name: Ed Boyden
title: Neuroscientist, inventor, entrepreneur.
about: Ed Boyden is Y. Eva Tan Professor in Neurotechnology at MIT, an investigator of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute and the MIT McGovern Institute and Yang Tan Collective, and professor of Brain and Cognitive Sciences, Media Arts and Sciences, and Biological Engineering at MIT. He leads the Synthetic Neurobiology Group, which develops ground truth-oriented tools for analyzing and repairing the brain, and applies them systematically to reveal fundamental mechanisms underlying brain functions, as well as to repair the brain. One ultimate goal of the group is to create biologically accurate computer simulations of entire brains, starting with small brains like those of worms and fish, and ultimately pointing towards the human brain. Through creative, ground-truth oriented, and collaborative approaches, the Boyden lab invents and discovers, and helps people grow as thinkers and leaders. Boyden has co-founded many companies, and advises many companies and non-profits.

name: Samer El Gharib
title: Founder & CEO | Slighter | Smoking Management Solution | Techstars 19’| Startup of the Year 19' | Plug and Play 19' | CES Innovation Award 19'| RAP V 20’ |
about:
Samer El Gharib is a successful entrepreneur with a passion for large-scale social change. He is the founder and CEO of Slighter, a smart device equipped with Artificial Intelligence (AI) that learns your smoking habit and assists in reducing smoking. Samer’s invention was featured in “The Next Web”, “BBC”, “Daily Mail” and won Harvard Business Week award, Big Booster and UK Lebanon Tech Hub competitions. Currently, Samer and his team are fully engaged in delivering the device to the market within a very short timeframe. 

The combination of creative and business-oriented mind that brought the success of his current endeavour comes from Samer’s diverse background in the media industry as an acclaimed actor, a general manager of three TV stations and Head of promotions department. Samer started acting and became a TV anchor at a very young age, progressively transferring his passion in acting into playing a leading role within the top management team of the TV station. He was appointed General Manager in charge of conceptualizing and bringing to life three TV stations from scratch. During this period of time, Samer got an extensive experience in building and managing teams, creating business plans and transforming business concepts into successfully operating ventures.  

Acting is both a career and passion for Samer, being constantly on the go and engaged in a conversation is his lifestyle. Having tried himself in various aspects of the media industry, he decided to become an entrepreneur, write his own script and produce his own story: Samer now plays a role of a PR leader and CEO of Slighter.

Samer believes that AI will help humans to evolve in an efficient way by changing habits and saving time. The AI technology lies at the core of Slighter algorithm that is aimed to change millions of people’s lives for better.

name: Anish Verma
title: Vistage Chair | The CEO Coach | Transforming driven individuals into inspirational leaders by empowering their minds and elevating their capabilities. Ask me how you can join our invitation-only CEO peer advisory group!
about:
Vistage has supported SMB CEOs for over 65 years, helping leaders drive meaningful impact in their businesses, communities, and personal lives. It is often lonely at the top, and as a leader constantly faced with challenges, getting unbiased input is difficult. Imagine bringing your toughest issues or opportunities to a group of fellow CEOs to help you make better decisions – that’s what happens in our peer advisory groups. 

As a Vistage Chair, I use a proven 65-year framework to simplify complex challenges and address core issues. I bring world-class speakers on topics ranging from AI to self-awareness, sparking innovation in your business. I facilitate a monthly all-day session for the group CEOs to resolve the toughest issues/challenges. During the one-on-one coaching, I tailor my approach to your unique needs, helping you rise above the details and focus on the big picture. At Vistage, our members are the real heroes, achieving remarkable success—and it's my passion to guide and support them every step of the way.

Our results speak for themselves—Dun & Bradstreet data shows Vistage member companies grow 2.2x faster than non-members, regardless of market conditions. In 2020, while non-member companies experienced a 4.7% revenue decline, Vistage members achieved an average revenue growth of 4.6%.

Send me a message if you are interested in taking your business to the next level and having a significant impact on your business, your family, and your community! Together, we achieve more faster!

Partner at G2 Venture Partners focused on investments at the intersection of advanced digital technologies and traditional industry. I started my investing career in 2003, working on the petrochemical, oil and gas and consumer portfolios at Bain Capital Credit. 

I enjoy learning about new technologies and connecting great people to great opportunities. If you are interested in connecting and we haven't met, please include a note in your networking request about the purpose for reaching out.

name: Jo Wetz
title: Chief Executive Officer at Element Materials Technology
about:
CEO of Element since 2019 and responsible for the overall strategy and growth of the Element group. Jo led the original buyout of Element in 2010 while at 3i and since joining Element full time over twelve years ago has been central in driving the growth of the group from 600 colleagues in five countries to over 9,000 colleagues in over 30 countries.  Jo led the buyout by Bridgepoint in 2015, the take private of Exova in 2017 and the buyout by Temasek in 2022.  Jo has been a member of the Group’s main Board for over 14 years.  

Prior to joining Element Jo built a career in private equity with 3i, both in London and the Amsterdam. During his time at 3i Jo led a number of successful buyouts in the UK and Europe with a particular focus on the global Testing and Inspection market, these included the investments in Inspicio and Element as well as the leading non food discount retailer, Action.  

Jo is a father to three daughters and lives in the UK.  A Chartered Accountant with a degree in Economics from University College London.

about:
I am an experienced technologist, innovator and leader with a deep background in computer science. My key strength is my ability to scale from hands-on engineering work to building and managing engineering and product organizations of hundreds of people.

In 2011, I co-founded Firefox OS, Mozilla's Web-based smartphone OS. Since 2014 I am Mozilla's CTO, responsible for Mozilla's technology and vision of the Web.

In 2015 I founded Silk Labs, an embedded machine learning startup.

I joined Apple in 2018, where I am responsible for Apple's HomeKit product.

name: Chris Jones
title: Founder & CEO @ DeepStructure: durable AI in TypeScript | Ex-{ Databricks, Mozilla, Sweat Equity } | Archer 🏹
about:
My expertise is building from zero to one.  For the last 10 years, I've been working at startups in the areas of AI, machine learning, big data, and infrastructure.  Since dropping out of the CS Ph.D program at Berkeley, I've been on a journey of designing systems of increasing scope: starting from deep technical problems early in my career, to now building teams and defining product & business strategy.

I love to make things that other people think are impossible.  In grad school, I published research on automated synthesis of high-perf parallel algorithms (15 years before LLMs).  At Mozilla, I created a mobile operating system that was built around the core of the "old, bloated, slow" Firefox desktop browser, that we got running on the lowest-end $30 smartphones.  My first startup exited to Apple after pushing the boundaries of deep learning on embedded devices.  I built an AI dog-training robot in months, and an AI-enabled GPU-accelerated Chrome browser running in the cloud.
