name: Marc Lieberman
title: Helping grateful people successfully navigate their way to & through retirement. Applying your values to your investing.
about:
I like to think of myself as a guardian for my clients. I founded my firm, Shorepine Wealth Management, with an eye towards the belief in "protect and adapt" which is what I do every day for my clients. In fact, the Shorepine tree (our namesake) is one of the most protective and adaptable trees in existence. 

There are many elements in investing, both internal and external, that can push one off their correct course. It is my job to make sure that doesn't happen. If you are an investor who is committed to your financial journey, we should talk. If you are a business executive who just doesn't have the time to consistently maintain your investments, we should talk. If you are a person that wants to apply your social values to how you invest, we should talk. I am your trusted advisor to protect you from the elements.

With a rare combination of skills that spans fundamental research, technical analysis, socially responsible investing and financial planning I am able to bring my clients the best of many worlds. 

As a past Director of Research and Portfolio Manager at a local investment manager I have the skills to manage your portfolio at an institutional level.

As a CFA Charterholder I have the passion and knowledge for investing that can help you succeed.

As Past President of the CFA Society San Francisco (~3,300 members) and a volunteer for many years I have the wherewithal to give back. I am humble enough to know that life's journey doesn't happen without help and grateful enough to give of myself.

name: Greg Segall
title: 3x Founder + CEO  |  3x Board Member  |  Advisor  --- #5to9: 9-year-old ninja warrior, tech geek, fitness freak, podcast junkie, baseball monkey, 6-string shredder
about:
Over the past 20+ years, I’ve founded and scaled 3 companies with 2 exits:

• Enterprise SaaS (VC-backed ~$50M, B-Round)
• E-Commerce Agency (bootstrapped)
• Consumer Tech (bootstrapped)

During this journey, I've been fortunate enough to work with some of the most passionate, caring, and driven people in the world. Building businesses and uniting a diverse set of people to accomplish a shared vision and mission is what I love.

My most recent venture was Alyce - www.alyce.com, acquired in February 2024. This enterprise SaaS platform made gifting not just a marketing and sales tool, but also a mindset and approach to creating authentic business relationships. Tens of thousands of marketers and sellers used Alyce to strengthen their most important connections, all while making a positive impact on the world.

Before Alyce, I founded One Pica (now Astound Digital), a global e-commerce agency. I was a part of this company until its acquisition in December 2012. During my time there, I helped build some of the largest commerce and supply chain infrastructures in the world for companies like 3M and Scholastic.

I've also helped grow and facilitate the acquisitions of several retailers, taking them from six-figure revenue to hundreds of millions of dollars in revenue in just a few years. It's all about execution.

In addition to building businesses, I am passionate about mentoring and advising women and underrepresented founders, especially having a daughter who I want to see have every opportunity I have had.

My #5to9: I'm a fitness enthusiast and peanut butter nut (dad joke). I also love recreational sports -- baseball, softball, and basketball -- but I tend to get a little too competitive and sometimes end up injuring myself.

I'm always on the lookout to participate in the next big opportunity and I'm fascinated by new frontiers in consumer and enterprise products and tech, the applications of generative AI across every industry, and the future of commerce.

I have a few things cookin'... but I'm always open to exploring new opportunities and having conversations with like-minded people.

name: Lucas Judice
title: CEO @Freatz | Data & AI Executive | Lawyer | Business Advisor | Author
about:
Throughout my life, I've been driven by a relentless pursuit of challenges and personal growth. From my early days selling lemonade at my parent's beach house in Brazil at 5 years old to my initial foray into the legal world, and now my transition into the tech entrepreneurial space, my journey has been marked by determination, adaptability, and a keen sense for business opportunities.

At 14, I began my professional journey as a mail clerk in a law firm, showcasing my early organizational and communication skills. I eventually transitioned into an intern role, honing my analytical and problem-solving abilities. By 22, after completing Law School, I was deeply immersed in the legal world, demonstrating a strong aptitude for legal research, negotiation, and client relations. My contributions to the field were further solidified with the publication of three books, including two titled "Startup Law" in Brazil, and several articles in specialized journals. Notably, my thesis garnered recognition and was cited by Supreme Court Justices, also in Brazil.

2008 was a pivotal year. I founded the Pimenta Judice Law Office and celebrated the birth of my twins (later in 2011 followed by the birth of my third child). 

The publication of my books, especially "Startup Law," marked the beginning of my transition from a legal expert to a tech entrepreneur, bridging the gap between law and the startup ecosystem.

In 2012, inspired by my writings and the evolving tech landscape, I established MidStage Ventures, a venture builder that evolved from my law practice. This endeavor not only renewed the excitement I felt as a young entrepreneur but also showcased my ability to innovate and scale businesses.

Relocating to Los Angeles in 2013 was another transformative moment. In LA, I expanded MidStage Ventures internationally and pursued a Master's degree from the University of Southern California. This academic pursuit at USC was a pivotal moment, further steering my career towards tech entrepreneurship and broadening my horizons.

Today, with experience on the Board of Directors for 20 companies and a rich history in international ventures and conferences, I lead as the CEO of Freatz / AlmoçoGrátis in both Brazil and the United States. My journey from the legal realm to the tech world underscores my adaptability, cross-cultural management skills, and global business strategy expertise.
education_2_degree: Master of Laws (LL.M.) - Civil Procedure, Civil Procedure
speaking_engagements: Mission Matters podcast interview; Restaurant Technology Guys podcast interview
notable_achievements: Published two books about startup law; Transitioned from lawyer to tech entrepreneur; CEO of Freatz / AlmoçoGrátis in Brazil and the United States
reasoning: Lucas Judice demonstrates a strong track record as both a legal professional and entrepreneur, with evidence of successful business building and operational experience. His progression from founding a law firm to establishing MidStage Ventures (a venture builder) and now leading Freatz shows a clear pattern of entrepreneurial growth. His experience on the Board of Directors for 20 companies, international business expansion, and thought leadership through published books on Startup Law indicate proven operational capabilities and domain expertise. However, while impressive, there's no clear evidence of major exits (>$100M) or unicorn-scale companies that would qualify for higher levels.

name: Neil Mandt
title: Producer/Director/Explorer/Professional Sports Owner/XR Pioneer - 3,000+ TV shows, 127 countries, 10 Emmy nominations, 10 movies, 7 continents & 5 Emmy Wins.
about:
Neil Mandt is a 5-time Emmy®-winning producer, seasoned Hollywood director, and pioneering entrepreneur at the forefront of Digital Rights for real estate. Over a 30-year media career, he has produced more than 3,000 episodes of television and multiple feature films for studios including Disney and A24. He produced the first Super Bowl in virtual reality, co-founded an MMA league in China, built one of the earliest AR platforms for true-crime storytelling, and has developed immersive content across AI, VR, and gaming.

A creative thinker with an extraordinary breadth of experience in producing feature films, network television, Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality content, since 2015, Neil has been the driving force behind the creation of the Digital Property Rights industry. He is the Founder of Digital Rights Management (DRM), the first platform enabling real estate owners to register, protect, and monetize their digital airspace. As the only figure equally rooted in high-level entertainment and property technology, he brings a rare combination of creative mastery and entrepreneurial innovation - cementing his role as the definitive leader in this emerging field.

On the entertainment front, Neil has sold projects to and produced television and film productions for every conglomerate in Hollywood. His credits include producing movies for Disney, A24, HBO, Showtime, Starz & Lionsgate, the Olympics Games, the OJ Simpson Criminal Trial for ABC News, the Golden Globe Awards and the creation of series television for ESPN, NBC Universal, CBS, ABC, FOX, Discovery, FOOD Network, Travel Channel, Sony & Showtime to name a few.

Neil also frequently advises a range of corporations, from Fortune 500 companies to innovative start-ups, helping them refine their identities, clarify their objectives, and realize their content strategy in ways that resonate with digitally-native audiences.

about: I am a jack of all trades but a master of wireless networking. My tryst with wireless started way back before the start of this century. During my masters, I wrote the first version of a new wireless MAC layer called the Redundant Tree Network (RTN), which provided fault tolerance to Bluetooth when the original Bluetooth was designed to carry mostly audio data. Fast forward 18 years; I now have a company that is commercializing all my work, including several published journals in IEEE mobile computing. Edyza Inc. is primarily operating in indoor farming and is revolutionizing the concept of microclimate tracking, machine diagnostics, and pest pressure estimation. name: Artem Mariychin
title: Managing Director at Anthelion Capital
about:
Experienced leader specializing in creating, improving, and investing in businesses through the use of data science and technology. Throughout his career, Artem has focused on combining statistical and quantitative analysis of granular data with deep fundamental research in order to understand investment opportunities, financial strategy, and business operations. 

In his prior role as Senior Director of Member Data Science at Nike, Artem managed a team across functions including data science, engineering, and product. Artem joined Nike when his company, Zodiac, was acquired. Zodiac was a predictive analytics company that he co-founded with Professors Peter Fader and Dan McCarthy. As CEO of Zodiac, Artem built a company that forecasted individual customer behavior and lifetime value for brands, which allowed Zodiac's clients to improve strategic decision-making and business operations. 

Previously, Artem was an investor at companies including Goldman Sachs, Highbridge Capital, 3G Capital, and Perry Creek Capital where he focused on identifying investment opportunities arising from industries undergoing structural change, companies facing complex situations, and disruptive technologies. 

Originally from Moscow, Russia, he grew up near Detroit, Michigan and graduated summa cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania. His interests include renewable energy, artificial intelligence/machine learning, and genomics.

name: Daniel McCarthy
title: Associate Professor of Marketing at the Robert H. Smith School of Business, University of Maryland, College Park
about:
I am an Associate Professor of Marketing at the University of Maryland's Robert H. Smith School of Business. I popularized customer-based corporate valuation, a "bottom-up" approach to valuing firms by assessing the value of their customers. My other areas of research include data fusion, data privacy, missing data problems, machine learning, and causal inference.

My research has been accepted and published in top-tier academic journals such as the Journal of Marketing Research, Marketing Science, Journal of Marketing, Journal of the American Statistical Association: Theory and Methods, and Annals of Applied Statistics. My work has also been featured in media outlets such as the Harvard Business Review, Wall Street Journal, FT, Fortune, The Economist, Inc, USA Today, Barron's, CBS, CNBC, Slate, Business Insider, and CFO Magazine. I have won numerous awards, including the Don Lehmann Award, Robert J. Lavidge Award, MSI Alden G. Clayton Award, ISMS Award, Shankar-Spiegel Award, and Gary Lilien ISMS-MSI-EMAC Practice Prize. I was also a finalist for many others, including the Paul Green, John A. Howard/AMA, JM Hunt/Maynard, and MSI H. Paul Root Awards.

In 2015, I co-founded a predictive analytics company, Zodiac, where I served as the Chief Statistician. Zodiac was acquired by Nike in March 2018. I subsequently co-founded Theta to commercialize my work on customer-based corporate valuation.

Before joining the University of Maryland, I was an Assistant Professor of Marketing at Emory University's Goizueta School of Business. I hold a Ph.D. in Statistics from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. I also earned a BSc in Economics with a concentration in Statistics and Finance from The Wharton School and a BAS in Systems Science Engineering from the School of Engineering and Applied Science, as part of the Jerome Fisher Program in Management and Technology at the University of Pennsylvania.

name: Paul Everton

about:
Paul has founded four technology companies, MessageControl (acquired 2020), Konverse, CalendarBridge and Visible Vote (acquired 2011) over the past 12 years.

Paul's most recent company sale, MessageControl, was sold to a public company Mimecast. The product became Mimecast's CyberGraph product which is now protecting millions of users from advanced phishing and identity threats.

Prior to his first company, Paul developed and sold technology solutions to Fortune 100 companies, large enterprises and mid-sized consumer businesses while working for Check Point Software, F5 Networks, Riverbed Technologies, and Radiant Systems.

Paul’s passion is in finding opportunities where software can solve real business needs and seeing that software deployed to millions of users. He started programming at the age of 12 and went on to get his B.S. in Computer Science from Georgia Tech. He previously won the Chicago Innovation Award and currently holds 10 patents spanning multiple technologies.

Presently, Paul serves on the boards of CalendarBridge, Konverse and Georgia Institute Technology’s College of Computing.

name: Erik Katz
title: Entrepreneur, C-Suite Executive, Board Member & Strategic Consultant
about:
“Regret and fear are twin thieves who would rob us of today,” writes Robert Hastings in his poem, “The Station.” In this poem, Hastings advocates for relishing the moment and living for the journey, as opposed to remaining always focused on some future achievement or final destination. For many years, this philosophy has guided not only my personal but also my professional life: how can I use my skills and expertise to live a purpose-filled, results-driven life each day in ways that are meaningful to me and beneficial to society at large? 

It was these aspirations that led me to leave investment banking and apply my commercial abilities towards climate solutions and social impact. This principle of living purposefully and in the moment also informs my belief in the importance of adaptability, resourcefulness, and action by quickly triaging and implementing optimal solutions.

With these ideas as my north star, I’ve had the privilege of accomplishing a great many things, of which I’m very proud. Some major accomplishments include:

✓ I raised $1.1B in private equity capital for nature-based and infrastructure decarbonization projects, including $500M from a single PE investor that led to purchase of one of the world’s largest forestry companies.
✓ I raised $10M in seed capital for tech-led communications, energy conservation, and social impact ventures.
✓ I developed strategic partnerships with world leading financial institutions, including First Reserve, Goldman Sachs, Oak Hill, Och-Ziff, TPG, and UBS.  
✓ I led two of Blackstone’s largest M&A transactions: the $12B merger of Albertsons and American Stores, and the $17B sale of Albertsons to SuperValu, CVS, and Cerberus consortium.
✓ I have broad industry and functional leadership experience as Founder, CEO, COO, CDO, Board Member, and M&A advisor.

These accomplishments were made possible through a focused assessment of the resources at hand and a desire to use those resources to create positive change. I look forward to continuing to help companies in growth or transition phases to achieve tangible and durable success.
reasoning: Erik Katz demonstrates significant executive experience and deal-making capabilities, particularly in investment banking and private equity. While he has founded ventures, his strength lies in his proven operational and deal-making experience at major institutions like Blackstone. His profile shows he has successfully operated at senior levels, led major transactions, and raised significant capital. name: Marc Cohen

about: Marc Cohen is an entrepreneur with more than 30 years experience creating, managing and transitioning successful businesses. Since 1984, Marc in partnership with his brother Jeff, has founded and sold five of their companies to publicly traded entities.  Marc is a cofounder and the CEO of Wrinkl, Inc. an award winning group messaging platform based in Philadelphia, PA. Marc was the co-founder and CEO of Teleperformance Interactive, an automated technology company that he sold to French multinational Teleperformance in 2008.  Prior to founding Teleperformance Interactive, Marc co-founded Campus Direct (sold to National Student Clearinghouse in 2004), Voice FX Corporation (sold to Student Advantage, Inc. 1999), FX Direct, Inc. (sold to Telespectrum Worldwide, Inc. in 1997) and Advanced Voice Systems, Inc. (sold to MCI Communications in 1989).  Marc was named Young Entrepreneur of the Year by the Philadelphia Chamber of Commerce in 1989 and was twice named one of the “40 under 40” by the Philadelphia Business Journal. Marc has been a guest speaker at The Wharton School of Business (University of Pennsylvania), Temple University (Philadelphia) and St. Petersburg University (Russia).  Marc holds a number of patents in the areas of interactive voice response, directed advertising via the Internet and group messaging.

name: Jeffrey A. Cohen
title: Wrinkl, Inc.
about:
After graduating from law school, I focused on corporate and appellate litigation before going into business. 

Since 1996, in partnership with my brother Marc, I've founded and sold four technology businesses to publicly traded companies.

Until April 2008, I was co-CEO of Teleperformance Interactive, the automated technologies company Marc and I sold to Teleperformance in 2004. Teleperformance is the world’s leading customer relations management company with about 300,000 employees.

After selling Teleperformance Interactive, my brother and I founded Techstar Partners, LLC, through which we invest in technology companies and advise them. 

My first novel, The Killing of Mindi Quintana, was published by Welcome Rain in 2010. I am nearing completion of my second.

In 2015, Marc, Erik Katz, and I founded Wrinkl, Inc. Wrinkl is the group messaging platform built specifically for business users.

Serial entrepreneur and AI innovation leader with 25+ years of building and scaling technology companies from inception to successful exit.

CREATIVE VENTURES 
Beyond traditional technology ventures, Mr. Smith founded Black Tongue Society, a side project exploring the intersection of AI, art, and human sensory experience. This passion project produced Sense and Anchor, an AI platform that reimagines wine discovery through emotional connections rather than technical terminology. As the co-owner and winemaker of KHR Vintners in Sonoma, he brings innovation to artisanal winemaking, exemplifying his belief that technology should enhance rather than replace authentic human experiences.

Mr. Smith's career embodies the principle that transformative technology works best when it amplifies human potential, whether in pharmaceutical intelligence, healthcare equity, or the visceral world of wine.

about:
A Deal Maker in the AI Space! 

For the past 8 years, every night after my final meeting at midnight, I have seen this scene unfold. (The night view on the iPhone makes everything look brighter, :))

My journey as a researcher in self-driving car-related technologies began 23 years ago. 

However, it was in 2016 when I realized the imminent rise of AI and knew I had to be a part of it. 

That year, I launched a leading AI headhunting firm, followed by an AI-focused media outlet that covers significant advancements in AI research and startups.

name: Lamar Tyler
title: I've helped over 20,000 Black Entrepreneurs WIN | Chief Executive Officer at Tyler New Media, LLC | Founder Traffic Sales & Profit | Business & Marketing Keynote Speaker
about:
Lamar Tyler is the CEO and co-founder of Tyler New Media - one of the fastest-growing private companies in America recognized by Inc. magazine on its annual Inc. 5000 list (2021, 2022, 2023 & 2024). The parent company of the celebrated Traffic Sales and Profit (TSP), America’s premier learning community of over 47K purpose-driven Black businesses and entrepreneurs, Lamar created his platform alongside his wife, Ronnie Tyler, to not only help guide Black businesses and families to discover their true purpose and legacy, but to also change the economic landscape of the Black community by closing the wealth gap through entrepreneurship. He is also the visionary and creator of the 2x Telly Award-winning streaming platform, theConvo™, which has been deemed the ultimate destination for conversations around Black entrepreneurship, Black wealth and the new Black history!


Lamar is one of the leading and most influential voices in business and digital marketing and has received countless recognition for his work, including being listed as one of Ebony Magazine's Power 100, selected as a finalist for Black Enterprise's Family Business of the Year, and for Infusionsoft’s Small Business ICON Award, as well as the recipient of the ClickFunnels Two Comma Club X Award and the ClickFunnels Bootstrapped Entrepreneur of the Year Award for Coaching & Consulting (2023).


Lamar is also the author of two books, Traffic, Sales and Profit: The Ultimate Step-by-Step Guide to Creating Consistent Business Revenue Online and The Gatekeepers are Gone: Hustle + Technology = Success, and has been featured on CNN, HLN, Today, Good Morning America, NPR, Washington Post, Entrepreneur, ESSENCE, Parenting Magazine and more.

name: Krystal Zell
title: CEO | Chief Customer Officer | Ex Tonal, Home Depot, Starwood Hotels, Bain & Co
about:
I have had an exciting and adventurous career with incredible brands over the last 24+ years.  Most recently, I was the CEO of Tonal, the world’s most advanced and convenient connected fitness experience.  I led the company through the challenges of recalibrating to a post-covid environment, while leaning into our DNA to innovate our member experiences and develop the next gen product (Tonal 2).  I had the privilege of working with an incredible team to set the company up for a bright future.  I left late last year after we achieved several key goals primarily because I wanted to discontinue commuting to SF. I am enjoying some time off but beginning to consider new adventures.

Prior to Tonal, I had 20+ years experience building incredible customer experiences to drive growth in retail and hospitality.  I had the privilege of leading several extraordinary teams for The Home Depot, one of the most iconic companies in American history in a category that truly impacts the quality of people’s lives by helping them improve their homes. I was also fortunate to work for Starwood Hotels helping to deliver memorable experiences to our guests as they traveled for business or explored the world. I believe in the transformative experience of travel and hospitality and the soul-nurturing power of home. I’ve been lucky to work in both worlds.

I thrive working at the intersection of all the modern functional disciplines required for growth – product (digital and physical), marketing, service, digital, in-store/on-premise, brand, technology, analytics, and more. I believe that really connecting with customers requires the skills of balancing the art and humanity of commerce with the modern sciences of data, analytics and engineering. Ultimately, I believe in keeping the human - customer or employee - at the center of decisions. I have always believed in taking care of customers first and I’ve had the privilege of learning from amazing companies with the same ethos – The Home Depot and Starwood Hotels.

I’m passionate about hiring and nurturing talent and building world-class teams that succeed together. I also believe in creating environments where diverse opinions are welcomed and teams believe in collaboration in order to drive superior results.

When I’m not working, I spend time with my family and raising two wonderful children along with my husband in Atlanta.

name: Arshad Hisham
title: Founder | CEO | Executive Leader | Engineer | Educator | Inventor | Investor | Board Member | Serial Entrepreneur
about:
I am an internationally recognized serial entrepreneur, Executive Leader, CEO, Board Member, Educator, Angel Investor, Engineer, and Inventor with degrees in Business, Engineering, and an MBA.  I am driven and motivated with a proven track record of exceptional achievements. I have built companies from simple ideas into multimillion-dollar businesses, secured global press coverage, and negotiated complex exit sales to billion-dollar conglomerates.

I served on advisory councils at universities like Cal State East Bay and on the jury selection committee  for the Prestigious Edison Awards. My work in AI, Automation, and Robotics has been featured in Fortune, Forbes, Discovery Channel, IEEE, and Popular Science. As a frequent speaker, I have delivered keynotes at the IEEE Robotics Symposium, Boston Consulting Group’s AI Summit, Walt Disney, City of Tomorrow Summit, and Robo-Business.

As a top operations executive, I’ve led digital transformations for Silicon Valley high-tech firms and Fortune 50 companies, driving growth across diverse sectors like healthcare, retail, banking, and consumer goods. I am also a board member and advisor to emerging tech companies, particularly in AI, automation, cybersecurity, blockchain, and robotics, with experience at IBM, the Australian government, and Toyota.

Between 2008 and 2015, I founded four rapidly growing startups in Enterprise Software, Vehicle Fleet Analytics, POS Systems, and Online Gaming (B2C). Since founding InGen Dynamics in 2017, I have driven growth and innovation in AI, Automation, and Robotics. Our products such as Aido, Sentinel, Kaiser.Haus, and Origami, address global challenges like labor shortages and environmental sustainability. By 2025, we achieved an $80M revenue pipeline, and with over 750,000 hours of field operations.

My products and companies have been published and taught in high school textbooks and referenced by prestigious institutions like MIT, the University of Pennsylvania, Kessel, and IEEE. ASME( American Society of Mechanical Engineers ) recently featured my company and profile in a cover article.

name: Shaun McCarthy
title: President and CRO, Spectrum Effect | Advisory Board, Joyous | Board, National Spectrum Consortium
about:
With over 20 years of experience in the technology industry, I have led global sales and customer experience teams for Nokia and Cisco, two of the world's leading providers of networking, cloud, and 5G solutions. I have built and maintained strategic partnerships with C-Suite executives in various markets, driving profitable growth and customer satisfaction.

As the former President of North America for Nokia, I oversaw the operations and performance of the region, managing a portfolio of products and services across wireless, fixed, SaaS solutions, and optical networks. I also served as the CEO of Nokia USA and the SVP of North America Sales and CX, leading the field teams for the largest and most influential customers in the continent. Previously, I was the VP of World Wide Sales for Cisco's Mass Scale Infrastructure Group, where I led the global sales and technology specialists that helped customers transition to Software Defined and Automation based Operations, Cloud Architectures and 5G. I also managed Cisco's global relationship with AT&T, its largest individual customer and channel partner, as the VP and General Manager of the AT&T account.

I am passionate about building world-class teams and delivering results that exceed expectations. I believe in data-driven decision making and an empathetic approach to understanding the needs of customers, employees, partners, and other stakeholders. I am a collaborative, transparent, and inspiring leader who knows how to simplify complex problems and drive creative solutions. I live by three rules in my life and career, and I try to instill the same mentality in my team: listen, learn and form your own opinion; figure out what you are good at and use it to develop your personal brand; and always be customer obsessed and live by the 99-year plan.

I am excited by the opportunities and challenges that the technology industry faces today, as legacy operations are being disrupted, new business models are emerging, and AI and 5G are playing a role in everything. I have learned from my experience with Nokia and Cisco that nothing is impossible when you have a clear vision, a strong team, and a trusted partner. I am determined to make the impossible happen with my team, customers, and partners every day.

name: R. Nick Bryan
title: CEO at Galileo CDS
about: I work with small focused teams to build & scale businesses.  Building a resilient foundation for a fledgling business is a hard and multifaceted challenge.  It involves finding the right problems to solve for customers, figuring out the value in solving those problems, and then building the product and distribution channels with the right pricing to share in that value. name: Saeid Hejazi
title: CEO at Allied Shielding
about:
I'm currently the CEO of Allied Shielding. We provide governments, defense, military, and critical infrastructure with electromagnetic and radio frequency shielding against interference, eavesdropping, and sabotage. For example, protection against the ever-growing threat of an Electromagnetic Pulse (EMP).

Our clients include the US Army Corps of Engineers (USACE), US Navy (NAVFAC), and regional Middle East defense agencies such as Qatar's Ministry of Defense, Saudi's Ministry of Interior, Jordan's Royal Hashemite Court, and others. 

We specialize in shielding operations and tactical centers, data centers, technical surveillance countermeasure facilities, and more. Our solutions cover the whole electromagnetic spectrum and can achieve attenuation levels of 60 dB against eavesdropping, 80 dB against HEMP attacks, and 100 dB against EM noise. 


Previously, I was the CEO of Wally AI, a generative AI financial advisor. With 15,000 banks, brokerages services, mortgages, and crypto-wallets from 70 countries connected to our AI, we provide people with a conversational experience that delves into their financial patterns, tailoring strategies and insights to their unique situations. 

Before Wally, I was the CEO of Nahel. With a team of 70 amazing hustlers, we built the first “Amazon for the Middle East” that sold 60,000 products across 11 categories to consumers in the UAE and the region. Regional logistics giant Aramex acquired Nahel. 

And before that, I was studying computer science at York University. In my third year, I won a Canadian business plan competition hosted by the University of Toronto which caught the attention and interest of some investors and gave me the confidence to build what became Nahel.
notable_achievements: Founded Nahel, which became the first 'Amazon of the Middle East' before being acquired by Aramex; Co-founded Wally, a personal finance app used in 70 countries
reasoning: Saeid Hejazi demonstrates a clear pattern of successful entrepreneurship with at least one verified exit (Nahel acquired by Aramex) and multiple leadership roles in significant companies. His progression from winning a business plan competition to building a 70-person e-commerce company that was acquired, followed by founding an AI company with significant scale (15,000 financial institutions connected) and now leading a defense contractor serving major government clients shows proven operational capability and consistent growth in responsibility and impact. The acquisition of Nahel by Aramex (a major regional logistics company) particularly stands out as a concrete exit achievement. While impressive, the available information doesn't yet support classification at L5 or above, as we don't have specific valuation or funding data for the exit or current ventures.

name: Chris Petrakis
title: Chief Commercial Officer
about:
“Opportunity lies in the place where the complaints are” – Jack Ma.

Chris Petrakis is an award winning entrepreneurial business leader, visionary, patent holder, and sales relationship expert.  With 35 years of experience as a serial entrepreneurial (three successful exits) and corporate sales leader, he brings his creativity and customer relations skills into play in each and every role. Prior to founding Harbor Wound Care Consulting, LLC; & co-founding US Mask Supply, Solebrity, & Cura AI, he spent his energy in the Federal IT Contracting, Med/Surg, and Healthcare Supplies markets while patenting products for his consumer products company (On The Edge Creations).  On The Edge Creations enjoyed market success with Brookstone, Sears, regional retailers, and many E-Commerce corporations.  This experience provided him unique insights into manufacturing (domestic & International) as well as the logistical efficiencies of online commerce markets.  Additional successes were enjoyed as either Sole Owner or Co-Founder of two companies in the medical and hospitality arenas.  Chris' entrepreneurial experience has provided him a deep understanding of Global Manufacturing Markets, International Commerce, and Logistics.  He continues to enjoy the luxury of past clients calling him a "friend" and his relationships run far and deep with both domestic & global business leaders.

Mr Ramsay Brown is a neuroscientist and technology executive. 

He is the founder and CEO of Mission Control AI Public Benefit Corporation, a San Francisco-based technology company building the future of highly autonomous AI systems and the M2M economy. 

He works where emerging technologies and critical challenges intersect: building companies and technology alike. His expertise includes synthetic workers, AI autonomy, machine-to-machine economics, AI Safety, AI and industrial policy, digital therapeutics, immersive reality, behavioral engineering, brain mapping, ocean desalination, and theoretical nanochemistry. 

Mr Brown has advised both the private and public sector enterprises; including the Departments of State and Defense; and NATO. He holds a MS degree in Neuroinformatics from the University of Southern California (Fight On) and is currently a Senior Research Associate at Cambridge University in the United Kingdom (Jesus College).

name: Vishwanath Parameswaran
title: Global Executive Coach,  Co-Founder - Boundless Minds, Author
about:
As an Executive Coach, my work is focused on building transformative, eco-systemic leadership. I am also the co-founder of Boundless Minds, a platform  focussing on Emotional Intelligence education for children.

As a credentialed Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coach Federation (ICF), I have worked with senior leaders across the globe spanning US, Asia, Middle East and Europe, enabling them to lead successfully in times of increasing complexity and uncertainty. 

Its been my privilege to have worked with several Fortune 500 organizations, facilitating senior leadership workshops on Strategic Planning, Culture Transformation and Leadership Capability building.  My consulting assignments revolve around Executive Coaching, Leadership development, Culture change, Change acceleration and and Organization design. 

I am the co-author of the book - Discover the Alchemist Within (https://www.amazon.in/Discover-Alchemist-Within-Towards-Personal-ebook/dp/B07HF57Z8D), a guide to personal growth and transformation. My articles have also been published in Forbes, The Hindu Business Line and other Indian Publications.

I was also a part of the Forbes Coaches Council and am also a Hogan certified coach. I also work as an Executive Coach with Coaching 4 Good, ( https://coaching4good.com), a leading Career Coaching and Leadership Development firm based out of Austin, Texas.  My professional accreditations include the Myer Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI), The Leadership Circle (TLC) and am also the co-architect of the Transformative Alignment Mapper (TAM), a tool to identify, align and unleash the transformative potential of individuals, teams and organizations.

Some of the organizations I have worked with include McKinsey, Barclays Bank, Adobe, Deloitte, Shell, Texas Instruments and Philips Research, Bath Consulting, Thought Works, Tata Power, VeriSign, Monsanto, SAP, ARM, Cisco, Geometric, Crisil, Bharti Axa, Nokia, NetApp, True North and Epsilon

I hold an MBA in Human Resources from XLRI, Jamshedpur and my last corporate assignment was as the Head of Human Resources for Motorola Software in India. 

I am an avid trekker, and among others, have summited Mount Kilimanjaro and also been to the Everest Base camp. I also dabble in music production and short films.

Website: http://www.transformational-coaching.org 
E mail : vishysmail@gmail.com

As the founder of Spaded, I am on a mission to revolutionize the service industry with a groundbreaking platform that matches service industry workers with available shifts, monetizing their skills and providing an innovative solution to the high turnover rates and staffing issues plaguing the hospitality industry. With over a decade of experience in product development and executing go to market strategies, I have a proven track record of creating and scaling successful products and services that enhance profitability and sustainability.

Prior to Spaded, I co-founded and led Skycision, a SaaS aerial monitoring solution that leveraged drone-collected spectral imagery to help farmers optimize their crop management. I raised over $1M in venture capital, directed and oversaw all aspects of the business, designed and launched two iOS applications and a web app, and earned recognition and awards from the Pittsburgh Tech Council and Forbes.

I also have extensive experience as a freelancer catalyzing business growth, providing mentorship, coaching entrepreneurs, and consulting with early-stage startups across various domains and industries. 

I hold an M.S. in Information Systems Management from Carnegie Mellon University concentrated in Data Mining, and completed my B.S. at Norwich University in Computer Security & Information Assurance.

name: Nikhil Srinivasan
title: Stablecoins at Infinite | Previously Sardine, Distributed Systems (acq. Coinbase) | F30U30
about:
Nikhil Srinivasan is a product leader with over a decade of experience in the tech industry and cofounder and CEO of Infinite.

Most recently, Nikhil led product at Sardine, before which he was the cofounder and CPO/COO of Islands, where he led product engineering and business operations. Prior to that, he led technical product on the Crypto and New Assets teams at Coinbase, which were responsible for scaling technical and operational aspects of new asset additions. He joined via the acquisition of his first startup, Distributed Systems, where he was the cofounder and CEO.

Prior to his entrepreneurial career, after dropping out of college, he served as a product manager at a growth-stage mobile monetization startup. Before his startup days, he conducted research at the prestigious Wyss Institute of Biologically Inspired Engineering, working in George Church's synthetic biology lab.

Nikhil is also an active angel investor backing moonshot founders via his Spearhead fund. He was awarded Forbes 30 Under 30 for Enterprise Tech in 2019 and is active @nvs on Twitter.

name: Allison Bentley
title: founder | distributed systems company (stealth)
about:
At the intersection of robotics, networked systems, and machine learning, I build intelligent, connected hardware-software solutions that solve real-world challenges. My engineering approach combines deep technical expertise in autonomous systems with practical deployment experience across cloud, edge, and robotic platforms.

As the first full-time hire at Mycro Harvest, I architected a complete IoT ecosystem for agricultural monitoring—integrating edge sensors, networked communications, and cloud analytics into a cohesive system. I implemented both the infrastructure layer (Kubernetes, CI/CD, secure remote device management) and the application layer (REST APIs, React frontends, data visualization), while collaborating on the hardware design and firmware that powers our edge devices.

My academic research explored statistical optimization of neural network architectures for autonomous control systems, where I developed methods to balance inference latency with model performance—a critical consideration for robotics applications. I created a complete simulation environment that follows the OpenAI Gymnasium standard, enabling rapid testing of control algorithms under realistic conditions.

My robotics experience includes implementing SLAM, path planning algorithms, and motor control logic, as well as creating containerized architectures with ROS for autonomous navigation. I've designed systems that effectively process sensor fusion data (vision + depth) for 3D object detection and classification, essential for robot-environment interaction.

I'm particularly passionate about networked robotics challenges—how to create resilient, distributed systems that can intelligently coordinate action across multiple agents and varying network conditions. My work spans the full technology stack, from low-level embedded programming (FreeRTOS, ESP-IDF) to cloud orchestration (Kubernetes), unified by a consistent focus on building reliable, adaptable autonomous systems.

My technical toolkit encompasses Python, C++, TypeScript, ROS, PyTorch, TensorFlow, and modern cloud infrastructure tools—all applied with a systems thinking approach that considers both theoretical performance and practical deployment constraints.

education_2_degree: Bachelor of Applied Science (BASc), Mechanical Engineering

name: Yiwen Huang
title: Let's reinvent the pharma industry with AI!
about:
Yiwen Huang is the Founder and former CEO of R2.ai, an innovative AutoML platform empowering both AI experts and business professionals to independently develop and deploy high-quality AI solutions. Now as R2.ai becomes part of the Pharmaron family, Yiwen is excited to return to the intersection of AI and science, driving transformative AI advancements within the pharmaceutical industry.

Originally a chemist, Yiwen began working with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning in 1995 when his PhD research required him to write his own backpropagation neural network and other machine learning algorithms. 

Excited by the possibilities the world of data management and machine learning had to offer, Yiwen entered the world of enterprise software development full time in 1998. 

As the Product Director at Teradata, Yiwen directed the development of the first distributed ML platform, revolutionizing the world of ML with a platform that cut the time to train a model with terabytes of data from several weeks - to mere minutes.

But even with those advancements, most businesses still struggled to adopt machine learning because they didn’t have enough expertise in-house.

In 2015, Yiwen started R2.ai with the goal of making AI accessible for businesses of all sizes by automating heavy lifting of the ML  development so both AI experts and non-experts could quickly develop and deploy solutions to real business problems.

Today, R2.ai  is a recognized pioneer in the market, with over 2,200 users.

Companies benefit most from R2.ai’s platform:

-- Have large volumes of data, and want to leverage those massive data sets into better customer experiences, revenue, or risk management (but may be concerned about the upfront cost)

-- Want to accelerate their current ML projects - knowing they provide a key advantage over their competitors

-- Are looking for a way to leverage AI and ML with their existing resources (whether they have in-house machine learning experts or not)

-- Believe in continuous improvement and are looking for a way to further improve their ML Models

To learn more about how R2.ai can support your business goals, send Yiwen a message here on LinkedIn and he'll be happy to connect you with the R2 team or your own free trial account.

name: Scott Stuart
title:
Restructuring CEO | Global Non-Profit Leader 
Turnaround Advisor
about:
As the CEO of Turnaround Management Association (TMA), I lead a global non-profit organization that strengthens the economy by helping distressed companies improve performance, manage disruption, and restructure work. With over 30 years of experience in corporate restructuring, I bring a wealth of knowledge, expertise, and connections to this role, which I have held since July 2018.

My mission is to create impactful opportunities for the nearly 10,000 members of TMA's 58 chapters across the world, by providing them with networking, education, and certification resources. I also foster a culture of diversity, inclusion, and empowerment among our members, who represent various professions and backgrounds in the turnaround and corporate renewal space. Our Certified Turnaround Professional (CTP) program is the gold standard in the industry, and our Network of Women (NOW) and NextGen leaders are strong and inspiring.

Before joining TMA, I co-founded and co-led Esquify, Inc., a legal tech startup that developed an AI-driven platform for legal document review, which was acquired by a leading provider of legal services. I am passionate about leveraging technology and innovation to enhance efficiency, quality, and transparency in the legal sector. I also have a background in public service, having started my career with the U.S. Department of Justice. I am honored to give back to the professional community that has supported me throughout my journey.

name: Dan Mallin
title: Certified EOS Implementer® | Facilitator | Teacher | Coach - Helping people get what they want from their business | AI Expert | Business Consultant and CEO-Founder of Capacity's Answer Engine®(Lucy.ai) & MNCup.org
about:
As a serial entrepreneur, Board Member, Founder & CEO of Lucy, Founder of the Minnesota Cup, and Certified EOS Implementor, Dan specializes in driving business growth through AI innovation and strategic leadership. I have successfully founded and exited five technology companies, earning six U.S. patents in AI along the way. My passion lies in empowering fellow entrepreneurs to achieve their vision using the Entrepreneurial Operating System (EOS), a framework that has helped me and my clients transform their businesses. Dan is passionate about helping entrepreneurs and small business owners increase and maximize their growth while spending less time drowning in the day to day operations. Are you an entrepreneur who is interested in doing more of what you love, being fairly compensated while having the time for other passions? You can gain control and live your ideal life and Dan will help you get there! Let's connect if you're looking to maximize your company's value or need a speaker who can inspire and guide your leadership team.

Dan created Lucy, an AI-powered enterprise knowledge management SaaS software platform that transforms how the Fortune 1000 leverages their unstructured data.

Formerly the CEO & Founder of Magnet 360, Dan helped companies leverage marketing and technology to provide competitive differentiation and engagement for outcomes. Decades of experience amplify Dan’s character as a results-focused business leader, where outcomes matter more than the process or toolset. “Our clients expect results; we deliver.”

Founder of MNCup.org, the largest statewide business competition.
Board of Homes Center for Entrepreneurship, Carlson School of Management, University of Minnesota

Dan sits on multiple private company boards, bringing a differentiating viewpoint, helping evaluate opportunities, & facilitating governance as an agent of change. He has been recognized as the 2020 AACSB Influential Leader, Ernst & Young’s Entrepreneur of the Year, Business Journal’s 40 under 40, Twin Cities Business 200 People to Know, & the Minnesota Business’ Real Power 50. Dan has also served as a chief officer at multiple companies recognized as ‘best places to work’ in multiple markets nationally. The aggregate speaks to Dan as a practitioner, a visionary leader, an intuitive business person, and a mentor to many, a role in which he takes great pride.

about:
I left Intercom after taking them from $1M ARR to $150M+ as Head of Finance.

Immediately after that, I had the opportunity to join another startup as their first finance hire. It represented a clear path to earning more money while keeping a balanced lifestyle.

But I turned it down to start Equals and build the next generation spreadsheet.

Not only did taking “easy choice” feel like denying my full creative potential (I’m not just a finance guy, I love marketing, product, and branding too)...

…but it set a poor example for my two children, whom I prioritize over everything else.

Because it would teach them…

1. “Steady as she goes” always beats rocking the boat
2. Denying their ambitions and dreams is okay as long as they're paid off enough

But worst of all, it would teach them to always fear failure more than regret.

And I admit I feared failure more than I should’ve when Equals was just getting started.

For starters, most investors told us we’d never beat Google or Microsoft at the spreadsheet game.

And even after we’d found investors willing to bet on us, our initial go-to-market was rocky— 

Struggling to zero in on a viable ICP, cycling through marketing leads, and having to ditch the freemium SaaS “lean startup” playbook in the process.

But over the years, Equals has emerged as something wholly unique: the fastest, most flexible way to measure and report on your SaaS business by far.

Equals empowers SaaS to integrate data from Stripe, Salesforce, HubSpot, SQL, and more all in one single source of truth.

Because getting ARR from 0 to 97% is relatively simple.
But getting it from 97% to 100%? Incredibly hard.

And that’s exactly what Equals solves (thanks to Descript’s Head of Finance for that description).

We’ll even build your dashboard for you to prove it.

Ready to start?

Go here:

→ equals.com/arr-reporting/

Talk soon.

TUHIN JAMES PAUL
REAL WORLD EVIDENCE | HEOR | MARKET ACCESS | Patient Centric HTA Insights 

As a driven and Aspiring healthcare professional with a Learning foundation in Real World Evidence (RWE), Data Analysis, and Health Economic Outcome Research (HEOR), I bring a unique blend of analytical prowess and practical insights. I am committed to leveraging my skills to drive meaningful outcomes in HEOR, Clinical Analytics and delivering insights that not only shape healthcare policy but also elevate patient care standards.

name: Martin Kessler
title: Shape Co-Founder | Transforming How We See, Understand & Nurture Our Bodies
about:
With ShapeScale we've been on a quest to revolutionize the wellness industry with cutting-edge 3D body scanning technology. Our flagship product, ShapeScale, empowers individuals and businesses alike to visualize, track, and achieve their wellness goals like never before.

ShapeScale's photorealistic 3D body scans and AI-driven insights are transforming how people measure progress, stay motivated, and make informed health decisions. Today, ShapeScale is in use with hundreds of businesses across North America, from gyms and med spas to longevity clinics.

With a background in consumer product management, growth marketing, and data science, I thrive on bringing innovative solutions to market and driving sustainable growth. I'm passionate about leveraging technology to help people lead healthier, happier lives.

Beyond my work at ShapeScale, I used to host the 20 Minute Fitness Podcast, sharing insights and interviews to make wellness accessible and actionable for all.

🚀 Go-to-market strategy & product launches

💼 Strategic partnerships & business development
🏋️‍♀️ Fitness tech & wellness innovation
🎙️ Podcast hosting & content creation
🌿 Certified Sports Nutrition Coach

When I'm not working, you'll find me dadding, running, cycling, strength training, and exploring the great outdoors with my family. Let's connect and explore how we can shape a healthier future together!

name: Ian Jaffrey
title: Co-founder / CEO @ Skipp
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Motivated to work on big, difficult problems. The U.S. home renovation market is over 400B and with 80% of the housing stock over 20 years old it's growing steadily. Despite the massive size, renovations largely remain a highly antiquated process. 

My co-founders and I created Skipp to change this. We believe the planning process of renovating your home should be like building and customizing a car online. Not through a generic model or a clunky configurator, but with capabilities to see the possibilities of how your exact space can be transformed to your needs with complete confidence.  In just a few days, Skipp can provide the full suite of professional renderings, plans, costs, contractor bids and architect grade plans. With the hard stuff taken care of homeowners can focus on the fun parts. 

With shifting demographics and the convergence of groundbreaking tech, the time for modern renovation processes has arrived. We're creating the easy button. 

Lots more underway! We're also hiring! 

ian@skipp.co

name: Eric Boutin
title: Founder, CEO, Healthcare Investor | Digital Health, Longevity
about:
Eric Boutin is a founder, CEO, healthcare investor, and board member — helping early-stage startups to global pharma companies reimagine healthcare through science and technology.

Eric helps founders launch, fund, and scale companies through Harvard Street Advising. He was a Venture Chair at Redesign Health, a digital health venture studio, where he created and financed startup companies. Before that, he was a Managing Director at dRx Capital, Novartis’ digital health venture capital fund, where he led early-stage investments in pharma tech, patient care, and healthcare AI.

Prior to dRx, Eric was Founder and CEO of Evolve, an AI-powered consumer tech company, which was acquired by HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS). He was Founder and CEO of Good Start Genetics, a reproductive health and genomics company, which was acquired by Invitae (NYSE: NVTA). name: Bob Goldberg
title: Retired CEO, National Association of REALTORS®️
about:
As the former CEO of the National Association of REALTORS® (NAR), I was proud to lead this highly reputable and diverse organization with 350 plus staff members and annual revenues in excess of $200M. 


The total asset base I oversaw  was well over $500M which included  our wholly owned subsidiaries ( President, Second Century Ventures, Reach Accelerator Program, President,  Center for Specialized Real Estate Education, President and CEO,Realtors Information Network, Chairman, Sentrilock and President, Realtors Property Resource). 

NAR  is the largest trade Association in the world. 
 
Having served NAR for nearly 30 years, I was well aware of the trends, challenges and opportunities the real estate industry and NAR faced. 
 
Experience has taught me that active listening, transparent governance and strong interpersonal skills are vital to improving the lines of communication between members and the executive team. 

I achieved this goal using social media, speaking engagements, conventions, and trade shows to listen and respond to member’s suggestions and feedback. 
 
A quote that resonates with me is, “Talk is cheap when your words are of no value.” Below are examples of valuable, cutting edge initiatives that I directed as CEO. 

* Acquired and founded two top-level domains (TLD) – .realtor and .realestate that strengthened NAR and REALTORS® brands currently valued at ~$5B.

* Drove $240M+ in revenues to NAR and subsidiaries.

* Orchestrated efforts to generate non-dues revenue initiatives with partnerships, sponsors, and vendors. 

(1) Right Tools, Right Now program provided nearly one million free products to 300,000+ members with savings of more than $53M.

(2) REALTOR Benefits® Program, a member/partner benefits program, saved members ~$57M.
 
By respecting and meeting the needs and goals of diverse constituents, I envisioned a unified culture that fosters openness, innovation, and profitability.
 
In the end,  it was my honor and pleasure to serve our phenomenal staff and members!

name: Liz Parrish
title: CEO of BioViva USA Inc
about:
Elizabeth (Liz) Parrish, MBA, is the Founder and CEO of BioViva Sciences USA Inc., a biotechnology company dedicated to extending healthy human lifespans through gene therapy. BioViva specializes in combinatorial gene therapies, leveraging its proprietary CMV gene therapy delivery platform to advance cutting-edge treatments.

A distinguished entrepreneur, author, and innovator, Liz is a leading advocate for the Best Choice Medicine (BCM) plan, a regulatory framework designed to streamline and accelerate the approval of genetic therapies. She is actively engaged in international educational outreach and has spoken at prestigious conferences worldwide, including WIRED, TEDx, and other high-profile forums.

Liz has been published in multiple books, including contributing an academic chapter to Springer, further solidifying her role as a thought leader in the field. She views cellular aging as a disease and believes that advancements in space research will not only contribute to healthier and longer lifespans but also enhance the safety of space travel and drive breakthroughs in curative medicine, particularly for patients under the age of 20.

name: Jason Williams
title: Content Development Executive Assistant at Clínica Dr. Durántez / CryptoPlaza Longevity Ambassador/ Founder, Owner & Editor Infolongevity.com
about:
My first years (1984-2000) took place in the Venezuelan Oil Industry, mainly in the storage, distribution and sale of liquid fuels, performing technical, managerial and executive positions.. The following 15, already in Spain, mostly in the areas of real estate development and promotion, and the PV solar energy.

In June 2016, a group of Venezuelan investors hired me as the General Director of a technological startup, designed to create an innovative real estate portal, using ultimate generation programming languages (Angular JS, HTML5/JS/CSS3), and deploying deep learning and machine learning algorithms. 

The latter opened my mind to a previously less known field of knowledge and aroused in me an enormous curiosity to delve into the applications that such technological advances might have in other areas.

In December of that same year, under an agreed deal, I left the company that owns the portal, to enter the Artificial Intelligence (AI) applications related world. Among other things, I learned about the advent of the technological singularity, term coined by the futurist Ray Kurzweil, co-founder of Singularity University. On this, I focus on advances in science and technology for the prevention and treatment of diseases linked to aging (neurodegenerative, cardiovascular, cancer, etc), and ultimately, the curing of aging itself, eventually allowing for a considerable increase in the healthy life expectancy and lifespan of the human race. 

I follow closely and practice networking with scientists and other world leaders who are committed to these ideas and are working on them. Among others, in alphabetical order: Aubrey De Grey, Bill Andrews, Bill Faloon, David Sinclair, George Church, Jason Williams, Joao Pedro de Magalhaes, Juan Carlos Izpisúa, Liz Parrish and María Blasco.

name: Micah Brown
title: NAI VC | Aspiring Attorney | Financial + Product Engineer
about:
Micah Brown, an Executive Graduate of Columbia University and Uxbridge College, is a pioneering technologist, investor, and aspiring attorney with a distinguished career at the intersection of AI, Neurotech, and financial engineering. Currently, Micah is a key leader at Cingularity, A Kandupay company, Straea Ventures and Velkaris, a drone defense technology company. He is also an incoming Juris Doctor/MBA candidate, focusing on neuroscience-driven public policy and privacy rights.

Micah’s career is marked by historic achievements. He previously served as the CEO of Centiment Capital, a private equity fund based in New York City, which focused on people of color and was acquired and went public in 2022. Prior to that, he led five other tech startups, including BrainRap, An Abbey Road-endorsed AI Pioneer (Acquired in 2023), Centiment, one of the first popularised AI-driven Sentiment Startups within the Advertising Industry (Acquired in 2019), and Filmfundr, one of the first AI-driven film technologies (acquired in 2018).

Micah is recognized for pioneering Neurosentiment, introducing the concept as early as 2014, and commissioning the first neuroscience AI study conducted by a British person of color in partnership with Kansas University Medical Center. This breakthrough secured investment from Sprint, marking a significant milestone in American history. In 2019, Micah and his team at the MIT Media Lab won the People's Choice award. In 2021, Micah’s company, BrainRap, was admitted to the prestigious Abbey Road Red Program, making him the first Black British Founder, Founder of African and Caribbean descent, and Uxbridge College alumnus to achieve this honor in Abbey Road's 150-year history and the history of the United Kingdom.

His career includes senior-level roles in technology and management at Aon, AB InBev, NBC, and Barclays, amassing 19 years of experience across industries. Notably, his work has contributed significantly to currently used media technology while working with Viacom and NBC.

Raised in Catford, South London, Micah's journey was shaped by resilience and determination, earning a Higher Diploma in Bioinformatics and Neuroscience from Uxbridge College in 2009 before relocating to the U.S. in 2013. He has consistently championed diversity in tech, leading the USTEC and CCNY Codes initiatives that helped 300 young people of color secure roles at tech giants like Amazon, Facebook, and Google—a historic achievement for the institution.

As the CEO of ROCK Robotic, I’ve dedicated my career to creating innovative LiDAR mapping solutions, navigation algorithms, and 3D computer vision technology. I see a world where businesses are not just consumers of AI but active participants in how AI evolves, paving the way for a future where agentic AI is accessible, impactful, and aligned with our goals.

I’m committed to shaping this future by developing the next generation of data-driven solutions and ensuring that businesses across industries have the technology to thrive. Let’s build the future of data, agentic AI, and a world where you have a say in how AI works.

I have been working with the Douglass Township Police Department since November 2011. Before starting my career in law enforcement, I graduated from the Allentown Police Academy in 2011 after obtaining an Associates Degree in Criminal Justice from Montgomery County Community College in 2009.

Throughout my career, I have gained a diverse set of skills related to law enforcement and have had the opportunity to collaborate with some exceptional people. I have learned a great deal over the years and am excited to broaden my horizons. I recently completed my Bachelor's degree from Strayer University and a Master's degree in Criminal Justice from Walden University in early 2024.

I am open to networking and sharing my knowledge, education, training, and experiences as a police officer with others. I also hope to gain insights from other professionals to further advance my career and personal development. 

I am thrilled to announce that I founded "Aerial Insights, LLC" in January 2024, which is a drone-based company providing a range of services to clients, such as aerial photography, videography, aerial thermal imaging, inspection assistance, 2D/3D modeling & mapping, and more.

Although my heart and soul lie in police work, I aim to grow my network, enhance my experience, and connect with more amazing people from the community I have sworn to protect and serve.

I’m a founder, producer, and community builder working at the intersection of immersive tech and immersive theater.

We’ve shipped to 6+ XR headsets, sold 50k+ copies, and earned $1.7M in revenue. My focus is on turning experimental, creative tech into products that people love and pay for.

We went from tiny site-specific shows to our own venue in four years, hosted 200+ audience festivals, produced sold-out immersive plays, and created a home for weird, honest, physical theater.

My background spans startups, education, nonprofit leadership, and cultural entrepreneurship. I like building things that feel impossible until they aren’t.

Nik Bhattacharya is a seasoned software architect and tech leader at Google. He has deep specialization on the Android platform, NLP and developing innovative user experiences.

name: Nisha Talagala
title: Co-Founder and CEO of AIClub and AIClubPro - Driving AI Literacy
about:
I am the CEO of AIClub - driving AI Literacy for people of all ages. I am also the co-author of  Fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence - the first AI textbook for Middle School and High School students. Check out our work at https://corp.aiclub.world. You can also find the book on Amazon here https://www.amazon.com/Fundamentals-Artificial-Intelligence-Introduction/dp/B09QF5SFHQ/ref=sr_1_1?crid=9HVPRDI4WS7Y&keywords=ai+fundamentals&qid=1683142735&sprefix=AI+fund%2Caps%2C185&sr=8-1


Previously, I co-founded ParallelM and defined MLOps (Production Machine Learning and Deep Learning).  MLOps is the full lifecycle management of Machine Learning (and its variants Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning etc.) in production. I co-created the first industry/academic conference for MLOps - USENIX OpML (Operational ML) in 2019, and am the co-chair for OpML 2020.  I write for online publications including Forbes, and am a TEDx speaker.

My background is in distributed software, systems and applications.  Prior to PM, I was Lead Architect/Fellow at Fusion-io (acquired by SanDisk), developing new technologies and software stacks for persistent memory, Non-Volatile Memory File System (NVMFS)  and  application acceleration. Before Fusion-io, I was the technology lead for server flash at Intel - heading up server platform non volatile memory technology development and partnerships and foundational work on NVM Express. Before that, I was Chief Technology Officer at Gear6, where we built clustered computing caches for high performance I/O environments.  

I got my PhD at UC Berkeley doing research on clusters and distributed systems. I hold 73 patents in distributed systems, networking, storage, performance, key-value stores, persistent memory and memory hierarchy optimization. I enjoy speaking at industry and academic conferences and helping such forums by serving on Program and Organizing Committees. I also write contributed articles for various online forums. I am also currently serving on the steering committees of both USENIX OpML and USENIX HotStorage as well as the Technovation Steering Committee for the Americas. 

Specialties: 
Machine Learning
Deep Learning
MLOps - production ML and DL
Streaming Analytics
Model Management, ML Provenance and Governance
ML and AI diagnostics and performance
Systems Architecture
Distributed Systems
Persistent Memory

name: Phillip Walker
title: Senior Researcher at Smart Information Flow Technologies
about:
How do you find structure in chaos? How do you control and predict the changes in that structure? What can we learn from nature when building complex, distributed systems that humans can use and understand? I enjoy working on projects that seek answers to these questions. I want to make complex systems more intuitive and predictable for the people in charge of managing them, and I enjoy pulling influences from diverse fields of knowledge to do so.

In the past few years I have:
* Improved the resilience of computer networks using strategies employed by honeybees to defend their hives.
* Developed virtual reality interfaces to visualize and control hundreds of robots simultaneously.
* Debated the impact future fleets of delivery drones will have on everyday citizens going about their lives below them.

As we grow and become more connected, understanding how to control the chaos becomes more crucial than ever. I want to bring order to the chaos, and have a blast while doing it.

Interested in checking out my work? Here are some recent projects I've had the pleasure of working on:

Offensive Swarm-Enabled Tactics (OFFSET)
https://www.sift.net/research/human-performance-and-ux-innovations/offset
DARPA video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W34NPbGkLGI

Resilient Emergent Properties for Autonomous Agent InteRactions (REPAIR)
https://www.sift.net/research/artificial-intelligence/repair-0

Monitoring Emergent Duress Under Long-Lasting Allostasis (MEDULLA)
https://www.sift.net/research/computational-social-science/medulla

Of course, my entire life isn't chaos. I also enjoy building keyboards that look like they were made in the 1980's, cycling around my neighborhood to see things you'd miss from a car, and playing a game that's centuries old (it's chess, and after years of trying I'm still not that great at it--turns out it's pretty hard).
notable_achievements: All-time leader in wins, passing yards, passing touchdowns, completions, attempts, total yards, and total touchdowns at Temple University; Helped Temple to their first conference title in 49 years (2016)
reasoning: Phillip Walker demonstrates strong technical and research credentials with a PhD in Intelligent Systems and 8+ years of experience at SIFT working on advanced robotics and AI systems. His profile aligns with the L3 'Technical and Management Veterans' classification due to his deep technical expertise, research leadership, and work on complex technical projects. While he has impressive technical achievements, there's no clear evidence of startup exits, major company scaling, or significant entrepreneurial track record that would qualify for higher levels. His experience is primarily in research and technical development rather than company building.

After graduating from California State University Long Beach I have set out to explore all that I can within this industry. I strive to study products, materials, processes, forms, brands, trends and human factors. I find myself with a deep fascination of what people desire within products and obsess over even the smallest of details to achieve the surprise and awe from a consumer. There have been many options in this life but design is my vocation. The knowledge and skill set I have developed in my studies is utilized through my work, and constantly refined by more experienced designers, peer review, and personal reexamination.

I engage in consumer needs with design as my ammunition, fighting for a better tomorrow. I push to enhance my abilities in producing well thought out design with the aspiration to one day be a leader in the industry, designing products to make a difference.

title: CEO Publicis Sapient | Directoire+ Member (Executive Board), Publicis Groupe | Bestselling Author | Speaker | Investor | Board Member
about:
Nigel Vaz is the CEO of Publicis Sapient, the digital business transformation company, focused on helping companies to thrive in a world that is increasingly digital. With expertise spanning strategy, product, experience, engineering and data, Publicis Sapient helps businesses sustain relevance by adapting to change and capturing value through digital.

In more than two decades with the company, Nigel has acted as a strategic advisor on complex transformation initiatives with clients across geographies and a range of industries including financial services, automotive, retail, consumer products, and telecommunications, media & technology. 

Named by Consulting Magazine as a Top 25 Global Leader, Nigel advises some of the world’s largest businesses on their transformation initiatives. Publicis Sapient clients include Carrefour, Goldman Sachs, Marriott, McDonald’s, Nationwide, Nissan and Unilever. Prior to Sapient, he was a successful entrepreneur – co-founding a public company with interests in internet consulting and connectivity solutions.

In addition, Nigel is a member of the Directoire + of Publicis Groupe and is Global Lead of Digital Business Transformation for the communication, media, data and technology group.

An inductee of the BIMA Digital Hall of Fame, Nigel has also served as President of the IPA (Institute of Practitioners in Advertising) and board director of The Marketing Society.

He is a regular commentator in broadcast and print media including the BBC, Bloomberg, CNBC, CNN, the Financial Times and Wall Street Journal, and author of numerous articles on business transformation, technology, brand experience and culture. 

Nigel is author of the bestselling business title 'Digital Business Transformation – How Established Companies Sustain Competitive Advantage from Now to Next', based on years of partnering with clients to harness the power of digital.

name: Kevin Williams
title: Renewable Energy Solutions
about:
Kevin Williams is a serial entrepreneur. He founded several successful companies. WISE Power, Inc.  (WISE) is the latest brand that he developed. WISE a is a Deep Tech company that uses patented technology to transform the electric utility industry. WISE provides an intelligent energy storage solution with Internet of Things (IoT) capabilities to create a Distributed Energy Source System.

Our WISE technology uses intelligent energy storage that is scalable and interchangeable to power dwellings and electric vehicles. The universal cell technology creates portable WISE Power Packs that will generate power to extend the range of electric vehicles. This new technology is being deployed in kiosks around the U.S. and Canada.

In addition, our scalable systems can generate enough electricity to power entire communities. We have designed self contained systems that can be grid-tied, off-grid, and work with many types of renewable energy. 

Prior to starting Wise Power, Mr. Williams founded WillCo Technologies, Inc. in 2005. The firm’s mission was to make information easy and accessible. As an intelligent information technology (IT) consulting firm, WillCo specialized in creating simple solutions to complex issues. WillCo developed custom programs and software to enhance the communication, interaction, and integration among various computer systems. In 2006, the company created a cybersecurity compliance program and related software platform. This program is licensed to the US Department of Defense and now has more than 1.6 million registered users.

Prior to starting WillCo, Williams served as the Programs Development Manager for Space And Naval Warfare Systems (SPAWAR) Info Tech training in Honolulu, HI. He then worked as Senior Program Manager - Information Assurance Training Group for Anteon Corporation (now General Dynamics IT) and was tasked with managing a Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA) compliance program.
education_1_degree: Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.), Business, Management, Marketing, and Related Support Services
notable_achievements: CFO & Treasurer of Jack Henry & Associates Inc; Ownership of significant shares in Jack Henry & Associates Inc
reasoning: Kevin Williams demonstrates characteristics of a Proven Operator (L4) based on multiple factors: 1) He successfully founded WillCo Technologies which developed a cybersecurity compliance program licensed to the US DoD with 1.6M+ users, indicating significant scale. 2) His prior senior roles at SPAWAR and Anteon Corporation (now part of General Dynamics) show executive-level experience in the federal technology sector. 3) While his current venture WISE Power shows promise in the energy sector, there's insufficient public data about its scale or funding to justify a higher classification. The DoD contract and 1.6M user base suggests successful execution at scale, but without clear exit values or funding data, we cannot classify at L5 or above.

name: Brittany Williams
title: Principal at WISE Power, Inc. Where the Internet of Things Meets Energy Storage
about:
10 years of professional experience at the executive level in companies my family has owned. The WillCo group included my company WillCo Promotions which produced and promoted large scale entertainment events such as concerts, comedy shows, large scale festivals and celebrity hosted events. I've had the pleasure of working with many celebrities in the entertainment industry.

I've served as a principal with WillCo Development, which rehabbed and sold real estate in the greater Kansas City area.  

We began the start up WillCo Technologies in 2006. Our full service information technology company focused on cyber security and system integration with over 1.6 million registered users with the US Department of Defense. We sold WillCo Technologies last September to focus all of our time and efforts on the new start-up Wise Power, Inc.

WISE Distributed Energy is an Internet of Things (IoT) energy storage company that empowers electricity consumers to save money, reduce waste, and control their energy usage with our patented technology. WISE technology works by allowing home owners, building owners, facility managers, and anyone who manages a building’s power supply to store energy from the grid or renewables to use later as needed. In addition, WISE technology integrates smart devices through a vendor- neutral hub to facilitate home automation as well as building management through smart HVAC, electrical, and solar plus storage solutions.

name: Dr Olusola Ayoola
title: Founder, Robotics and Artificial Intelligence Nigeria
about:
Dr. Olusola Sayeed AYOOLA is the Founder and CEO of Robotics and Artificial Intelligence Nigeria (RAIN), a leading organisation in artificial intelligence and robotics talent and product development across Africa. With a strong academic background in AI, robotics, and engineering, Dr. Ayoola is a visionary leader committed to leveraging cutting-edge technologies to solve critical challenges in sectors like healthcare, national security, education, and sustainability.

He has spearheaded multiple groundbreaking projects, including AI-based solutions such as a Passenger Scream Detection System for Public Buses, Exoskeletons for Upper Limb Dysfunction Rehabilitation, and Carbon Emission Tracker Drones for environmental surveillance. 

His work extends to smart devices aimed at improving healthcare outcomes, like the Smart Arm Gyroscopic System for patients with Erb’s palsy and a Smart Drug Dispenser for dementia patients.
Under his leadership, RAIN is also expanding its training programs across Africa, fostering the next generation of AI and robotics experts. Dr. Ayoola's passion for education and knowledge-sharing is evident through his numerous keynote speeches and workshops, including at the prestigious ICARS 2023 Conference in Abu Dhabi, UAE, and his involvement with the Nigerian Society of Engineers, where he has inspired young engineers to explore career opportunities in AI and the Internet of Things (IoT).

Dr. Ayoola’s contributions extend beyond RAIN's projects; he is an advocate for developing sustainable technologies to address Africa’s unique challenges. His leadership has earned him recognition as a thought leader in the African tech ecosystem, making him a sought-after speaker and collaborator in global technology and innovation forums.
